description:
Wow! Incredible food at a great price. This is my first time at Gordo's, very impressed by the food. Fresh and delicious like it was made at home!

This spot has a nice well kept interior, very homey. Simple to understand menu, no price gouging.

Staff is friendly, explained a few things to me. Honestly really impressed by Gordo's. Great value for college students like myself.

I would definitely come here if you enjoy great Mexican food.
author: David B.

description:
Holy hell who knew you could get a bomb salad at gordo?! I've always thought gordo was mediocre at best but it's all we got out here so it gets the job done. But the taco salad I just had was fantastic. Tons of delicious ingredients, the poblano dressing was amazing and it's the perfect lighter option if you don't want a burrito. 

Get the salad, people!
author: Taylor B.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE. Just spent $30 on a taco that was half decent, a steak quesadilla that DID NOT HAVE A SHRED OF CHEESE, and a super all meat steak burrito that came with some carnitas that tasted days old and watered down.

This place is a joke, how could you screw an order up so bad? No cheese in a quesadilla? Are you kidding me? Wrong meat in a burrito? All of this for the sweet price of 30 bucks. Ya right. Never coming back. Go to one of the other excellent options in the area.

DON'T WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ON THIS PLACE!
author: Blake P.

description:
This place is lame now. So sad. I grew up eating gordos. You order A regular size burrito and you get a tiny kid's size. Meat is skimped as well. They are trying to make it like a chipotle with all the new bowls they are adding to the menu. 

New ownership is definitely taking advantage of the new SF Richmond district crowd. Higher prices, smaller sizes.
author: Monica R.

description:
After a long day of disc golf and beers in the park, Gordo Taqueria is just what I needed. 

This place is small, like it only seats seven, so more than likely just order it to go. I got the grilled chicken burrito with rice, beans, guacamole and house hot sauce. This gut bomb was amazing; the chicken was tender and full of flavor and the rice was the perfect addition to soak up all of those burrito juices. 

This burrito was huge which is good, but was also pricey. It was just over eleven dollars with tax, but worth it since it filled me up for a good five hours.
author: Nate M.

description: In looking for a restaurant to cater an event over the weekend I came across Gordo Taqueria. With less than 24hrs Luis, the restaurant manager had sent me photos of trays and follow-up with prices. A day later I was there picking up food for 80. Everything we ordered was delicious, they neatly packed everything and even helped me to the car. Extremely satisfied and great service from Luis and their staff. Thank you!!
author: Carina L.

description:
The place got more expensive over the year, but it's still a quick fix for my burrito crave. After traveling for a while, I am home sick for a little of San Francisco local food. The place comes to my mind because it's a childhood restaurant for me when I studied at Washington High school. There are multiple locations of this shop, but I see them mostly in outer Richmond. 

The super burrito has a gigantic amount of rice, beans, salsa, meat and cheese. I like to add sour cream and Guacamole, but they do come in as an extra charge. The tortilla is freshly steamed before making into the burrito. It's dense enough to keep the burrito from leaking sauces. The taste is fairly light, and that wrap up a very good balance of flavor from the beans, rice, and meat. There are usually a long line for lunch, but the chefs are very quick and skill to make the dishes. I recommend taking the bus here or walk if you live local.
author: Vincent Manjin L.

description:
I'm glad to report that the problems outlined in my review below have largely been fixed.  A few of the original staff are back and they seem to have spread their professional magic to the newer people. I don't even see the burrito maker with the questionable attitude working there anymore.  

The burritos are back to slightly above mediocre, but that's good enough for me when I'm in a rush. 
As cautionary advice, I'll remember my first review every time the big holidays roll around each year. I still go to Gordo's when my options are limited, and I probably won't bother during those holidays.
author: Jackson B.

description: Holy crap. Rudest staff I've ever encountered. Female wrapping burritos was full of nasty glares and "really? You want extra tomatoes?" style attitude throughout the entire ordering process. She even finished it off by slamming the burrito on the counter. The whole vibe of this place is nasty. Male staff are constantly glaring at the 14 year old girls that walk in. They used to be the only option in the Richmond for years, but the Richmond has grown. We no longer have to tolerate Gordo's.
author: Jamie S.

description: Last two experiences were very solid and maybe Gordos is back on track with a consistent product!
author: Alan S.

description: Looked for a quick place to manufacture a delicious gut bomb for cheap. Well, it was quick, it was delicious, but it wasn't cheap. I didn't expect a place called Gordos to ask $10 for a burrito. It was tasty though ‍. Although they weren't particularly friendly, I didn't encounter any of the bad attitude mentioned in other reviews.
author: Matt S.

description: I have been a customer there for almost 10 years and the food has been mediocre, but today was really cold and windy and they had a door open so it was REALLY drafty in there!  I have a 2 year old who gets febrile seizures so we first closed the door then this guy opened it, then we closed it again, then he goes to open it and we asked if we can please keep it closed he barked at us saying it gets foggy in there... I suggested they have management do something about their ventilation and we left. Never coming back there again! Rude!
author: Tony L.

description:
It's blah. I mean, it has all the components. But it isn't the mission. In Tahoe, (no not even Tahoe) in Oregon I'd be stoked for one of these. But I've been to mission street. I know what a burrito is supposed to taste like b

"Yo B. They killed killer B." I think of this movie every time I do that.

And a super burrito is supposed to come with all these things for which you charge extra. Why even call it super!? Meh. But they've been around more than half my life. So I'll go there. But I won't be thinking about THEIR burrito while I'm eating it.
author: Brett R.

description:
These carnitas tacos and bowl were sexy! Fresh, flavorful, and big portions.  The price is right and the sauce is SPECIAL.  Go.  Now. 

This was a recommendation we took from word of mouth and I'm so glad we did.
author: Meagan M.

description: Their burrito wrapping skills are not as great any more. It's not wrapped tight. Loosely wrapped so all the rice and sauce started coming out of the foil and onto my clothes. Disappointed.
author: Christi S.

description:
"Do you ever walk into a restaurant, and immediately feel full? That's Gordo" - my girlfriend.

Gordo is a standard S.F style taqueria. Cleanliness is questionable, portions are huge and food is good. This particular location is slower than molasses and I've had to wait twenty minutes in a 5 person line to get a burrito that takes literally 30 seconds to make. It's downright kafka-esque. 

The food is very caloric, and hits a certain "I want to feel stuffed" craving very well. 

Heads up, their guac is literally purée'd avocado with minimal flavor. Not worth paying extra. Food usually sits out for hours and it's hit or miss depending on who assembles your food.
author: Ben S.

description:
I'll preface this by saying my family of 5 has been going to Gordo's for about 25 years now and I've been going my whole life. Amongst my whole family it's safe to say that we've ordered probably a thousand burritos from Gordo's at its various locations in the last two decades.
 
 One of the great things about Gordo's that we loved was the consistency, the relatively short time to get a burrito, the price, and the location. The only thing that is the same convenience for us is the location. I'll go into detail below.
 
 I don't know why the old burrito makers left, but they've been replaced by a newer, younger worker. This hasn't done them any favors. The consistency of a Gordo's burrito is no longer there, whether it be a ripped tortilla, too much rice and beans and not enough meat, I no longer know what to expect when I open up the the tin foil of a Gordo's burrito I've opened up hundreds of times before.
 
 Another thing I've noticed in the last few months is the fact that they only use one of the two available counters to make burritos. I'm not sure if this is because they do not want to pay for second burrito maker, but it has cost them in long lines that often reach the door of the restaurant. Now fortunately you can order online at this location which I do and I recommend anyone who wants a burrito in a timely matter to do so as well.
 
Now this probably goes without saying as it's becoming increasingly pricier to live in San Francisco, but they've recently upped the price on a super burritos from about $7 to $10. If my family of five once they each get a burrito for dinner, I've gone from paying $35 to $50. For what you get it's just not worth it for me anymore. It's very unfortunate but it is what it is and I'm happy for others who are able to afford their new prices.
 
 So the location obviously is the same, and that is now my thing about the Taqueria. Living in Pacific Heights, it's much easier to get to get to the Richmond then it is to find a spot somewhere to park in the mission. If someone has any suggestions for a new Taqueria whether it's near me or near Gordo's, please let me know.
author: Patrick M.

description: Seriously Gordos is so great! Their tortillas are so yummy and chips are a bit greasy but that makes them so much better than your other places tortilla chips. I love to eat here, and my only negative thing to say is I get a pretty simple order when I'm here and the price is always different for the same meal. Anyways....their ingredients are so tasty!
author: Hoku L.

description:
I've been going to Gordo for over 20 years, frequently or even daily at times.

I think this Gordo used to be better. I'm talking 10 years ago though. Lately the meat is not the quality it used to be. I still find it acceptable, but I often find myself ordering the meatless burrito with Guacamole after numerous disappointments in the past few years. This can also vary by location, I mostly go to the Geary and 19th and Clement and 24th location. This review is specifically for the Geary and 19th location however.

First of all the burrito. If you like burritos, you'll probably like this place, especially the guacamole which, most of the time is fresh and tasty. All of the food uses a very high amount of salt in my opinion. The green hot sause is pretty good too if you are into that, but not very spicy (just a little). I'm not going to go into all the food connoisseurs language about how the meat was succulent or the tomatoes were ripe with flavor and had a nice refreshing finish, but overall its good if not great, at the expense of the high sodium factor. I tremendously enjoy the burritos here most of the time (95% or more of the time).

This particular location has a restroom as well as a handful of tables. If you choose to sit here to eat, there is usually a place to sit without having to wait, and is a comfortable place to have a chat with some friends afterwards for a few minutes without feeling pressured to leave due to it being crowded.

During peak times, there is a line, but usually no longer than 15 minutes at the very worst as they have 2 burrito making stations here. You can watch them make the burrito as you customize it to your liking. They will ask you in this order - #1 your order, which they will then prepare by either steaming or otherwise preparing your tortilla(s). After a short pause, they always fill the burrito in this order - beans, rice, meat choice, tomatoes, extras which cost money (guac, sour cream, jalapeños (free), etc.). They also often have an optional "red" hot sauce, but if you don't specify, they will give you "green" which I think is better anyway.

Guacamole is a must unless you absolutely cannot stand it. Its also under $1 unlike Chipotle which is $2 or much more.

Now one more thing...

I also have an experience with the douchebag working the register. Granted, this is only one of their staff and other cashiers have been ...average or passable and I don't expect anything amazing from an affordable burrito joint.

First of all, this place has a history of charging meat burrito prices for their bean and cheese (meatless) super burritos, so look out and be sure to question them if the charge doesn't seem right. I'm sure many of you won't lose any sleep over a 50 cents to a dollar higher charge per super burrito, but its about the principle. If the price being charged doesn't reflect the charge on their big wooden overhead menu, I think you should say something about it. ESPECIALLY because of the douchebag at the cashier I encountered at least twice about this same issue A FULL YEAR APART.

Makes up some bull poop about it being because of the tax. Regardless of what my math level is, I'll tell you I can use a calculator which is on every smartphone ever and quickly compared the cashier charge to what should be charged based on the big wooden menu. Douchbag cashier REFUSES to double check and insists its tax related, then I challenge him to press the buttons for a bean and cheese and immediately notice the first charge for the burrito itself is too high. I usually get bean and cheese with guacamole, so that is 2 buttons - 1 for the burrito, and 1 for the "extra" guac. He says the machine just charges that amount and is basically being a gigantic prick about it.

Now I'm not going to go bankrupt over a dollar or less difference, but its about the principle, and the reaction to my challenge. LEARN SOME BLEEPING CUSTOMER SERVICE you entitled piece of poop! If you just got off your high horse and walked over to the menu, then pressed the button on the cashier, you could CLEARLY see the charge was wrong.

He begrudgingly gives me a dollar back from the tip jar and makes a remark that "you probably need it". Was that really necessary? I was only rude to him because he was rude to me first. Also, that was TIP that someone else left FOR THE STAFF, WHY ARE YOU GIVING THAT BACK TO ME, A CUSTOMR

Luckily this place is a low cost place and so many people don't expect any service, and burritos are good if you avoid the meat (some people find the meat good even). For this reason, and mostly overlooking the douchebag casher, I give this place a more than fair 3 stars. But they really should correct that overcharge for meatless burritos. I just hate to thinK how many people they have overcharged over the years because just recently I think its happening again at a nearby location on Clement (yet to be confirmed)...sigh. Thankfully not all Gordo locations are staffed with douchebag cashiers.
author: Ken S.

description: BOMB dot COM ! on the go - quick authentic burritos! It's not fancy, super quick with limited seating. Good luck with parking! Your typical bay parking
author: Ashley M.

description: Gordo taqueria is a nice place for a quick bite or a huge superburrito if you feel like it. It's conveniently located in the busy intersection, there's always a line, but it seems to move quickly. Their food is good, real Mexican food for solid 4. Their burritos sometimes don't hold together and are a little bit too moist. And the real minus is their restroom which is "out of order".
author: Oleg K.

description:
What's good? The quality of the meat (I got carnitas), and the prices aren't bad...IF you don't want anything extra.

What's not so good? What you get for the money. The burritos are smaller than most SF burritos, and about the only things on the regular ones are meat, rice, and beans...it makes for a very dry and plain experience, although all of the flavors in it are solid. 

They also don't even offer nachos, which is sort of my mainstay. And the service was inexplicably slow for 445PM on a weekday. 

So, would I rather have a $7 one-meal, pretty plain burrito? Or a $11, 3-meal, loaded set of nachos with scrumptious, perfectly-seasoned meats and plenty of toppings? I think that question answers itself.

It is not, at least, the worst burrito I've found in the city...that dishonor goes to Chino's in the Outer Richmond, which serves larger but amazingly-tasteless burritos.
author: Chris S.

description: Been going to gordos for a long time ever since high school decade(s) ago jk. It was always that place like, "man that's the type of food thatll hit the spot" place to damn it's either I grew up or the workers changed. BE ADVISED! Bring a tampon or pad when u come here. Not for yourself but for the cashier. I went in with my wife ordered 2 burritos and a side of rice and beans for my daughter. Didnt say anything to us when we got to the register but human nature taught me to look at the screen that showed the price. Handed my wallet for my wife so she can pay it since I was holding my shoeless daughter. Got the card back. Female cashier turned away....waited......I think the jeapordy song finished playing. "Can we have our receipt," "Did you wanted that!?" Head turns away...."Yeah we do." Not tryna get scammed for tips. But we got our receipt and left. No customer service no thanks. That's why I'm never tipping here. Bye Felicia!!!
author: Jordan S.

description: I've been coming here for some time now on and off,  and I must say this is the most stingy restaurant I've visited. The burritos are small everything is measured to have the least amounts as possible, even though the service us great the food portions are a joke. I paid $10 for a small burrito that had more beans than anyrhing. Would not go back again.
author: Jose N.

description: I've been coming to this place at least twice a month for the last 8 years but unfortunately I won't be back. It's a completely new crew and they're awful. The proportions are all off and they don't even bother to wrap the burritos. They just cover it in tin foil and leave you on your way to eat your four cups of sour cream. Bummer. This place used to be the best in the city.
author: Caitlin N.

description: I used to stop here every so often around dinner time for some takeout burritos. Sometimes the line is out the door, and the service can be slow. The last few times there have only been one or two guys working which means each order can take twice as long. The food is always decent, but after a rude encounter during my last visit I won't be coming back to this Gordo's location. The server asked which type of beans I wanted, and I could not hear him over the noise so I said chicken, thinking he was asking what meat I wanted. He then rudely asked me if I spoke English and asked about beans again.
author: Larissa S.

description: What is happening Gordo? I just ordered a burrito for delivery. I know you knew what I paid for since it was printed on the burrito wrapper. So why is there no sour cream in my burrito? Also, the green sauce goes into the burrito not on the side!  Since when is it a side piece? Please go back to normal and make your burritos like they're supposed to be. K, thanks.
author: Irina M.

description:
Carnitas Burrito Supreme ...

... that is all you need to know when you go there to eat! Don't waste your time reading the menu! Just asked for Carnitas Burrito, pick your favorite bean, and whatever it is you like to add, and maker sure .... here is the trick, so pay attention! .... make sure to ask them to put some of the crunchy carnitas in there for you too! You will not regret it!
author: Afshin A.

description: This place used to be my favorite place to get my burritos, but they recently changed their staff and now it just doesn't taste as good. They lost their consistency they had with their old employees and now they are constantly changing new people. I still come here for convenience, but the food is not as good.
author: Ryan Z.

description: Do not eat here.  It's gross, sloppy and inedible.  How do you screw up a quesadilla? Oh that's right, by not putting any cheese in it.  Carnitas - flavorless and not even crispy.  Honestly I didn't mind how they left items out of the order because I threw it all in the trash anyway.  Disgusting.
author: scott P.

description:
people say i'm so mexican my blood type is "tapatío". well i'm only part mexican. because the other half of my blood is called GO GIANTS.


and that's why every even-numbered year i go here for a burrito. super. all-meat. the funky green wrapper.
author: Dan B.

description:
I love Mexican food and I'm picky sometimes!
But Gordo is above average. I love it since it's near my house!
The portion is great and it's not too expensive!
author: Candice L.

description: I know Gordo's gets a bunch of flack for not being real Mexican food, but to me, it is in it's own category. Portion sizes are decent. It's quick. Their guacamole is pretty decent. It's a different kind of burrito then from a real taqueria. It's always a quick go to for me if I'm in the Richmond district or in any of the other areas where this is a Gordo's.
author: Julie L.

description:
Been to this place on 3 separate occasions and every time I think they could work on their carnet aside seasoning.. it's flavorless. 

The only reason it's a 3 star is because they have friendly enough service and it's quick.
author: E A.

description: Currently, this is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. The food is amazing and made very quickly and conveniently.
author: Beth S.

description: I've been coming here for years. Gordos was my favorite taqueria growing up. The prices were low, the meat and fillings were flavorful, and the portions were huge. I remember countless weekend mornings when I used to eat super Gordo burritos with my best friends in college. It was the perfect aid to our hangovers. We would run home because we were so excited. I also came here during my time in grad school to reward myself after a midterm or final exam. Lately, I feel as though the quality has gone a bit down hill and the prices, just the opposite. Today, I ordered a super steak burrito with everything. The price was around $10.50, a little more than I'm used to. For that price, I'm expecting a really juicy and delicious burrito. However, the steak tasted bland. The beans and rice tasted fresh, but lacked flavor. I couldn't distinguish the sour cream from the guacamole. I was pretty disappointed. Maybe there was new staff? I didn't recognize anyone there. When I review Gordos, I think it is fair to compare it to other nearby taquerias and restaurants. For $10.50, I would rather go to Taqueria Los Mayas or use that money to get some pho. The curry restaurant next door is also a great, delicious alternative. It will definitely be hard for me to go to Gordos anytime soon with all of the tasty options nearby. Gordos was 5 stars back in the day. Within the past 4 years, it lowered to a 3 or 3.5. I hope it will get back to that 5 star level. I will give it a few more tries. If it is consistently a 3, I will have to say farewell to Gordos.
author: Petunia M.

description:
What's up with the changes?!? I always get a simple quesadilla with rice & chicken and  it's the best! This time it was barely left on the griddle to get crispy & melt and barely any rice was added, which was flavorless and dry anyhow.
This is mainly a review for management and hope things get turned around.
author: Taylor T.

description: Service sucks, people are rude. You can definitely get wayyyyyyyyyyy better Mexican food than this place in the city.
author: Ada H.

description:
Jalapenos on the side? i asked for (2) on the side...ordered 2 plates and a quesedia. When I got home i only found (1) jalapeno on the side with...4 slices inside.

The food tastes good and seems relatively healthy/clean. However, doesnt make up for the lack of everything else such as pricing inconsistencies and the stuff they put in your order, which seems shady small at times.
author: HJ C.

description: Good local food place but sadly they just implemented online ordering. So if you're a walk in during busy times expect the wait to be double than what it used to be prior.
author: Mike P.

description: We were visiting from LA and we didn't know what would come close to the food from here so we found Gordo Taqueria and it was so good! I got a simple quesadilla which I loved because it wasn't greasy and everyone else got burritos. We were all satisfied and it was not expensive at all and the employees were kind! Definitely going back next time we're in SF.
author: Angie M.

description: The place itself  is a nice Mexican restaurant, Im a regular  customer,  the food is okay, but they recently closed their restroom for good - it's  "out of order" forever.
author: Siarhei F.

description:
Our go to in the outer Richmond!!

Me and my boys always have a great time here !

The food is solid and they treat me and my sons nice
author: Azikiwee A.

description:
The food is great, affordable to go food.  They were recently closed for remodeling, when they reopened it looked the same except for a fresh coat of paint on the walls.  I have been going to gordo's at this location since they opened the location in the late 90s.  The people who work here are nice and friendly.  

I took two stars off of my review because they ran out of black beans tonight and were running out of food at 8pm on a Saturday night when there is a music festival going on in golden gate park this weekend, they should have ordered double their normal food order rice, black beans and etc.  The price for a burrito had gone up to almost $10, they claim that it is the cost of living here in San Francisco.
author: Alix J.

description: Went here based on Yelp and a friend's recommendation. Something much have change. Greasy, tasteless, poorly wrapped burritos that immediately fell apart. Equally greasy quesadilla that we couldn't finish. Was looking forward to a good neighborhood shop.  This isn't it.
author: Jay D.

description:
Not sure I like this one as much as the one on Clement.  Although they have more space for seating, they are frustratingly slower,  also I a
Saw the guy break so many tortillas by overstuffing.

The guy saw that I saw my tortilla broken so he doubled wrapped mine.  I didn't
 see another guy  get the same treatment
author: Erik H.

description: I don't know why this place has bad reviews ! It's great for a burrito/ huge quesadilla craving . And I'm Hispanic ! Hispanic approved ha. They also let you call in orders for pick up which is great ! And give you huge things of guac and salsa if you order it on the side ! Great quick Mexican stop after the beach :)
author: Linda G.

description: Having Gordo's in the neighborhood or actually having moved back to the neighborhood after  8 years this spot was on the top of my list .. The flavors just mesh together so deliciously.. I prefer the grilled chicken on anything , a burrito, a quesadilla, even in a small cup with little rice and beans when you need a snack but don't want to eat a whole burrito , which I can hardly do..The guacamole  is wonderful and the prices fit every budget.. I did try the steak the other day and that was my only complaint..I think the guy was new not enough meat and lot's of grissell So back to my chicken.. It's Not the Mission but is it real delish!!! Never leave me Gordo's..
author: LeeAnn L.

description:
If a Gordo's burrito were a gesture, it would be a slowly unwound middle finger. To wit:

* Disinterested employees who have long since dispensed with trying to seem even remotely affable? Check. 

* Thrown together burritos with the classic "Single Sour-cream Splotch?" Check. 

* Guacamole of a shade of green you've never seen before? Check. 

* Inspecting every bite for the knuckle hair that you are  sure is in there somewhere? Check. 

* Lackluster flavor, pricing and size? Checkity check check. 

Seriously folks, unless you are literally in some sort of Saw-esque type situation in which you must eat one of these burritos to save a loved one or a favorite appendage, do yourself a flavor and head to the mission. Your tummy will thank you.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I actually prefer the Gordos on Clement Street, but this location has the all meat burrito! And I love variety! Typically the roommate gets the Carnitas super burrito with refried beans while I get All meat super burrito.

Service here is inconsistent. Sometimes I get someone that's super helpful and accommodating, while other times, I get someone who seems to be grudgingly making my burrito. I normally get no beans, no rice and no sour cream, so at times I get a weird look for ordering a super burrito. But it's my burrito! I can do what I want!

One time, I ordered the all meat burrito and was told that meant I get all of one meat and nothing else on the burrito. Why does it cost more than a normal burrito then?! I tried correcting him and telling him that meant I get all the meats avail, but there are no descriptions on the menu, so it was a he said, she said kind of situation. Instead of arguing, I just said okay since there was a line behind me. So apparently, I paid more for an all meat burrito cuz it had more meat and nothing else. It didn't make sense, but whatever, I had no choice but to let it go.

When I can get an actual all meat burrito, I enjoy their offerings. Otherwise, I'll swing by the Clement Street location instead.
author: Elena N.

description: Always get the Gordo plate, extra rice in place of beans with grilled chicken. Plus the chips and spicy salsa. My go to lunch 2x a week. Quick easy and cheap.
author: Iaintworried B.

description:
The worst burrito I've had in 15 years in San Francisco.

Come to Gordo if you want a cold, soggy burrito featuring two ***slices*** of "cheese," swampy beans, watery tomato salsa, clumps of bland rice and "guacamole" the color of store brand mint chocolate chip ice cream, slopped together by a worker who doesn't seem to care at all.
author: Sam S.

description:
Most frustrating quesadilla I've ever eaten. 

It was not even wrapped tightly at all so when I got home and tried to bite it it fell apart and basically I had to use a fork to eat carne asada and sour cream mush. 

I think this place is just convenient but not really good quality because the quesadilla was not flavorful at all. 

I'll stick to El Farolito and Pancho Villa from now on.
author: Amanda R.

description:
A friend brought me here because we were both craving good Mexican food. But she said the thing to get is the carnitas. She was so right on!!!  Asked the man behind the counter in Spanish if I could try a little spoonful. Wow so tender and delicious. Melts in your mouth!

My friend got the burrito but since I'm low carbing, I decided to just get a container of carnitas and some guacamole. I now have to go at least once a week it's that good! 

I hope to try the burritos or tacos at some point because everything looks delicious.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Just ordered delivery burrito from this place and it is probably the worst In the city. My quesadilla had no cheese in it, but was filled with rice and shitty pinto beans. Why the F are there rice and beans in my quesadilla and no cheese? Maybe it was my burrito? Oh no, my super burrito was the exact same thing....just rice and beans. And the other order was incorrect. The most disappointing food order EVER!
author: Kristin G.

description: Really good Mexican food made to order. I love their super burritos, and their carnitas are awesome. If you're looking for good Mexican made fast come here!!
author: Katie G.

description: This place has always been a local staple for late night bites for me.  The food is always super good, reasonably priced, and service line moves quick.
author: Steven H.

description:
The burritos are decent taste-wise and size-wise. The service can be a bit better though. Came here last evening at 5:45pm with a line out the door. Didn't get to actually order til about 6pm...you would think that with a line out the door, they'd have an extra person helping make the burritos but no. 

Cashier guy stood there taking people's money. Another dude just kept wiping the same spot on their fanning system above the stove for about 10-15 min. Burrito maker guy doesn't talk and doesn't make eye contact. He will give you whatever he feels like giving you unless you speak up. I don't even want to go into that right now.

Got my burritos and left. Thankfully it was good so I'm not too irritated. There was also a guy who came in right before I did. I thought he acted very suspicious but came to find that he was mentally challenged. It was entertaining watching him talk to literally everyone in front of him, all the while cutting them in line. I'm glad no one got pissed at him and just let him through.

Next time though, I think I'll head over to the Clement one. I paid $18 for 2 super burritos, no drinks and nothing extra.
author: V M.

description:
Gordo Management - we got poisoned yesterday from your burritos that we bought at 6pm. We got 5 burritos, beef/chicken. 3 out of 5 people in my family got poisoned and had bad stomach ache all evening and night. Both beef and chicken burritos had something bad in them - so it wasn't the meat, probably either Salsa, Sour Cream or Guacamole was bad!

I love Gordo and this is the first time i got poisoned there in 15 years that i've been going to this place.

Please - make sure that your ingredients are fresh and clean. I love this place and will be back, but if you poison me once again, i will not comeback.
author: Serge U.

description: Ordered a chicken burrito with a spinach tortilla, chips, and no rice. Instead, I got a flour tortilla, no chips, and rice. If they can't get an order that simple correct, I won't be back.
author: Christopher M.

description:
Ok, I'm from San Diego, and i know my Mexican food partly because i am one, not food, unless you travel in a certain circle in which case please don't follow me, anyways. ... really deliciously made carnitas in what they call a quesadilla prepared like a goddammed burrito! 
God bless you, even though I'm atheist, seriously shit is DELISH YO!!!!
author: Tommy L.

description: Huge fan.  I've been going here for the past 15 years, this is always a stop.  I love there boiled chicken, and their burritos are consistently moist and flavorful and their quesadilla are scrumptious.  Sometimes there's a bit of a wait (10 minutes max), but at those prices its well worth it.  I've ever had a bad burrito from this place. Definitely get the hot sauce if you're not sure. It isn't that hot, but it adds a lot of flavor.
author: Howard G.

description:
A neighborhood staple. Decent burritos at reasonable prices. Quick and casual. One of our go-to places. 

If they were a bit cleaner and had a few more interesting items on the menu, and perhaps some good beers, they'd be a five star in my book.
author: Al S.

description:
Gordo's was always one of my favorites when I lived in the city 4 years ago.  Chose to stop by while visiting for the weekend and of course did not regret it!  Ordered a regular carne asada burrito with guac and sour cream and my gf got the same but with carnitas.  It was her first time here and she loved it!  The regular burritos are a good size, but I regretted not getting the supreme for a dollar more. 

The taste is great!  I prefer black beans, but im sure they all taste good.  Guac and sour cream cost a little extra but adds great flavor to your burrito.  

Gf loved it so much that she insisted on going back the next day!  Next time I'll be sure to get the supreme.  We will be back, GORDOS!

Biggest downfall of this place.......parking -_-.  Spent 30 minutes just trying to find a stall on Saturday night and Sunday midday.
author: Bryce W.

description:
My tummy was rumbling, Jeremy P was about to curl up and die on the sidewalk. Brew Fest, too much Tequila, and a serious lack of sleep were getting the best of us. We needed a burrito, STAT. 

As we made our way to Blarney Stone to watch a meaningless preseason loss, we stopped off in Gordo's to replenish ourselves. I've had Gordo's plenty of times, and am always moderately satisfied with it. I tried to Chili Verde Super Burrito yesterday (around $7.50) and had the same feeling as I've always had about Gordo's: it's mediocre, but edible. 

No hot suace on the tables, or really anywhere. Their green housemade "hot sauce" is very mild and lacks flavor, kind of like the Chili Verde. My mom used to make this dish before her vegan days, and hers was always amazing: spicy, tender, made-by-mom-goodness in each bite. I would give my mom's Chili Verde 5 Stars, hands down. But Gordo's, methinks not. But it was filling, and cheap, and sustained me for the rest of the afternoon. The guys who work there either hate me, or hate their job, or a mix of the two. Gordo's is what I expect Mexican food to taste like from the Richmond. Nuff said.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Totally worth the wait in line. Everything is DELISH! 
-They have a spinach tortilla choice 
-They melt the cheese on tortilla before filling it.
-Salsas both green and red gave a great kick to them. 
-Great prices 

We will for sure be return customers.
author: Monique F.

description: Horrible experience for the last time!!! These assholes have been rude, and/ or internationally overcharged me for the last time!!! I've caught them pulling this bs at least 3 times now... I get a super burrito with bean and cheese no meat. Came out to OVER 9$ this time because of guac and sour cream. This always comes with the super burrito and is the difference between the reg and super. I complained but they had their thumbs up their asses and had no idea what i was talking about. This has happened several other times when i catch them they say oooh oh yea "sorry about that" look at their coworker like well i tried and reverse it. (keep in mind I'm always out if my way nice to them, i always ask how they are doing, and thank them an unnecessary amout of times (and they are still incredibly rude to me))... Today there were some new people working who were actually pretty nice. There was a very nice woman working (it was her 2ed day) so i didn't want to make a scene but i was noticeably upset and asked about the charge. She asked them and they agreed with the charge. I'm tired of being screwed out of 2 extra dollars unless i point out that they overcharged me.... Also the food is very meh. If it was a good burrito I'd be ok with paying 9$ but this is shitty fast food.
author: Joshua H.

description:
I just don't love gordo's. The price is good but the food isn't my favorite. I don't really like the rice they use, and the cheese isn't visible where the display of food is so I forgot to include it!! I also didn't think the quality of meat was amazing.

It's easy and fast so if you are looking for that, then go for it. But I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Jenna G.

description: Probably my least favorite taqueria I've been too. Soggiest steak burrito I've ever eaten. The steak didn't have much flavor and they didn't even have red salsa, only green and the pico de gallo kind. The way the guy put together my burrito and the food before me was so haphazardly that it kind of gave me anxiety. It was 20 minutes before close and I waited in a long line,only to find out as I was paying that they didn't have chips left. It wasn't the worst but I'll probably never come back here.
author: Fab E.

description: Gordo has really gone downhill since I left the neighborhood. I used to walk from my home on 10th Avenue all the way to Gordo Taqueria because the burritos were that good. I came here on Wednesday and regretfully ordered an asada burrito. The burrito just fell apart as soon as I opened it. They didn't have spicy salsa and their hot sauce selection is non existent. The guys who make your food now are rude and act like they're doing you a favor.
author: Darius A.

description: Gordo's is one of my favorite spots to grab a burrito! They are always consistent with their food and the price isn't expensive! They also have jalapeños for free if you like your burrito with a kick like I do. They also have a plate option which I like to order sometimes and it comes with a few tortillas so you can make your own taco!
author: Gordon K.

description: They don't have avocados. How do you have guacamole if you don't have avocados? Where is this guacamole coming from? Suspect! As a Mexican and a Californian  I find this to be a deal breaker.
author: Scarlett C.

description:
Gordos is an abomination. 

Totally flavorless. Everything tastes boring and bland. 

Sometimes the paper wrapping gets folded into your taco, but you don't notice because it tastes the same.

Solidly mediocre. I've eaten here maybe half a dozen times, and I'm always disappointed in myself for returning. But it is the only place for tacos in the Richmond and it's just so convenient! Low blood sugar makes bad decisions.

I think they charge for each additional ingredient beyond the filling listed on the menu. My two tacos came out to $8. They're supposed to be $2 and change each. Once you see your sad rice tacos, garnished with a few strings of carnitas and some limp, soggy pico, you can't fight the urge to hide them beneath guacamole and sour cream. Good up-sell tactic, Gordos.

Positives: while not good, the food is edible, and and you can wash them down with Jarritos. And the kitchen staff is entertainingly rude.
author: Kelly T.

description: This location is as good as any other Gordo's, and usually not too difficult to park.  Sometimes there are lines at very random times, but they usually do an efficient job of adding another person for food prep, and things generally move along well.  As with all Gordo's- my call is the carnitas.  All of their offerings are good or better, but carnitas if the 'most exceptional' from my perspective.  I'll be back frequently.
author: Andy S.

description:
Decent burrito place. The regular all meat burrito cost me 7.34.
No salsa bar but you can ask for extra sauce. I prefer the red sauce over the green sauce. The cool thing bout the all meat burrito is that they put all the meats into one burrito...so that includes carne asada, chicken, cartnitas, and chile verde.

I would recommend getting the quesadilla. It comes out like a burrito since its stuffed with so much stuff, but the tortilla comes out flaky/crunchy since its also fried instead of jus heated.

Overall its nuthin too special but its good and quick.
author: Frank L.

description:
for some reason this is not as good as the one on clement and 24th ave.

Do not know why? They are merely blocks from each other.

Stick to the one on clement!
author: David G.

description: Ive only tried their carnitas tacos and rice here. Overall its good for a quick fix, the tacos are a good portion. I ordered them with sour cream, beans, salsa, and hot sauce. The carnitas is pretty good and seasoned well. The rice is bland and taste like its lacking alot of things. Service isn't bad. I just wish they wore gloves, the older man used his bare hand to scrape the extra meat that fell off when making it and put it on top off my taco..
author: Alyssa C.

description: Came in and there was no line. Couldn't decided what to order so we stood there deciding, but no one even asked us if we were ready yet after like 3 minutes. Stood there waiting for about 5 more minutes, already decided on what we wanted to order and then finally someone came over to help us. He was a bit rude and spoke super quick and was hard to understand with his accent and over the loud grill in the background. Ordered the Super Burrito and a Regular Burrito. If you're hungry, get the super burrito as it is quite large. But if you're not too hungry and don't have the appetite for the super Burrito, but still want the cheese (as that's the only difference besides the size) get the regular Burrito and add cheese for only 65 cents. A little overpriced, but a decent Burrito not in the Mission district.
author: Courtney D.

description: Huge fan. I've been going here for the past 15 years, and even though I don't live in the area anymore, when I visit, this is always a stop. I love there boiled chicken, and their burritos are consistently moist and flavorful. I don't understand the complaints about the service; I've never had a reason to complain. I don't think I've ever had a bad burrito from this place. Definitely get the hot sauce if you're not sure. It isn't that hot, but it adds a lot of flavor.
author: Michael K.

description:
I had never been to a gordo before last night. The line looked long but it moved along quickly. I ordered a super carnitas burrito. They loaded it up. It was big cheap and flavorful. 

The location is far from me but if I'm in the area I'm definitely going to stop here again. Friendly staff also. Did I say its cheap??
author: Marty J.

description:
Shared a carne asada super burrito with the BF on the drive home from SF and it was yummy. The rice was cooked perfectly and the sour cream made everything super creamy and delicious. My BF ate most of the meat parts of the burrito but from what little I did have it was good. 

Can't say much about the service cuz my BF ordered but IDK why you would complain when you're paying $4 for a burrito
author: Ingrid L.

description: My go-to in the neighborhood since I can walk here from my apt. I had originally gone to the one back home in the east bay in Berkeley so it was comforting to see one so close to me. I always get a super carne asada burrito with everything, extra salsa, and a side of chips and guac. Their guac is incredible. Works every time.
author: Thielson D.

description:
FACT: THEIR BURRITOS SUCK!

Out of all burritos I've tasted (approximately over 1,000 burritos nationwide) this place is the worst. Far worse than a microwaveable burrito since you would expect a microwaveable burrito to taste like gargoyle balls. But this place, your expectations are completely shattered by how much you pay and how much cardboard-like their food tastes. 

If I made a burrito, which I suck at cooking, their burrito would STILL taste like cockroach piss compared to mine.  

I can't stop saying how much this place sucks. If this place can still have customers, then time for me to start my own burrito place!
author: Mike D.

description: I literally eat here almost every week... not very healthy but sooo delicious....their green salsa is what makes this gordo better than the one on clement imo. Hits the spot everytime :)
author: Kasey O.

description:
The super burritos here are just terrible and lazy, especially for nearly $10. The meats are so-so, they dump the beans on with lots of liquid, and the entire thing is consistently sloppy and bland. I really want to like it because it'd be great to have at least a mediocre burrito in the neighborhood.

La Espiga de Oro on 24th St. And Taqueria San Bruno are consistently the best so I'll have to make the trip and stick with those.
author: Patrick C.

description: The burritos are worse than average. Cheep, sloppy ingredients. Lazily thrown together. Only go here when I have NO other quick calorie options in the neighborhood. Close your eyes and swallow
author: Mark K.

description:
So I did the mental math and looked at my yearly budget and have come to realize that I spend a solid $1500 a year on Gordo Super Burritos. Why? Because bar none, these are the best burritos in San Francisco. Screw what anyone says, forget, La Taqueria - this place is the best bar none.

As an added bonus, only local SF-types even know this place exists. Take a date here and she'll act like you played her a Rolling Stones record for the first time.
author: Steven B.

description:
Constancy A
Parking always a nightmare C (doesn't effect star rating)

Here's the deal,  I like this place I do it's cheap it's fast and there are a few locations around SF. That being said 
cleanliness D
customer service C-
the food is consistent which is great. Maybe it's me I don't know but when I SEE you handling my already cooked food with what appears to be dirty hands I instantly want to vomit. I know that all chefs touch our food. I've worked in many kitchens. Maybe it's the dirty hand towels left on the cutting board maybe it's the sweat. All I can think about is dirty fingers on my food. Is it just me? I kinda want the work space to at least look clean! 

Will I go back ......yes. Do I do a little ritual asking my ancestors to keep me safe and not let me get E.Coli yes times infinity..
author: Nena L.

description:
Amazing for people who have only had Taco Bell.

Above average for people who like Chipotle.

Ok for people who like roach coaches.
author: Sam W.

description: So, I heard this place had some good food and stopped by to check it out. There were so many flies in the dining area I just walked out without even approaching to order or look at the menu. Won't be coming back to this place. That was super gross.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Have gone here for year. 

Always liked the food and the friendly service until today. 

When I went to pay the guy at the register, have not seen before, pointed at a paper sign taped to the register that said Cash Only. I asked when did that change happened he just pointed at the sign and said cash only with a scowl like he was mad. 

One of the other guys said it is just today. The machine is not working. The guy at the register just kept scowling at me. I ask him why didn't you say that. He just kept with the attitude. 

I did not have any cash and also I don't need to support bad customer service. 

No longer going to this shop.
author: Peter W.

description: Eh, really not a great place. Nothing particularly noteworthy about Gordo, except that it isn't very authentic, and there's usually a decent line there. Not many Mexican food options in the neighborhood, but I would go elsewhere if you're craving a burrito.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
We have been in the Richmond District for 4 decades. We started at the Gordo's on Clement and then switched to the one on Geary after it opened as it is closer.

Over the years the quality-quantity-price was just fine.  What the hell happened yesterday!

My wife stopped in to buy to regular burritos. The size dropped to something as small as a small hot dog from a cheep vender cart! Then when she went to pay they wanted $18 for the two burritos. She was very tired after working all day on keeping people alive in the ICU of a local hospital and with the long line she did not want to make a stink so she paid it and left.

The burritos were watery, small, had almost no meat in them, and generally were sub-par for Gordo's.  If you need to charge more then by all means do so, but don't fall into the trap of making things smaller and charging more.  We go here because it is always the same and that is what we expect.  

Get your act together or loose two customers who have been loyal for 4 decades!
author: James D.

description:
Okay food, borderline service, no atmospherics. My backup plan when all other Mexican restaurants are closed. 

I have eaten at their other locations too and all are about the same.
author: E F.

description:
If you didn't know, Gordo means fat in Spanish.  

This place is thebest mexican in SF.  I've been coming here for over 10 years and they have definitely begun to recognize me.  The chicken plate, the tacos and the burritos are some of the best.  The authentic and friendly staff make this place one of my favorites.
author: Kaylee A.

description:
Gordo, Gordo, Gordo... One of my oldest and best friends. I've been eating at this establishment my entire life. What can I say? It's basically the definition of comfort food for me. There are multiple Gordo restaurants around SF and Berkeley - I have been to all, I have never been disappointed. This is traditional Mexican food at it's finest. 

As a Gordo veteran I feel obligated to let you all in on a few secrets - ask for both sauces - red and green, get the jalapeños, try the refried beans, and for god sakes, mix meats! Otherwise, you can never go wrong with a carnitas super burrito in a spinach tortilla...
author: Philip B.

description:
It's good for what it is, a quick burrito. I would rather come here than chipotle any day as it's a better value and decent tasting I guess. I'm not saying it's the best burrito, you can find way better spots in the mission but this is practically all there is in the Richmond. 

The burrito is ok but my only gripe with it is, why is the guacamole so thin and almost like a spread?  It's like they liquified the avocado or it's a powdered avocado mix. 

Customer service is lacking terribly. No greetings or acknowledgement of your presence until you're in front of their face ordering. They barely listen to what you want in your order, just assume and put stuff until you tell them otherwise. They have conversations amongst themselves while you're ordering and even when you're paying. I don't care that much, just give me my food and I'm fine but damn, if I'm not rude to you and have manners enough to say please and thanks, don't treat me like I'm an inconvenience to you providing you with business.  I never have that kind of issue at other taquerias, just this one.
author: Hiroki M.

description:
Stopped by and got the carnitas quesadilla with guacamole. YUM.

Parking sucked and the spot was busy!
author: Roger A.

description:
food is ok at best, but i think these guys make a lot of "mistakes" on the bill. other reviewers have the same complaint on yelp. 

i see them ringing up people before they get their food. the receipts are not itemized. interesting right? then i saw them ringing me up and i saw $.10 charge being included. i did not ask for a plastic bag and they are charging me for it. of course, its not on the receipt.  simple math confirm. other times ive been here i got the wrong change. i gave a $20 bill, i got change back for a $10... i got correct change back after i asked, but the cashier did not apologize and acted like it was not an issue...

ive been here on and off 15+ years. service keeps going down and these guys dont look like they give a eff. plenty of better places around, INCLUDING the other GORDOS 3-4 blocks away from this location.
author: Jason C.

description:
I use to like this place a lot. Went there last night and to my surprise did not enjoy it. 

The food for starters was off, doesn't have the same taste as before. It lacked flavor. Also they only offer one type of hot sauce which was bland. 

Also the service was not nice. Everyone working there seemed depressed, quiet and apathetic. Not one smile, or a thank you for coming or how are you. I having experience in the restaurant industry can tell you that saying those things makes a huge difference. The cashier was kinda rude too.

But overall, the food was poor, not what it use to be. It's probably missing something.
author: Serge C.

description:
I love the carnitas quesadilla, but if you're hungry, go for a burrito.
Great, friendly staff!
author: Evan W.

description: Had the carnitas quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream. Overall pretty good and filling, just dont think it matches up to anywhere in the mission or even Papolotes. Would come back and try other options.
author: Josue V.

description: A must go to spot in San Francisco! No need to over spend on food at fishermans wharf or downtown. Just take the 38L and boom! You're here! 100% delicious!
author: Javi P.

description: Gordo Taqueria on Geary blvd between 18 and 19th avenue comes through for me every time. Today, tonight they ran out of tortilla chips and made more... Brought a bag of warm chips to each one of us grubbing on our meals. Very nice of them! Bought my fourth of guacamole to go with them. Beautiful classic Mexican music played in the background tonite and not loud. As usual my chile verde regular burrito made with a spinach tortilla, no sour cream but black beans, white cheese, rice, tomato mixture, guac, lots of jalapeños and picante sauce, and of course chile verde which is made with the other white meat was delicious and warmed me up. Got to watch news and Jeopardy as well! My tummy thanks you guys for my yummy burritos, always.
author: Artemis R.

description: Gordo's is just a convenient go to for me if I want a burrito that is not from Taco Bell and I can't go out to the Mission for one. I always get the chile verde with spicy salsa, sour cream and jalapenos added inside. I would say that the one on Clement St does not run out of the chile verde as often as the one on Geary.
author: Yvonne T.

description:
I like this little cheap and simple taqueria when I want to grab a burrito in the Richmond District. You have your options of burritos, super burritos, quesadillas, and combination plates. The prices are reasonable and you can see them making the food right behind the counter. I like when I can see the meat that I'm choosing to eat.

Grilled chicken burrito- juicy chicken and a good mix of all the ingredients (beans, rice, guac, salsa, sour cream, hot sauce)

It's not the most amazing mexican food I've ever eaten (and I'll never find another burrito place like the one in my home town) but for the price and speed that I get my food I can't complain. The employees could be a little more friendly and have a smile one their face but I always order to go so it doesn't bother me that much. There is a small sitting area with tables you can eat at but I only see 1 person eating at the table each time I go inside.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I only go for a Carnitas plate.  Customer service runs the gambit depending on when you go.  If you can avoid the rush the insanity is not as bad.

Decor: 2
Food:4
Service: 2  

Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!  Slim pickings in this neighborhood
author: Kelson H.

description: I have been eating at gordos for 30+ years.  I have been to all of their locations, I was in line at the Geary street location behind three kids who ordered in Spanish with probably 12 people behind my self, I watched three of the biggest burritos come off their line  watched three or four scoops of beans and rice, delicious stacks of carnitas go on and all the goodness.    I ordered the exact same thing.  Except I barely got a half scoop of rice, a measurably tablespoon scoop of refrained beans, they were almost out and instead of having some ready the gave me that)  barely a noticeable amount of either guac or sour cream,  it was a horrible display of customer service and was probably the smallest "super" burrito, I have ever seen.    I have had tacos bigger than that!   And tried to charge me full price,  where are the standards between stores?????   Walked a few blocks to the clement location,  normal good size good carnitas super burrito!
author: Nathan K.

description: Not bad but not great. Sour cream and guacamole cost extra and not included in the super burrito which is minus. Burrito is made right in front of your like chipotle which I like because you can make sure it's made correctly. Place is super small so don't expect to be able to eat inside.
author: Matthew G.

description:
I have been a customer of Gordo's for several years now, and they have yet to disappoint me with the quality of their food. 

The pros:
--They have kept the good quality of their food consistent
--Good and quick service
--The restaurant is always clean and tidy
--Convenient since I'm only a few blocks away
--Nice selection of tortillas and good hot sauce

The cons:
--They have not changed much over the past 10 or so years--other taquerias in the city have added more things to their menu, or have offered a larger selection
--They charge extra for single ingredients in addition to the basic--c'mon now, lots of other places consolidate this little hassle into the much loved "super burrito"  for a smaller premium

Nonetheless, the food here is very good quality, and great for a quick and tasty meal
author: Victor R.

description:
Gordos is a burrito place like a "rebound booty call" after a long term relationship. Not really good, but its there, and it kinda does the job...and later you feel kinda gross.

Too bad mission is too far from the richmond district.
author: R S.

description:
I have been going to Gordo's for nearly 20 years...wow, putting that in print makes me feel a bit old all of a sudden. I was away from SF for about 13 of those years, but nothing has changed. Their super burritos are still the best burrito I have ever had. EVER.

I like their boiled chicken with guac and sour cream. My better half recently introduced me to the carnitas and refried beans, which is also fantastic.

Everyone who works here is very nice and extremely friendly. I have never met anyone who hasn't like Gordo's.

It should be noted that there are differences between the different Gordo locations and many feel that this Geary location is the best.
author: Ben B.

description:
I go here a LOT, but only because it's close, fast, and convenient.  Nothing special.  The super  burritos are quite large (like, as big as my forearm), but most of the other items on the menu seem like fairly poor value given the number of other (better) burrito places, taco trucks, etc, in this city.   I stop by once a week for lunch, but immediately turn away if there is a line, and find something else to eat.

Food here is 'fine,' not good, not terrible.  My favorite item for value/low cost is a bean and cheese burrito on corn tortilla.  The thing I order most consistently is a carnitas super burrito with a spinach/wheat tortilla.   Portions (particularly how much meat is included) really vary from day to day and by who is making your burrito.  There is a younger guy who always makes me HUGE burritos. Trying to fatten me up, are you? A couple of the older guys are pretty stingy with portions though.

The guys working here are nice, they seem to remember everything I've ordered in the past.  It's true that when their regular cashier (a woman) is not there, and one of the other guys is working the register, they tend to over charge you.
author: Heidi M.

description:
I'm going to say 5 stars for price, 4 stars for variety, and 4.5 stars for the counter people. I love Gordo's, though it's mainly because their burritos are, on average, $2-3 less than most places (at roughly $6 each), and because Gordo's itself is unassuming and relaxed. It's not some trendy chain with two tables and a huge line. I like that.

The chicken is good (not too spicy, but tender and chunky), the guac isn't spread too thin, and the end result is a big, fat, good burrito. It's totally solid food that anyone can appreciate.

Just remember, Gordo's is nothing fancy. It's a bare bones burrito establishment, and that's what most people like about it - myself included.
author: Jiordan C.

description: They make tasty, flavorful, inexpensive burritos, with great texture and a good and surprisingly light-feeling hot sauce. An easy walk down Geary too, in Outer Richmond.
author: Sharon G.

description: Not the best, but not the worst. We tried the burrito, tacos and an enchilada and all were okay but but up to the hype. I would recommend others on Geary!
author: Julia S.

description:
I would recommend the carnitas quesadilla or the carnitas super burrito.
-Carnitas quesadilla: You have the option of flour or corn tortilla.  I went with flour.  It comes with cheese, carnitas = very yummy, tomatoes/salsa.  I added guacamole for an extra $0.75.
-Carnitas super burrito: It comes with your choice of beans, rice, carnitas, salsa.  Extra cost for items such as guacamole, sour cream, cheese etc.
-Taco were just okay. Wish they had the hard shells instead of the corn tortillas. 
I would not recommend the chips and salsa because the "mild" salsa had no flavor.  It tasted just like chopped tomatoes...very plain
author: Roxana L.

description:
I only go to Gordo's because it's convenient. (I only live a couple blocks away).

The good:
Decent food.
Decent prices.
Spinach tortilla.

The bad:
No free chips/salsa.......sometimes. Wtf? Sometimes they just give them to me with no charge when I buy one burrito. Sometimes I grab four burritos and I get nothing.
Inconsistent pricing: I usually get the EXACT same thing... and get rung up a different price every time.
The service, or the lack thereof.
author: Munnie T.

description: Gordos is the most amazing fresh little taqueria wrapping up huge flavors in some super elastic steamed tortillas dripping wet with mexican love juice! Please do yourself a favor and get the carnitas super burrito, ask for extra yummy green sauce to heat things up, find a place to get drippy, sticky, gooie, then step out the door feeling real raguie... OOOOOEEEEIIII!
author: Dustin G.

description:
A pale imitation. Residents of and visitors to the Richmond district deserve better burritos than this. 

No salsa bar, either - you have to pay extra for chips and salsa! I never! Though I must say the chips and salsa were pretty good.

The burrito was a solid meh. Certainly edible, but nowhere near what you can get in the Mission.
author: Mike G.

description:
TACO BELL HAS BETTER FOOD THAN THIS DUMP!!!

Horrible service, rude staff, downright nasty food, and disgusting dining room. I live in the neighborhood and have tried to go here for years now, but every time I do I swear it will be the last. I went there yesterday, stood in line and waited for my turn, once I'm up I order 1 Carnitas taco, easy order right? You would think so, but the 3 clowns behind the counter (only 1 working) just throw a couple of tortillas on the grill, take the next persons order, then forget all about my order and just keep going. After a while one of them asks me what my order was, I repeat the 1 Carnitas taco, and they all start yelling at each other like it's someone else's fault. Wow, just wow. So then the one guy actually working asks me what I want on my taco, I say just refried beans, and he's like "What? Nothing else?", and I say no, so then he dumps a double heaping of refried beans like that's all that I'm going to have, and I say "You're going to add Carnitas right?", and he acts like I'm giving him a hard time, for real?

I don't know who the manager is at this dump, but Yo, you should be F'ing Fired!!! I can't believe how rude you losers are, you don't even pay attention to the customers' orders, screw them up constantly, and overcharge for things we don't order like Guacamole and Sour Cream, I don't know how many times I've ordered a regular taco and you charge me for the Supreme, I don't even like those and never order them you jerks!

And would it kill you to clean up the garbage off the tables for the next customers? All you do is stand around hiding behind the counter, 3 or 4 of you, but only 1 working, pathetic. The surface of everything is covered in grease and "Mystery Specks" of old food no one will ever bother cleaning. I can't believe your Health Score is even in the 80's, that's shocking! LOLZ!

I would give you negative stars if I could, you're a disgrace to Mexico and fine Mexican cuisine, I hope the Health Department shuts you down.
author: Grace S.

description: Cashier refused to take two steps to hand me salt when they ran out up front.  He told me, "If it's not out there we don't have it."  I'm like "It's salt.  Just put some in a ramekin and hand it to me."  Hes like "we don't have any."  I'm like you're running a full kitchen.  You have salt.  He refused and denied again.  "Everything we have is out there."  I say, "Are you refusing to give me salt, that you have, for my meal?"  He walks off with a huff, fills a ramekin in two seconds with enough salt to choke a horse.  Nice guy.
author: Seth C.

description:
Grew up going to this joint on a regular basis, so I'm first and foremost biased. 

Very well done, simple burritos. Meats are quality but not show-stopping, same for beans - friends say their refried beans aren't as good but I think they're fine. Super burritos are bigger than their regular counterparts and come with cheese steamed on the tortilla. They charge extra for sour cream and guacamole, but not outrageously so. 

Joint is usually empty. If there is a line it goes quickly. Decent amount of seating, no bigger than 2 seater tables though. This place gave me affordable, tasty burritos as a high schooler as well as a quiet environment to talk to friends, and even if I'm not hitting it up day to day I'm always thankful it's still there if I want to stop by.
author: Ian S.

description: Had it for the first time yesterday to try it out, got the super buritto with chicken, and I got a say I never had an upset stomach after eating anything before.  Will not go here again, noticed the workers handling food don't wear gloves so not sure how santized this place is but diff not my list to come again from first experience here.
author: Nawid A.

description:
Paraphrasing: "Dorothy, we're not in the Mission (or even the Sunset) anymore!"

So I found myself deep on Geary, wanting a burrito.  I'd heard good things over the years about Gordo's, so I thought I'd give it a go.

This is not what I expected at all.  The burritos were only about a dollar less than the ones I get in my neighborhood (the Excelsior, map it, it's in SF), but I guess that's the dollar pays for the flavor.

Sliced cheese? I'm not exactly sure that that was sour cream, though I know it sure wasn't crema.  And really? $1.65 for chips (that weren't homemade) and salsa (that tasted like watery tomatos?).

We had both a carnitas burrito and carne asada, that I couldn't tell the difference.

At least they had the birds in the restaurant like they do on 24th street.

I used to feel sorry for the people that lived out here because of the weather, now there's something else.
author: Michael M.

description:
You don't have to be a pretentious Mission hipster or an idiot like Brad K. says to be really, really unimpressed by this Gordo location. Gordo gets 2 stars because I'd eat there if pressed by circumstance but their food is far from A-OK. 

To start positive, I'll join the dissatisfied throngs that will vouch for the carnitas. That is some good pig!  But the beans and guacamole are not bad in that they are not like the Mission (my favorite taquerias aren't in the Mission anyway); they are bad in that they are a lot like Roseville.  

Wars about pretention, the Mission, and authenticity v. "You're an asshole" aside, everything but the carnitas just tastes boring--including the hot sauce. 

They might earn 3 stars if I only consider the food. But there was also some visible problems with food safety and hygiene. I'm not a germophobe, but please go through the effort of pretending my food is clean...for my apatite's benefit at least. 

And I also noticed some of the "unusual business practices" others wrote about. The "levels" of their burritos and tacos aren't explained on the menu. You don't know what regular is and what super is. So their game appears to be offering you things that aren't included without disclosing the extra charge at the time. 

And with this tactic your first visit will be way more expensive than the low prices on the menu board suggests, and NO ONE wants to haggle over a taco. That's not what tacos are for. 

Good carnitas though. I would come in to get some a la carte if I wanted to make enchiladas or something and I was already in the RIchmond.
author: Luke M.

description: We have eaten here a couple of times before when we have visited our family. The food has always been great. My concern is cleanliness this time. There was a rag on the counter, next to their cheese. The worker made my super burrito and then right after that took the dirty rag and cleaned the counter and then continued to make the next person's food without washing his hands. The rag was left on the food counter.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
Yum. When I went in on Sunday evening this place was packed. 

The guy making my burrito was funny. The service was fast and friendly.

Very Clean Environment. Nice mix of People. 

Minus one star for the really uncomfortable chairs.
author: Meghan L.

description: Best super burrito ever, carnitas is tender and juicy, the hot sauce has the best flavor and heat and the beans have been well cooked that they drip with gravy. I go back to SF every few years, and they haven't lost their touch.
author: Mickey L.

description: I am not even sure if my review will even count since Gordos is pretty much the most manufactured taco place in existence but here it goes. Usually I would get the spinach super burrito pretty hard to mess up but today I didn't feel like getting much so I tried getting two chicken tacos. The man making them was very lazy about making my taco. He loaded it with too much beans and all the juice literally saturated the entire taco. Instead of draining it off the guy just folded the parchment into the taco. I always believe a person should prepare food exactly how they would want to eat it. I only had four bites of my two tacos everything fell out the bottom. 6$ for four bites. I will not be back.
author: Brittany W.

description:
I stand by the Gordo chain both here in San Francisco and over in the East Bay.

But not this location.  NOT this location.  NEVER AGAIN, this location.

Steak should never taste like fish.
author: Michael D.

description:
The burrito, a regular bean & cheese, no meat, with guacamole, 3 stars in my book, it wasn't that warm, salsa was bland.

The service, food prep guy was fast and efficient.  Gave a good portion of guacamole.  The Cashier, he is the reason why I give one less star.  I did the calculations in my head before i got to the register:

Regular bean & cheese burrito is $4.05+$0.65 (Guacamole) + $0.40 (8.5% tax) = $5.10.  

The cashier rings me up $5.53.  I question him if that is right and he CONFIRMS that it is the charge for a regular bean and cheese burrito with guac.  I pays hesitantly and get a table to begin eating.  My friend who has gone to gordos for years does the calculations and finds that the cashier charged me for a meat burrito, which is $4.55.

We go back up to confront the cashier, who stubbornly argues that the reason why it is $5.53 is due to tax.  I also never knew San Francisco had a %17.65 percent tax on burritos, thank you for educating me Mr. Cashier!  

So my friend goes up and tells him to enter in the burrito again on the register, and the $4.55 flashes across his register, and we tell him that is wrong a Bean and Cheese burrito is $4.05 which is the price that is listed clearly on the board.  He states again it is due to tax but grudgingly gives me a dollar back.  

To make things worse, he gives me a snide remark saying how I need the dollar.  I will not come back to this store again. 

If you ever get a regular bean and cheese burrito, watch out, do the math your self and save yourself from getting RIPPED OFF.  To me, it's not about the $0.40 cents, I don't care, it's about the principle.  Stop ripping ppl off.
author: Ben S.

description: super burrito all meat.  cheap, fresh and fast.  NO COMPLAINTS...
author: Kevin L.

description:
Girl who grew up in the Avenues grew up with Gordo's.  

I remember it clearly.  Fifth grade.  My classmate Stevie Jo mentioned Gordo's being awesome.  She was one of my closest friends, so I was like heck yeah I wanna try this!  

So I came here one weekend with my dad and sister when I was 10 years old, ordered a chicken burrito, and liked it.  A lot.  I mean, it was a Mission burrito, and I was just a kid who didn't know the names or the hypes; I just knew I liked good food, and this was good.

And all the way till my college years, I believed that Gordo's was the best in the City.  

Then, I discovered the Mission.  And man, oh man, was THAT a discovery.  Y'all know what I'm talking about.  

And so, it was GOODBYE Gordo, HELLO El Farolito, and Taqueria Cancun, and everything else in between.  Plus, in your early 20s, what's not to like about the Mission?  It's where everyone wants to be, right?  Food, culture, Dolores Park, everything.  

So, I stayed in the Mission.  Kept eating those Mission burritos.  Lovin' those big, cheap rolls of delicious.  Who cares that it takes me about 45 minutes to get across town to the Mission.  Hella worth it.

And then tonight, I was walking past Gordo, revisiting old haunts.  It was around dinnertime, and I was hungry.  

I hadn't had a Gordo burrito in years.  Should I revisit a ghost of my burrito past?  Sure, why not?  Plus, I'd forgotten what they tasted like anyway.

There was a line forming, since it's that time of night, but I only waited about 5 minutes - not bad!  As I'm standing there in line, I check out the menu.  Hmmm....super burrito vs. normal burrito.  Well, I always order super burritos everywhere I go, but I always leave a bit at the end because those things are just so damn BIG.  Let's go with the normal size.  

Aite.  It's my turn, I order a regular burrito with chicken.  The guy takes the tortilla, slaps on a big piece of cheese, and warms it up.  Takes it out after a minute, and slaps on grilled chicken, salsa, beans.  I add cheese and guacamole for an extra dollar or so.  Pretty quick service.  

The base price is $4.25 for a regular burrito, but since I had some additional stuff, I pay $5.86 and walk outta there.  Open it immediately, take a few bites.  Take another few bites.  And another few bites.  

You can tell how this is gonna turn out.  ;)

I get home, finish off the rest while watching some baseball.  The burrito was expertly wrapped - no mess at the end or fork needed to pick up pieces that have fallen out.  I dig that.

And the verdict?

It was delicious.  

Well, Gordo, I just gotta say it's good to be back in the hood.  

Thanks for representing.  

I'll represent too. :)

*Minus one star because they charge for chips and because of the charges for the extra fillings which should come standard.
author: Vivian C.

description: Been going here since I was a kid--mainly because it's the only option in the Richmond for a burrito. When you're paying for your order, make sure you watch the register carefully. Last time I went, he charged me for sour cream & guac that I did not order (I quickly saw the little register mark the price of my burrito and then $.45 and $.65) From reading other reviews, it looks like I'm not the only person this has happened to. Will no longer be going here. If you want quality and honesty, go to the mission for that burrito instead.
author: Miya Y.

description:
The service was slow (only one guy taking orders, even though the other station was open and the line was almost to the door). They were also out of salsa for the chips, and the cashier didn't really seem to give a shit. The carnitas super burrito was good, but with all the other stuff + lack of parking, it's not really worth it.

One thing to note, there was an employee cleaning the kitchen and looked like he was doing a really thorough job. Loved seeing that.
author: eric c.
