description: This is a really simple place. Burritos, tacos, quesadillas. These are not the American kind- there are no veggies here. This is meat, rice, beans, cheese and salsa. You watch then make your dish in front of you from the ingredients you can select, $6 for a burrito. $2.75 for a taco. They taste good but very simple. Their credit card machine stops working sometimes so make sure you have cash. I suggest getting it to go bc the seating isn't the prettiest place to be. Good for a quick bite.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
I can't believe I waited in line almost 15 minutes for this mediocrity.  

Granted, being a vegetarian I'm all about the Super Vegetarian burrito wherever I go.  For many tacquerias its an afterthought, basically a regular burrito without the meat.  And that's fine.  But if you're going make a burrito with everything but the meat then those ingredients better be damn good.  Sadly at Gordo they are not.

The salsa (actually pico de gallo) was completely flavorless, made of underripe tomatoes and lazily cut giant chunks of onion.  The bland rice made up about 50% of the filling--as did everyone elses burrito I watched being made--indicating this place has an agenda to keep their costs down.   The beans were forgettable and there was inadequate cheese to hold the whole thing together.   Guacamole was so-so, but the sour cream was so thick it curdled into chunks quickly.  And no lettuce available?  Come on. Insult to injury, the roll up was badly done and the entire burrito fell apart after two bites.

I really feel that the only reason there is any line in this restaurant is because its the only tacqueria in the area, so they are popular by merely existing.  Sadly that doesn't cut it in this city.
author: SFnativeGal ..

description:
Ive always heard great things about this place, but i have to say tha I was disappointed. The taste wasnt great, service was not good, they barely undestand what we said, and when my boyfriend asked half of the beans they are used to put in the burrito, the guy put half of the burrito with rice and the other half with beans...that was terrible. 
So, try to be as CLEAR as you can, and if that doesnt work, speak spanish!
author: Danielle S.

description:
I always get the chicken burrito. It is so filling and I love it.

REALLY wish they sold carne asada fries though. My life would be complete.
author: Justine O.

description:
I got a chicken and a steak taco here. Though it seems like orders are really a loose suggestion here as the guy put whatever he felt like on it. The man making my food was rude and hard to understand (not a language barrier - he was just mumbling the whole time as the line grew behind me).

The salsa and everything else was pretty flavorless and bland. 

With so many tasty hole in the wall taco joints in SF, I'll pass on this one next time.
author: Christina K.

description: Bad news burrito! This is visit #2, after the first bland tasting experience I decided to pick up a quick lunch the other day. 2 hours after finishing carnitas burritos my boss and I are both bent over in pain. This continued until the next day. To say the least, don't risk it, they don't even taste that good and I would have paid double for a burrito without the bacteria!
author: Kyle S.

description:
The pendejos who work there must hate their jobs. They are straight up rude, slow and @holes.
Last time I went there, I ordered a beef burrito. The guy started making something, what it seemed to be a burrito, and added cheese on, but I never requested cheese, so I told him. The @hole acted like if I was dumb or something and said "have you ordered a quesadilla?" Well, no @hole, but you are attending me right now, so I assumed you were making my F-ing burrito.
After he was finally done with someone else's food, he asked me for the 10th time - I guess they are also deaf as well-, what I wanted. I replied "beef burrito with everything". 
The guy at the register is rude as well and doesn't even say a thing, just ring the food up and get my money.

Once I arrived home, my burrito was rice and beans ONLY. WTF???? Was that guy messing with me? I went back there, obviously pissed and requested a new burrito. I just threw the burrito on their trash can and the same guy who did my burrito told me I was supposed to tell him exactly what I wanted on my burrito. Well, pendejo, I told you before and I am telling you again, I want a F-ing BEEF BURRITO WITH EVERYTHING! Is it too hard to understand? Do you want me to draw for you? Should I make a diagram? Should I spell? WTF?!?!?!

They had the audacity to charge me the difference for the beef burrito.
They never apologized. They never threw in something extra, such as chips and salsa to make up for the inconvenience of making me going back there at night, on a cold and raining day (this is back in February).

Btw, their burrito is WEAK! Dude, I lived in SoCal, and I am telling you, burritos there, even in the weakest place is way better than Gordo's. Plus you ALWAYS ALWAYS get free chips and salsa. Those mfuckers need to learn something with the real Mexican taquerias in SoCal.


And yes, they do talk hell of crap about their customers. They are lucky they get any business, I wish S.F. was floating with Taquerias as it is in SoCal, they would go out of business real fast.
author: alice a.

description:
This place is really not that good. The prices are great, but the food isn't. My boyfriend and I ordered a cheese and chicken quesadilla, a super burrito with steak, and a bean and rice burrito. 

The bean and rice burrito and the chips and salsa were the only things that were okay and that we were able to finish. The meat and beans in the other burrito tasted weird and off, and something told me I should stop eating it. The chicken in the quesadilla also tasted weird and was very, very, very, dry. Not to mention there was a pound of chicken and no exaggeration one small slice of cheese on the quesadilla. 

The service was also atrocious. I felt rushed by the guy who was making the burrito and the restaurant was empty. The girl who cashed me out seemed annoyed that we had placed an order
author: Adrian S.

description: Little off today, I stopped by on my to get massage and ordered the regular plate but it was so small portion and messy. The place is a bit dirty too today. What happened Gordo???
author: Ty N.

description: I usually check to see who's working before going in since some of the workers really skimp.  Portions might not be consistent, but the flavoring is.  Make sure to ask for extra hot sauce on the side!  Makes everything taste even better!
author: Tina L.

description: Real good burritos. Don't be afraid of the line as it is most definitely worth the wait. Yes the wait times can get to the novice hunger affected burrito craving individual but every burrito master knows these burritos are on point!
author: William H.

description: Haha.. You guys wrap burritos all day and it falls apart when i start unwrapping the foil.   I ate my burrito with a folk and spoon. Wrapping a burrito is not rocket science.  Wrap it with like its for you.
author: E T.

description:
This place sucks........ Why u ask..... 
Cause they have the oldest person making the food... And he only takes one order at a time......while mr cool stands by the register and just stare while people line up........ 
I ask for two tacos... Not to hard....... Btw they was kinda gross....
Dude at da register didn't even break a smile....
Didn't even try to up sale.....
Didn't say thank you...... 
Man wha kind of customer services is this... Crappy....
author: jeannette L.

description:
These burritos suck. The only reason I would get them is because they are so cheap. But the super burrito is weak. 
Dudes are hella rude here too. Its a burrito shop so I shouldn't expect anything but it seems like they hate their jobs. 

Anyways, I barely got any carnitas in my burrito. Its 80% rice and beans. Half scoops of guac, sour cream and salsa. The burrito basically tasted like beans and rice and tortilla.

Spend a couple more dollars and go to any other burrito shop. This place is terrible.
author: Aron L.

description:
After eating my last burrito at Taqueria El Sol it was time for me once again to explore another burrito joint and so I did... I went over to Geary street and went to try Gordo Taqueria for the first time just to try their super burritos 


This place wasnt that bad at all and it was a little crowded in the begining during the lunch time hour at Gordo Taqueria ... When, I got inside I didnt have to worry that much because the line went really fast after when I ate up the entire steak burrito... Gordo Taqueria for me makes the super burritos really good!!!
author: William B.

description: Fast service, you choose what they add, not the best burrito I've had but it is up there in my top 5. Enjoy.
author: Samuel M.

description:
Service sucks and if the service sucks the food don't taste right.  
The Clement location is better!
author: Sherrell D.

description:
Gordo's is my favorite burrito place in the city. I've eaten at all of their locations (Clement, 9th Ave., Berkeley), and have always gotten great service and tasty burritos.

The menu is simple, with speedy counter service. I like being able to watch them make my burrito (it makes sure that no offending onions or cilantro sneak their way in). Also, when ordering at the counter it's apparent that the staff cares a lot about cleanliness, always wiping down counters and cleaning the grill.

There are a few tables to eat at around the restaurant (with the same funky, woven-seats with no backs they've had since before I was born), but I prefer to get my burrito to go and eat in Golden Gate park or at the beach. Make sure you grab enough napkins!

For the last 15+ years I've ordered the Carnitas Super Burrito, always with cheese, whole pinto beans, rice, and sour cream. The carnitas is moist and flavorful, and I love the simplicity of these burritos. The quesadillas are a big hit, too. And the sodas are really cheap.
author: Umilia M.

description:
Good lord, why did I subject myself to this place?! I knew what to expect but I guess I must've been pretty damn hungry and impatient yesterday.

It doesn't help that there aren't too many viable eating options for a quick lunch in the area.

Still, this place is "meh" on its very best day. No option for refried beans? WTF? No legitimate taqueria eschews the refried beans. The ingredients are incredibly flavorless - it boggles the mind. You see all the ingredients in the burrito but everything becomes an amalgam of "blah".

And they fail to list that the guacamole and sour cream are extra with the super burrito option. Don't most super burritos come with the extras?

I have no idea why this is even a chain in the Bay Area? Sorry, but it goes to show you that folks in the Bay Area wouldn't know what a good burrito was even if they were slapped in the face with it.
author: Art O.

description:
TAKE HOME: GO TO THE ONE ON CLEMENT INSTEAD.  They are nice and accommodating, as opposed to the arrogant pricks at this location.  As another reviewer put it, "There is a palpable air of 'stupid gringos' going on behind the counter."  But it's even worse than that.

BACKGROUND: This place is known as being the only affordable restaurant in the Richmond.  I'm not talking, "Oh, $9+tax is a great price for Pad Thai!" kind of affordable, I'm talking, "I can afford to eat out at these prices about once a day."

THE POINT: We bring in our own containers, so we don't contribute to their insanely wasteful paper, aluminum, fake-compostable-really-plastic container frenzy.

Every time we go in, we get major attitude and rolling eyes from the muscle-memory-only food assemblers there.  Today the mid-twenties guy with his cutesy beard literally looked at me and shook his head.  

NOTE to the small-minded: If you don't approve of something someone does that fits outside the one-square-inch box in your tiny head, either think it through or shut the hell up and accept the glory of knowing you have another customer who made the poor decision to keep you alive another day, and save you money on your expensive wrapping.  Assume that maybe someone's doing something different for a reason, and think for three seconds about the consequences of adding up even one hour's worth of the wasteful containers and pissy attitude you dole out.  

I dislike them.
author: Auspicious T.

description:
Somehow I seem to follow Gordo's wherever I find apartments. I used to live by the one in the inner richmond, then we moved to a place 2 blocks from it in the outer richmond. Now that i have a find a new place I'm scared I'll go through withdrawals unless i move to the sunset by the 9th ave one...

Grumpy middle-aged mexican men are running this joint but hey, nobody comes here for the service. We come here for a cheap and tasty burrito that happens to be a 5 minute walk from our place of residence. I've asked for a burrito with the spinach tortilla and received a death glare like i've just requested to take his right kidney, I've ordered avocado and not received any, and I've ordered a quesadilla with a spinach tortilla and received a burrito with a regular tortilla. Hahahah but you just dont argue with the Gordo Guys. They run the joint. And they know that when we are craving mexican food and are too lazy to head to the mission, where will we go? Down the street to Gordos of course :)
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
Anybody who thinks this is a good taqueria hasn't been to any taqueria in the Mission District.  Seriously.  

I like Gordo's.. don't get me wrong.  It's relatively cheap, quick "service", not bad for fast food.

One reason why it's not as good as Mission taqueria's?  Order a "veggie" burrito from Gordo's.  What do you get?  Rice and beans unless you add cheese, guac, sour cream, salsa.  Give me some F'ing veggies.. carrots, corn, lettuce anything.  They don't offer actual vegetables other than whatever beans you order and that to me isn't a worthwhile veggie burrito.  

Go to a Mission taqueria and order a veggie burrito and its full of all of the above and it tastes SOOOOOOO much better. 

I go to Gordo's because I live down the road but I always crave a better taqueria...
author: Phil S.

description: I enjoy Gordos cheap, fast, bland food. I'll be back
author: Andrew V.

description: First of all I am graciously giving 1 star because there is no option for a BIG FAT 0!!!  This brand used to be good, growing up in SF I used to go to the location on 9th Avenue.  Now that I live in the Richmond district I have been going to the Geary Street and Clement street locations and lets just say will not be anymore unless all the other burrito places in SF close.  I ordered a regular burrito which was like a "baby Burrito" of which I had to ask for more meat.  This burrito was $6 plus some change.  Then I ordered a super burrito and again had to ask for more meat.  After they put beans, meat and cheese they asked what else I wanted on the burrito and I said everything that comes with the super.  Usually a super burrito means that you have sour cream, guac, cheese, salsa, hot sauce. Here you have to order everything extra.  When it was all said and done the super burrito was only a dollar more than my regular burrito.  As I was paying I noticed the people right behind me had a huge burrito and asked the cashier what kind of burrito that was they told me a super.  I then had him look at the difference between the super burrito they made me and the burrito they were currently making and how much bigger it was.  He then told me that's because you have to ask to make it bigger.  WHAT?? INCONSISTENT ALL THE WAY AROUND.  My suggestion: go to Street Taco and El Faro on Haight street.  Way better food for the price.
author: Merrell D.

description:
"Meh. I've experienced better" is a good way to describe this business.  For the price, the food is good but for the customer service and quality of the food, you might as well skip this place.  I mean if I have to feel shameful in making someone prepare my food, something is wrong.  
I never felt welcome entering this location, more of a melancholy atmosphere.
author: Jesse C.

description: Went to Gordo's again as it's my number #1 burrito place in the city.  I opted for a whole wheat tortilla, cheese, pinto, grilled chicken, tomatoes, jalapenos and extra hot sauce.  The hot sauce has great flavor but isn't overly spicy.  I've frequented Gordo's many times over the past few years and believe the grilled chicken and carnitas are by far the best meats.  Overall if you are looking for an authentic Mexican burrito, with high quality ingredients, Gordo's is your spot!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Awesome and delicious. Get the supreme burrito. I had chicken always good. The guys that work there are amazing too
author: Madie H.

description:
Quesadilla:
Tortilla - light and crispy
Cheese - not overloaded

Side of Guacamole - no tomatoes,still very tasty

Overall, light and filling.

If you and a pal need a light lunch with lotsa flavor, I recommend Gordo's quesadillas!
author: Em L.

description:
I really want to give this place more stars, but I can't. At most, it probably only deserves 2.5.
 First off, the meats here are pretty darned salty (I've had both the carnitas and beef here) !! For the prices that they charge, I can't believe that burritos nor quesadillas come with chips and salsa (they have them, but extra charge for them,along with everything else like sour cream and guac)!

Secondly, the workers mumble here. I'm sorry if I don't know what goes into a taco or quesadilla because some places are different, but mumbling sure doesn't help. I didn't want the darned sour cream (i thought he said salsa) and still had to pay extra for it!

I think the only things worth eating here are the corn quesadillas or tacos.
The corn quesadillas are worth checking out, though they aren't your normal ones! I consider them more like tacos. They melt a slice of cheese into it, and the tortillas are toasted crispy. Do try, it's different. 

However, stay away from the flour tortilla ones. The tortilla's not as crunchy and when wrapped in foil, got soggy and tasted disappointing.
The only reason I keep coming back is that it's close by work and easy enough to grab some quickly to go. 

You can def get better tasting and more value elsewhere.
author: Ly T.

description:
Great quality for great value!

The burrito is a pretty decent size and the ingredients are fresh. The salsa and guacamole = yum! This is the equivalent to an authentic chipotle. The set up is the same. You get in line, tell them what you want, and then pick your fillings. I prefer cheese and bean, but chicken is ok too.

Super burrito with everything but beans! Add hot sauce and jalapenos. Es muy bueno :-)
author: Stine H.

description:
This review is not about the food. We all know what you get here. It's OK. It's not expensive. It's convenient. BUT GORDO GUY, WHY ARE  YOU SO MISERABLE? It's like you suck the life out of everyone in there. You are rude, you are stupid, you are lazy and you talk shit about the customers. HELLO, it's not like we can't understand you. You F#$ up the order and then keep it to eat! To the owners of GORDO...get rid of the GORDO GUY at the GEARY location. He is a kill joy for customers and the entire staff.

The Clement street workers are faster, smarter, friendlier and charge the same amount, for the same exact thing, every time! 

I know this may seem harsh, but it's year after year after YEAR and we all know it, so WHY?
author: C. S.

description: Good burritos, but literally every time I go to Gordos they mess up my order.
author: Dan S.

description:
Gordo Taqueria, you are thee ISH!  

Although you make me feel gordo, you make my taste buds and tummy happy.  I will gladly run several miles just so I can engorge in your super burritos afterward.

Based on reviews, I was wary of them skimping out on meat and filling the burrito with more rice and beans.  However, this was not the case.  My super burrito got a hefty portion of meat and equal amount of rice, beans, and accompaniments.

Carnitas= BOMB.  So delicious, flavorful, tender.  

Grilled chicken= Delicioso as well.

I did ask for their "spicy" salsa/sauce but could barely taste it.  If you need a spicy kick, you probably will have to ask for extra.

The guacamole is super creamy and fresh!!  

Service was ok.  This is a cheap, no-frills place.  Get in line, order your food, pay, and eat.  Simple and good!!
author: Abby D.

description:
Best burritos in SF. Fast service. 

Simple menu. Everything is awesome. 

Inexpensive.
author: Ohhh Y.

description: Better than expected. Chipotle style flow with more authentic ingredients. The dining room itself is nothing special hence the four stars but if you want a really good burrito Gordos is great.
author: Ron G.

description: I usually get my burrito to go.  The staff is super friendly and their carnitas is the bomb!
author: Nicole W.

description: Pretty good vegetarian burritos. However, the guys that work there are always rude and act like they are doing you a favor when serving you. Whoever manages this place should become aware of this terrible dynamic because it most definitely hurts their business.  I avoid going there just because of the rude reception.
author: Patufla P.

description:
Gordo is my favorite taqueria in SF!

Very good burritos, but I started ordering a corn quesadilla instead (for portion control). You can still load it up with rice, beans, etc... but it's a smaller meal over all, and under $4.

Delicious carnitas! Their chips + guacamole make a great snack.

Geary location: The older guy with glasses and mostly gray hair, usually wearing a hat, is super stingy with ingredients. Don't let him get away with it.
author: Wendy M.

description:
In terms of Mexican restaurants, this place is the equivalent of a dive bar, which isn't necessarily a bad thing. The food is filling and copious, the prices are low and the guys making your food are surly. Contrast that with a dive bar where the pours are large, cheap and the bartenders are surly. Both are there when you really need to get your fix. 

Get my metaphor? I don't really care if you do.
author: Casey U.

description:
I decided to explore out to the outer Richmond for good Mexican food after giving up on ever finding good Mexican food near Laurel Heights. Boy do I not regret coming here....

I got a Carnitas burrito and it was DELICIOUS! The carnitas was made to perfection with excellent flavor. The burritos are also very reasonably priced. I like that I do not have to order a Super Burrito just to get sour cream and cheese to it. You can get the burrito in a regular size or super size if you want more toppings and it doesn't cost much to add on toppings. 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone in this area!
author: Annie L.

description: Best carnitas in the City! Service is quick, restrooms are clean and service is great!
author: John P.

description:
Ok, if you are hungry and want a lot of good mexican food, eat here.  This must me  a stoners paradise.  I mean seriously, easy to read, everything looks and is delicious.  

I would take it to go because I am not crazy about the vibe, the tables or much about being there at all.  But pick it up to go and have the best take out :) Cheap as well!

I always get the plates because you can pick 2 kinds of meat, great rice, beans, salsa, cheese - whatever, they don't mind.  Then you need to get corn quesadillas with some meat and open them up and put different things from the plate in these perfect tortillas.  I mean what more could you ask for?
author: Alexis B.

description:
This place is pretty good. It's not like your typical burrito from the mission. Gordos is a bit more clean tasting. Meaning... Not greasy and a sloppy mess. One key thing that stands out is they don't water down their guacamole and sour cream. I hate restaurants that do that. Come on... Don't be cheap.

I always get the flour quesadilla. With boiled chicken, rice, guac, sc, salsa, and jalapenos. It's basically a burrito but crispy! That's the little secret. Whenever I come back from Asia this is my first stop to get my Mexican fix. This is definitely one of my fav. quick eateries. I highly recommend this place.

1 bad thing.... PLEASE DO SOMETHING ABOUT THOSE FLIES!!!
author: Karen L.

description:
Someone told me this was the best burrito in the city. If that's true, this California city with a spanish name is severely lacking in quality mexi food. This was just plain weak. Asked for guac, got no guac. Loaded with bland and tasteless rice and beans, which is just filler. The chicken itself was ok, but not enough to redeem this thing. The hot sauce? Ok. The pico? Bland - like old tomatoes and barely any cilantro. Why can't I find a decent freaking burrito in this town that costs less than $8?

Maybe I was spoiled growing up in LA and living in San Diego for 3 years before moving here, but so far I've been pretty disappointed. Sure, Papalote is good, but I wouldn't call it authentic (and who the f@*k charges 50 cents for a tiny extra dollop of salsa anyway?)

Where's my real burrito?!?
author: Josh G.

description:
I've been eating burrito's here since, oh before you were born.  Back in my day we didn't carry around cell phones.  We had to use these things called "pay phones".  Cell phones were only good for two things, melting your head and bringing down aircraft and they cost over $1,000.00.  That would be $1,000,000.00 modern dollars.  And we liked it!

One thing I've noticed about this Gordo Taqueria is that it has been consistent over the years.  They consistently don't put enough salt in their salsa or their meat.  They consistently have a mild to moderate air of unfriendliness... okay, there have been a few times they were friendly.  They also make tasty burritos and very tasty quesadillas.  I have yet to find a place that services the outer Richmond with this calibre of mexican food.  Just remember to grab some salt packets and napkins on your way out the door.

I am torn between this being A-OK and being a fan, but to balance the digital cosmic forces I will rate this A-OK.
author: Theron L.

description:
Oh Gordos, how I miss you. I first started going to the Clement location while I was in grade school. Since then, I haven't really been back, but I still remember the burritos and quesadillas, so I dropped by here over the weekend, so I could get a cheap lunch. I got the chicken quesadilla, so, nothing fancy. The food is exactly how I remember, and the prices really haven't changed too much either. I paid a little bit under $5. Fantastic.

Oh, service was a little slow here though, not sure if I just came on an off day, but the guys behind the counter seemed to be more interested in talking then in serving...
author: Steph G.

description:
Whaaaa Mon!?!?!?  Fi Real!?!?!?  No flavor whatsoever!!!   Carnitas = Bland, Super Burritos = Weak sauce Batty buoy Babylon Dem!!!

Spend fi hard earned money elsewhere, like maybe an actual authentic Mexi spot, i.e. El Burrito Express, Los Coyotes, Taqueria Cancun, Ocean Taqueria, and on and on.

Bun deh Gordo Heathens Dem Babylon Shitsyem!!!  FYAH BUN!!!
author: Ubique K.

description: I'm here at least 3-4 times a week. I just, I can't...it's so good. Fresh, tasty, friendly.....all those good words that drive my point home. In a perfect world, I's eat one of their chicken quesadillas (corn tortilla, sour cream, and hot sauce) for every meal.
author: Liz A.

description:
My favorite burrito joint of all time. I always get the grilled chicken burrito with tons of guac, sour cream, salsa, and hot sauce in a spinach wrap. All in this perfect blend gives the most satisfying and delicious bite. 

I don't understand why people aren't crazy about this place, but really I don't care. This will be and always will be the #1 place I come to for a delicious juicy burrito.
author: Denise W.

description:
I had it with Gordo's. I can't believe they just made me register on Yelp... 

The food tastes ok, but pros end there. Parking is really bad in that area, but my much larger beef with them is that the place is dirty - they have a procedure where food prep person sometimes hands your burrito to the cashier who then rolls it in the foil with his dirty, money handling hands. 

Now, I was aware of that so I asked the food preparer to wrap the burrito himself, unfortunately seems that English is a hard language to understand and the cashier ended up wrapping my burrito.

I won't be going back. Wish that Yelp allowed 0 rating or even better a negative one...
Oh well.
author: Mike M.

description:
There are people who love Gordo Taqueria, and there are people who absolutely hate Gordo Taqueria.

Being a true southern California girl, I must say that this "Mexican food" really sucks.  The guacamole is blah and bland, the chips, tortillas and taco shells were really greasy and oily for some reason (like OVERLY greasy, and it was leaking through the foil - YUCK), and nothing in my tacos or burritos have ever resembled anything tasty.  Put them all together, and you get one crap-tastic waste of money.  YESSSS.

Thank you, but I would rather drive down to San Diego or Los Angeles for some real Mexican food.  Road trip!
author: Tori S.

description:
I have never had a complaint about the service.  Even with a long line, it moves fast.  I know people say you can get cheaper and more authentic burritos in the Mission, but I'm not Mexican.  I'm Irish, and to me, these taste pretty great.  

I also like that, unlike some places in the Mission, it's super clean.  And I can get it however I want.  I usually don't like beans or rice on my burritos (I know that's weird) and I request extra cheese and extra pico.  And they never make me feel like that's the wrong way to order a burrito, even though it totally is.

Finally, all the haters who say they'd rather go to the Mission, when I'm hungover on a Sunday, the last thing I want to do is take an hour long bus ride just to get a burrito.
author: Theresa H.

description:
For what it is and more importantly where it is, it's not that bad.

Pros:
cheap
+ Fountain Soda
+ decent sized seating area
+ 5 blocks from my house
+ 2 kinds of beans
+ 2 kinds of chicken
+ huge burritos
+ the "quesadillas" (which are actually more like tacos, but ok, Gordo, we'll let you have your fun and call them "quesadillas"

Cons:
- disgusting pidgeon that roamed the dining area
- NO HOT SAUCE options (wtf?!)
- less than enthusiastic service
- the whole "quesadilla" thing.  I know, I know, I said I'd let you have your fun.  But I lied! There will be no fun!  You can't just go around calling something a quesadilla when it's clearly a taco!

I am actually really suprised that I didn't hate it here.  Granted, I like my burritos a little on the simple side, and I am a fan of green sauce so the fact that there is no red sauce was only a minor flaw in my eyes.  I feel like if Gordo added a selection of hot sauces, or at least some Tapatio for cryin' out loud, it could really take it to the next level.

And they should shoo any pidgeons that enter the place.  There should be a strict shoo-ing policy in place.  Because pidgeons are, well...gross.
author: Courtney N.

description: Best burrito north of Los Angeles, fast service too
author: Luis C.

description:
I was out visiting a friend and it was lunch time so we headed to Gordo's.

The food is relatively cheap and they prepare it right in front of you with your choice of fixings. The protions are pretty large as well. I got a carne asada burrito and it tasted pretty good overall.

If you're gonna be picky then head elsewhere, but this is your only choice for a burrito in this neighborhood. Nuff' said.
author: Gary T.

description:
Standard Mexican fare. Good decent size portions no matter what you order. Service is slow and unpredictable. I am in a line with 10 people and no one is in a hurry. 

I do come here a lot and I do like their guacamole and chile verde. Something cheap, quick (sometimes) and filling.
author: Lingo L.

description:
After 20 years, Jay (The Prince) and Mike (Cold Money) got together for a burrito. I haven't seen Jay since High School when burritos were a 3x a week habit (La cumbre made a lot of money off of us). I frequent Gordo's on Clement, 9th Ave, and Geary. and the food is consistent all the way around. Carnitas, Chile Verde, and Carne Asada! All good!

The food was great, the conversation hasn't changed in 20 years...and we finally caught up. We turned out alright.
author: Michael G.

description:
Dudes, c'mon.  First strike, no tap anywhere on the tables.  Second, the lazy burrito technique.  It's filled with apathy and despair.  Those two ingredients make a lazy burrito.  Third,...hmm, third...well I just don't like it.

If you like uninspired burritos, go here.  Plus it takes forever to get a meal in your mouth.  That's a better "third strike" right there.
author: Pouria Y.

description:
The past 8 hours have been filled w/ The Beatles; be it Rock Band on the PS2 or actually learning to play the songs on guitar. 

But it's time to eat. We need something easy/substantive so we make our way to Gordo Taqueria. I have never eaten here before and I'm skeptical about Mexican all the way out in the suburbs, but I'm told the place is good. The staple for me in terms of meat is carnitas so I must try that the first time here. 

I order the burrito and I'm given pinto beans as I wasn't even asked what kind of beans I want....hmmmm *skepticism rises*. I pay and it comes to $7 and some change. 

The burrito itself was HUGE. The first thing I noticed was the freshness of the guac. You could taste the sweet buttery chunks of avocado. Yum! Carnitas was good too, it has not been sitting on a steam table that long. In the end, I would come back, definitely if I'm in the area. So fitting to find a good Mexican place all the way Across The Universe.
author: Angelo F.

description:
3.5 stars for Gordos?? No. FIVE, thank you very much!

FAVORITE burrito place, hands down. My one friend called their burritos "dry", but definitely not! I always get the Super Chicken Burrito with everything (minus beans and spicy sauce) and ah, heaven! Me and my friends come here ALL the time. Whenever we can't decide on food, I'm always down for Gordos! 

Cheap food, super close to home, always serving fast ... what more can I say? I love Gordos! The one on Clement St. is good too, but this is definitely my favorite (:
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
Gordo Taqueria has the best burritos in the Richmond neighborhood! When I need a Mexican food fix, I can't go anywhere else but to Gordo. 

I always get the quesadilla or the crispy tacos. If you get the crispy tacos, get two because one won't fill you up. Surprisngly, I haven't tried their burritos yet. The quesadillas are cheaper, yet just as BIG and filling. They stuff their quesadillas with your choice of meat and just about anything else that can go in a burrito! Plus, I like quesadillas more since they are grilled. The quacamole dip is also very good - fresh and rich! 

Although the food is worthy of five-stars, the service is alright. They're a little rude sometimes and pricky. I recommend taking your order home or go to the Gordo Taqueria on Clement - they are more cheery and friendly!
author: Linda T.

description: I've lived in sf for nearly two years. There's two Gordo locations, I tried this one twice. I'm officially unimpressed. Since when do you have a super version of a burrito and you pay extra for guacamole??! It was a vegetarian burrito!!? Born and raised in San Mateo, lived there till 18.  I KNOW what good taquerias consist of and by far, I've not a clue why this place can find the balls to charge extra like they do for SUPER.  Never have I seen such a thing and I was thoroughly annoyed especially when it's SF and there are hundreds of options.  There's nothing special about this place and they have VERY limited options all around.  Won't return.
author: Maddy B.

description:
We've been going to the Gordo's on Clement street since we were kids! We'd get Carnitas in a cup!  These days, we go to the one on Geary since it's convenient with parking or on the way home. We've always loved the Carnitas! I like the all meat plate, rice & bean quesadilla, grilled chicken tacos, and the chips with guacamole are pretty good too! For burritos, I always get either the spinach or tomato wrap (regular or super) and it tastes so much better than the regular wrap. Their house salsa is the only thing I don't like, it tastes weird. Their hot sauce, could be hotter.  I always have to tell them to keep putting more so that I can taste 'some' hot!

Very affordable and will fill you up!
author: Christina C.

description: Gordo makes good burritos and their trademark is that they steam a whole slice of cheese into your tortilla instead of putting shredded cheese in with the rest of the fixins. Other than that it's your average California taqueria. Prices for burritos are very reasonable but I felt that taco prices were a little high (lowest price was $2.50 or something like that.) I'm used to a taco from a small taqueria being no more than $1.50-$2, and since I usually get a couple, the price adds up. I liked their carne asada a lot at their Berkeley location so I'm hoping to come back to see if it's as good here.
author: Josh K.

description:
I like going to this place cause it fills me up and it's tasty. I usually get the grilled chicken burrito w/o beans, with extra salsa, guacamole and sour cream. 
Quesidilla is good there, I love how it's crunchy...mmm. I get it with a bit of rice and either grilled chicken or carnitas with the condiments.
Ah it's yummy, my bf gets it this way and he has made my friend who hated burritos into loving it.
author: Mandy D.

description: Their carnitas is fantastic, and they're pretty generous with it. Unlike most taquerias in the city, though, a super burrito just gets you cheese (sliced, rather than shredded, and steamed into the tortilla). Guac and sour cream are extra. The salsa options were a little disappointing, as pico de gallo is the only one you'll get by default. You can also ask for a splash of salsa verde, but the burrito could definitely be spicier.
author: Doug T.

description: This is one of my fav burrito places. The carnitas burrito with refried beans is to die for. The chips and salsa are great also. Only thing is I can't tell the diff between the regular burrito and the super burrito. I would stick to the regular with the extra... Sour cream or guacamole.
author: Sean W.

description: Clean, friendly and good burritos!  One of my favorite burrito spots in SF.  Ignore all the Mission snobs, there can be good burritos in other parts of the city!
author: Tim T.

description:
Gordo Beef Plate is just what I needed to have a satisfying meal of authentic Mexican food!  

Their portions was very generous.  The plate consisted a choice of meat,  rice, beans and salsa with 4 corn tortillas.  For extra, I added guacamole and sour cream.  The meal came up to be a little over $6!  This is pretty awesome! 

On a side note, they sell individually packed salsa for $1.25.  Get the spicy one b/c it is so delicious and burns your tongue in a good way! 

I am so glad this place is around b/c it is so hard to find decent Mexican food at an affordable/cheap price.
author: Deborah C.

description: Decent burrito. Good carne asada.  Definitely have had better burritos.  First time there, but you can tell its authentic.
author: Zack G.

description: I go here almost every week - 1. It's convenient 2. Their bean and cheese super burrito with everything is Bomb!  I'm not a fan of their meats as other Taqueria's have better flavor, which is why I go veggie, but I highly recommend the veggie, super burrito! Burrito Mondays!
author: Natalia H.

description: Great food for good price. they are always consistent and fast. go here for a fast meal that taste good
author: Jonathan T.

description: Gordo is a good option for people living in the Richmond/Sunset Districts. Their burritos (Carne, chicken, and chili verde) are great. Not much of a dining experience inside but it is a place for pick up. 3 stars is good enough for Gordo although they are usually busy from 5-9pm daily with long lines... People know what they are getting themselves into..
author: Spencer R.

description: It is definitely fast-food Mexican.  Not bad/great food (never had a bad experience), very filling and if in a rush a good and convenient spot.  Parking around this location call be near impossible on some days/nights.
author: Des D.

description:
This is one of my favorite places in the city to get burritos. Everything is fresh and tasty. The hot sauce can be a little inconsistent though. Sometimes it's spicy and other times it's like there is just flavored liquid in my burrito. For the most part, though, it's great.

I live near Japantown, but I still go out of my way to get Gordo's burritos. I'm rating this four stars out of five for the lack of ambiance. Although, it doesn't bug me since I always get my burritos to go. So, come for the food, not the ambiance.
author: Kristina C.

description: Never again!!  Why didn't I listen to myself the first time I decided to never eat here agin?  Why can't we have a decent (and yes, that means I can't even classify Gordo's as "decent") taqueria in the Outer Richmond?  Who steams tortillas??  And what gives with the whole no lettuce thing?  And howzabout some kick ass salsas to choose from?  I'll make the schlepp to Pancho's henceforward, thank you very much.  No gracias, Gordo.
author: Radha K.

description: I went in there to get a large burrito.  After I purchased it  and took it a  bite of it, I discovered the cashier accidentally mixed my order with another customers.  I told the cashier and he grabs the burrito and just throws it hard against the trash can giving me attitude.  He angrily tells me  he will remake it for me and asks me what I want it.  " I want a super beef burrito with everything on it and no sour cream".  He states " I won't give you guacamole"  I'm looking at him confused and I stated i would like to have  guacamole and no sour cream"  He then explains there is sour cream mixed in the guacamole.  I'm looking over at the food counter and i see  a big tray of guacamole and next to it another large tray of white sour cream.  I asked him again what that green stuff is.  He said guac.  I then asked him what the white stuff is . He replies with sour cream.  Again , I ask let me have the guacamole.  Then this dummy goes" NO, it has sour cream inside" . What then is the point of having seperate containers for the guacamole and sour cream in the first place. Then he goes off saying I have no clue what im talking about. This cashier is a complete idiot.  We argued for 5 minutes  and me trying to convince him to please put the quacomole on the burrito.  Then there was one of the cooks looking on the phone, puts it down, doesnt even wash his hands and proceeds to make burritos for other customers! I will never go back there again!  This place is a health hazard and a rude staff.  I will never come here again.
author: Elliott Y.

description: I'm a big fan. I've been going here since I was child living in the presidio. The food is wonderful! The chili verde is particularly good and a hidden treasure.
author: David G.

description:
A satisfactory burrito. I really only eat here for the sake of convenience, as it's just a short walk from my apartment. On my last visit, the middle of my burrito was kind of cold - which means, dear Yelpers, that Samantha S. has learned her lesson: now I rarely venture outside the Mission when I need to satisfy my veggie burrito cravings.

I mean, if you're going to do it, do it right.
author: Sam S.

description: A staple in any budget conscious San Francisian's list of top places to grab a burrito. Mind you the portion size has gone down slightly compared to some years ago. The quality of carnitas and carne asda is worth the mile walk to Gordos. Try their real and authentic Mexican soft drinks with your tacos or burrito. There are few better deals in Mexican food in the whole city. Now I anticipate a line or new and curious vistors to Gordos. Ah well, we all have to share the wealth of little gems sometimes.
author: Jim H.

description:
this place sucks. this is the only time i have drafted a review whilst still in the restaurant. that's how disappointed i am with gordo, and here is my list of grievances: 

1. no chorizo. that's unforgivable. 
2. no lettuce. no lettuce? what the hell. it's so cheap, there's no reason NOT to have lettuce. 
3. only one type of shitty, watery salsa. they have green hot sauce, which isn't bad, but not good for chips and salsa. which brings me to...
4. shitty, stale, yellow tortilla chips that they probably bought in a bag from Food 4 Less. 
5. none of the meat looked appetizing. i'm not a huge meat eater right now, and nothing they had (since they didn't have chorizo) looked good. 

how does this shitty CHAIN continue to exist in the burrito mecca that is san francisco? blasphemy!
author: Shannon C.

description: I hate eating sucky burritos, it's such a waste of time and money. I'd rather drive to south city and go to el farolitos or la tapatia's! And yes, I could go to the Mission for el farolito, but I hate driving in circles for parking.
author: Christy V.

description:
Somebody wrote "best carnitas in town". They were the most bland carnitas I have ever had. The texture was good, but that was it. I make pork shoulder in my crock pot all the time. One time, I didn't use any spices or rubs, and it tasted like theirs. A lot of carnitas are put under a broiler to crisp up, or reimmersed in ther own natural juices, or both. These were tender, but lacked any other flare after that. Overall the rest of the ingredients in the "super burrito" (I think it was called) were middle of the road. Even the guacamole was, meh. The staff were completely uninterested in working. (there was a soccer match playing on their tiny tv that everyone was consumed with watching.). 
It is close to my house. I'll probably eat it again when I am to lazy to cook. 
My two star rating reflects this one outing alone. 
The place was clean and easy to order. 
It might be better at another outing, but I am not planning on going back any time soon.
author: Phillip H.

description: Bland food.. salsa is watered down and the corn and flour tortillas are hard and taste old, the beans dont taste fresh either. Their chicken plates arent that bad though... i guess its not bad for a quick fix... Sucks cuz I love mexican food and this is closest to my house.
author: Frank T.

description:
This place is Cheap as hell and that is exactly what you get with your food here. I'm not really hatin I'll still come here, but not for taste but because I'm feeling cheap. 
I was a little surprised to see some stuff people said about this place Yelp  is starting to lose some leeway for me when it comes to using it as a decision tool for restaurants. 
As I was saying before this place is cheap theres no doubt about that. But food wise it doesn't taste bad, just doesn't have much flavor.
Another thing, no orchata? Come on that should be a mus. and pay for chips? but again cheap.
author: Josh E.

description: I have gone here multiple times and it is usually pretty good. I ordered the carnitas quesadilla lastnight and woke up with a horrible stomachache and have been puking allll day. I had to leave work. Not sure if it was a bad night for their carnitas or what, but I am not going back there.
author: Ashley F.

description:
There are two kinds of cheap Mexican places as far as I'm concerned: the kind whose food tastes as bad as it looks, and the kind that has some strange inner quality that manifests itself in the food they produce. I'd have to say, Gordo's fits the latter bill.

It's not often I have a craving for a burrito, but ever since I was introduced to this place a few weeks ago I've gone back for more. What can I say? Their food is superb, simple, and downright cheap - where else can I get a filling super burrito for $5? Other items, like their quesadillas, Gordo plates, and tacos are just as good and just as cheap.

Service is nothing to write home about, but they take your order diligently and efficiently, so you're good to go in no time. I've had a couple of mistakes in my order (salsa when I asked them for none), but it's usually nothing major. The fact that they're open somewhat late is nice when my friends and I head farther out on Geary and need a quick dinner, and despite how small the place is there usually aren't many people there in the evenings.

Just thinking about Gordo's kind of makes me want to go there again for lunch. Mmm... maybe next time.
author: Will C.

description: Went here again because we were craving and starving for a mission street burrito. And my last review came alive. They are so skimpy with the meat. I was watching as he scooped the meat a small size and did not dump the whole scoop in my burrito. I wanted to scream on mission they give us at least 2 full scoops of meat in comparison of there scoop. Super burrito and small bag of chips with no salsa =$7.79. I'm done with this place.
author: Jeff C.

description: This place is just ok..nothing special.  The food was very bland and the were out of several of the toppings.
author: Michael K.

description: Used to go to the Gordo's on College Ave. in Berkeley and would have given it three stars.......but at this location the employees were so rude. They barely addressed me and my friend when we came in, talked to each other the whole time they were taking our orders, looked at us as if we were stupid when we didn't understand their questions to us, and made fun of us in Spanish, thinking we couldn't understand. Minus one star for that!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
This gordo is not as good as the one on clement.
ordered a carnitas burrito and it was dry as hell, the tortilla was hard.

They get 2 stars because the sour cream and hot sauce taste like the one on clement

Il be back to the gordo's on clement
author: DOM d.

description:
Fast, Cheap & Delicious! 

Exactly how I like my mexican food.
author: Chrissy L.

description: Not bad for a burrito fix. Get the chicken or carnitas (their carne asada is so-so).
author: Alex M.

description:
I saw Robin Williams here once on a late Friday evening. Did you know he enjoys Super carinitas burritos, black beans, with everything just like me? Yep, seriously. 

As my staple go-to Mexican joint in the outer Richmond District, this place has outlasted the likes of the corner Alexandria Theater and 35 cents Muni fare for the 38 line. Gordos pulls my childhood heart strings when I need that burrito fix. Ask for a Super and you'll get one massive tortilla blanketing heaps of your favorite ingredients, all for around $7. Fast, cheap, and appetite-quenching. And unlike its sister store on Clement, seating is more abundant here. Parking, unfortunately, is still a pain.

Now living in SOMA, I've yet to find another Mexican place in the area that rivals the true and tried value of Gordos.
author: Jay D.

description: Born and Raised in the City and remember this place opening on Clement St.  Wow!!  Just came home from a visit to the City and the FLAVOR is still the same.  Keep up the good work cause I will be BACK!!!
author: Duane G.

description:
Thanks to a free coupon I didn't have to pay a dime for this subpar burrito. Oh wait, yes I did. I had to fork over two dimes for a wheat tortilla surcharge. Um, OK. How about you state that on your menu if you are going to tack on extras? Or put it towards some lettuce, which was something you don't offer. But you do offer bags of chips that have grease soaking through the bottom, though I didn't get one as part of my order. No offense taken, though I do wonder how much you would have tacked on.

Ending on a (sort of) positive note - chicken verde was tasty. Too bad it amounted to a burrito about 2/3 the size of your much better mission cousin.
author: Jason B.

description: I like Gordo Taqueria a lot. The burritos are more moist and less burnt-tasting than the more authentic ones I've had. That's great. I like abundant salsa, sour cream, and guacamole. I get that here. The two chicken choices are good. Prices are very reasonable. The customer service is a-okay.
author: Paulina F.

description: I used to come here all the time 15 years ago--Gordo's was a mainstay in my college days! Coming here yesterday, I noticed some changes since i was last at this location so many years ago--first thought was that the line seemed to move waaaay slower--granted the guy in front of me seemed to be ordering for his entire office--but, i did notice things seemed to be way less efficient then they used to be! When i went to order--i noticed that things seemed a bit less hygenic--like the staff using a less than clean rag to wipe the counter after chopping up some carnitas--couldn't help but wonder how many germs were on that rag! yikes! Then, I went to pay and asked for chips and was told they were out....really? Ughh.. and then, lastly, eating the burrito that was so coveted by me in the past (and granted...i get that sometimes, our memories play tricks on us and make us think things are better in the past than they really were...) but, i just didn't get that---yum, comfort food feeling that I used to get! It was just meh....kind of broke my heart a little.  I mean, it was not awful, though--and it did have that certain flavor that I associate with Gordo's--but, it didn't wow me like it had in the past...maybe it was the turn off from checking out? Not sure...but, I think the torch that I carried all these years is starting to flicker out.
author: C Z.

description: My frequent lunch stop. They keep the place clean and they have fast and polite service. cons- their menu doesn't change and once in awhile their salsa is off and not very spicy.
author: Steve S.

description: I always come here with my husband and eat burritos which are always great !!! :) I will come here with my sister who's visiting me this year. I love Gordo!
author: Kimberly K.

description: Love me some chili verde and the carnitas. Don't forget the flour quesadilla. bomb diggati!
author: T L.

description:
Yesterday I read a review of Gordo that I disagreed with at the time and it made me decide to get a burrito from there.  One part I took issue with was the idea that guac and sour cream cost extra in a bean and cheese super burrito as I was pretty sure it was included.  I thought wrong.  My $4.95 burrito was $5.91.  I still like this place, but knowing I can get more for cheaper elsewhere has made me rethink the rating, even if it's way on the other side of town from me.

The quesadillas are still a great deal though, and I like their chile verde, so it's still a solid 3.5 stars - if they start selling crinkle-cut french fries maybe I'll bump it back up.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Came here last friday night for a quick bite before McKenzie's--havent been here for 4 years. But now, i remmeber why! or maybe its just this one time but...
I ordered a super burrito-steak and my tortilla tasted raw, like flour, it was gross. Blehhhhh!

Maybe I should have came, AFTER going to the bar--then I probably wouldnt have noticed!
author: Amy S.

description:
We wanted a cheap, filling dinner before heading out last night.   Our order came to about $14, which was odd, b/c when we walked in I read the menu and it clearly stated burritos were under $5. And, from their website menu today: 
BURRITO - Chicken $4.25 
SUPER BURRITO - Chicken $4.95 
So how, exactly, did our order for this amount to over $14? The website menu says that guac is a $0.65 increase and sour cream is $0.45.  She got both guac and sour cream. I only added sour cream. That's $1.55. So that still doesn't add up to $14. Oh, we both got jalapenos and spinach tortillas... but those aren't posted as *extra* items on the website. 

I got the Super and she had the regular - and when the guy finished wrapping them, he laughs and says, "hey look, they're the same size." 

Service: Slow, not friendly. 
Food: passable if you really want mexican. 
There's a small dining area, which was clean. 

This place will leave you burping for about 3 hours.
author: Meg W.

description:
Horrible.  What a sorry excuse for a taqueria.  If the staff was aggressively rude (think Soup Nazi) then it might be entertaining.  Instead, they just take up space behind the counter showing zero interest in doing jack shit for a customer.

It was deathly silent in the restaurant today...there were 9 people eating and two flies hoovering around and not a peep from anyone--just people silently chowing down on what I had hoped would be good eats.

When my quesadilla was ready, the woman just yelled "here" and threw the yellow basket down on the counter.  Also, I had a very specific request for what to leave out of said quesadilla which they completely ignored.

Deciding to soldier through it and eat it anyway--I discovered that most of it was barely luke warm.

Rarely do I have a "fuck this place, I'm outta here" moment, but I sure as hell had one here.

Try taco bell a little further down Geary--or for that matter, ANY OTHER TAQUERIA.  You will be guaranteed better food and better service.
author: Eric E.

description: Get in, get full. Fast service. Staff isnt outwardly friendly, but not rude either. -1 for the fruit flies.
author: Taylor S.

description: I only expect one thing here- cheap and grubby carnitas burrito- and they deliver every time.  Anyone whining about service here needs to remember they're paying under $6 for that burrito and then cry all the way over to La Urbana.
author: Chris T.

description: This is what a burrito is supposed to taste like.  Options are limited, but that's fine because what they do they do very well.  Love the burritos and the guacamole is good too.  This is my go-to place for a quick bite of Mexican food.
author: David S.

description:
The burritos here aren't anything special, but Gordo gets four stars based on their carnitas alone.  Sit me down with a plate of their carnitas, rice and beans and I'm a happy Jew.  

The staff here are generally pretty awesome, but there is that one guy who skimps on the meat as if you're taking food out of his kids' mouth.  Then there's the other guy who gave my friend a super burrito when she naively asked if they served "baby" burritos.

Still though, I love this place, and the other locations are more or less fantastic as well.  Reasonably priced and delicious.
author: joe p.

description:
I can't really make up my mind about this place.  It is cheap and fast and so so close to my house.  But the food is just "meh."  Not bad, not good.  They use sliced cheese on the burritos.  That weirds me out for some reason.  I order cheese-less burritos it weirds me out so much.  In the 7 years since I moved away from SoCal, I've learned to appreciate the Mexican(ish) food they serve up here, but Gordo isn't even good by those standards.  

If you're hungry and only have $5, this place will do the trick.  If you want mouth-gasms, you'll have to go elsewhere.
author: Carmen R.

description: The 2 star rating is purely for their tricky business strategy and I still like their food. I just bought a regular burrito from them and was charged for a price of a super one that would cost. I realized that after I had paid.. I asked why and the not so nice cashier said " because of the cheese, regular burrito doesn't come with cheese." Well, i did NOT ask for cheese. It's not the extra $ that pissed me off, I'm disappoint about their "special operating strategy". I still like their food and probably will go back for more orders but definitely will be more cautious on how much being charged at the register.
author: Stef L.

description:
I read some previous reviews here and I think some explanation is in order. 

First: Cheese comes standard with the burrito. Gordo's puts the cheese on the tortilla before heating it, so it's already melted before they throw in all the fixings. Not a cheese fan? Tell them before you order.

Second: Service is fine here, unless you're expecting the folks behind the counter to take you to your seat and serve you some wine. The folks behind the counter want to get you in and get you out quickly. Because the lines get big here, especially during lunchtime. 

And the lines are here for a reason. This is a quick, inexpensive burrito joint of the highest order. Beans. Rice. Meat. You can throw in some some pico and hot sauce. Guac and sour cream if you want. 

I'm a fairly big eater and Gordo's super burrito has always provided a perfectly filling meal, placing me at the apex of satiation without plunging me into the nether-regions of cuisine-induce slumber. No need for chips or some combo stuff. 

I bounce around the carnitas, chile verde and carne asada. I've heard about the glory of the all-meat option, but have yet to experiment. Try to look out for whatever is just off the grill.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Went here with the roomie today.  We needed to get the hell out of Daly City for some grubs.  Originally Americana was on our pallet, but we ended up going here, because the sign attracted us.

It wasn't too bad.  I mean definitely are better burritos out there and it totally had a fast food feel to it, BUT the burrito itself is pretty heavy, which is good.  We both ordered the Super Meat Burrito, though I really have no idea what that means.

All in all, not a bad place, and damn cheaper than the Taquerías near our house.
author: Clayton R.

description:
I've been eating Burrito's from Gordo's since middle school, though originally at the Clement location. I prefer the Geary location as it has more room to sit down and eat. Granted, on busy days, it can get a little scattered and messy. (Especially, when lazy people can't throw their own crap away.") The burrito-assembly area is ALWAYS clean. They clean even when the burrito is steaming, and always between your order and the next.

The burrito's themselves are big, juicy and tasty. The best part is that the price hasn't changed all that much over the last 10 years or so. They make the largest taco's i have seen, and the heaviest Quesadilla i have ever eaten. I can also feed my family for around 18 dollars with drinks.

So if you want a great, inexpensive burrito that doesn't require a reservation, a vegetarian need, or some isolationistic requirement to not be surrounded by working class people, then go get a Burrito!

I recommend the Chicken and Carne Asada in the AM/Noon and the Chile Verde in the PM. Don't shy away from the Sour Cream or Jalapeno's...mmm
author: Edward P.

description:
I use to LOVE Gordo's and come here often after school. But Everytime I actually opt for Gordo's, they just keep disappointing me! The burritos are always loose and falls apart ALL OVER me. I mean, I'm already a messy eater, I don't need people to think I'm a kid and can't even eat with my hands. 

The rice was dry and bland. No flavor what so ever. No enough sour cream in my burrito, TOO MUCH guacamole which took over everything else in the burrito. Steak was... wait, I hardly had any in there! When I did get a piece of meat, it was way too salty and chewy..

I doubt I would ever come here for my burritos anymore.. It's just not worth my calories..
author: Juliane N.

description:
Defenition of a bad combo; 

Only good when drunk, not open late
author: Drue C.

description: This place is well below average. The old guy who makes the burritos could care less about what you actually tell him. He just slops shit on there in a haphazard way and can barely pretend to listen to you. The burritos are sloppy and wet with bean juices and are barely wrapped tight enough. The fact that you pay for chips and salsa on top of it is a slap in the face. I watched him make my four burritos in disgust (and these weren't obnoxious custom orders either) and almost told him to forget about it halfway through. Eating them was just as much of a disappointment. There is nothing good about this location.
author: Adam F.

description:
This place obviously has what every other taqueria should have.
Burritos
Tacos
Quesadillas.
When I watch these fools make my food, they might as well get a scale and measure how little they add guac. and meat.

The next time I ever run into a top manager or Owner at either El Farolito or Taqueria Cancun in the mission , I need to get in their heads that opening one of their taquerias in the inner richmond, would be genius.
Obviously Gordo's wouldn't close down, but they would be no competition for El Farolito or Cancun Taquerias
author: Andrew Z.

description:
So I've been going to Gordos for the past 15 years.  In high school, we would get a Gordo's Cup for 1.25, it was a small cup filled with rrice, cheese, sour cream, guac and your meat of choice.  It was awesome for the price!

Nothing wrong with Gordos... The same people have been working there since the start... They have the same recipes for the meat... the carnitas is always cut to order, which increases that freshness... portions are nice, price is decent... and they got something for everybody!
author: ryan l.

description: Lack of properly marinated meat and their disgusting slice of cheese in their burritos makes this place a loser in my booked.
author: David A.

description:
I said no cheese. You say ok no cheese, continue to make the burrito with cheese and then look pissed when I tell you I cant eat it, as the burrito now has a layer of steamed melted cheese.  Being vegan isnt like a switch i turn on or off buddy, so dont be pissed when i tell you something and you decide to go agaisnt it.

The salsa, beans and rice are good here. I pick them up and go home and make my own burritos now.  The guacomole is not vegan as it has sourcream as a base.  One of the guys workign there was nice enough to tell me that(thats why it gets two stars, honesty). So unless you want a rice, bean, salsa burrito, Gordo's is strictly for picking up items for home.

Service could be better, usually a line of people, and of course the fact that this place is in the russian barrio, kinda makes it a bummer
author: Justin W.

description:
What I cannot figure-out about this place is the absence of ANY amenities on the tables ... no Cholula Sauce (you know, the one with the wooden cap on the bottle) ... not even Tabasco. There is no "salsa bar," where you can load-up on salsa for your meal. There are not even salt and pepper shakers on the tables! WTF? (Yes, yes, they have the little packets of salt and pepper by the soda machine - but those are for take out, not for eating a meal there.) What could it possibly cost to put some hot sauce on the darned  table?

The menu is about as basic as it can get, but it is all quite good; you get what you pay for.

I was in there tonight, and there was a continuous line of people. This place is a "Cash Cow."
author: John H.

description:
I must tell them " Thank you, Gordo!".
It just great to have them for a single Father like me.
I have 2 boys. I used to make  their lunch and dinner very often.
but Gordo helped me a lot.
They are fast, big-size and reasonable.
And, pretty good food.
Thank God!
We all love Gordo.
I like their grilled chicken Tacos.
My older son loves their Qesadilla.
spicy pork is good too.
sometimes I have dinner box.
I've never eat there, Just take out.

I go to the other Gordo on Clement and 24th Avenue also good.

Thank you again Gordo!
I can not survive without you.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Gordo's is a decent burrito. It's probably the best Mexican option west of Park Presidio and north of Anza.

It's my go to option when I want to go home and don't feel like driving down to the Mission.

I'm not excited about it, but until there's a Farolito West, this is the spot.
author: Jason R.

description:
The hype killed this one for me.

My roommate claim that these burritos are to die for, that she grew up on this, and nothing else.  With the line forming at the counter when I arrived, I thought "Hey, this place GOTTA be GRRRRREAT!"

Sadly, I had to take that thought back.

It's a good burrito, but I'm not dying for it, nor will I make another trip out to the Richmond to get this (I live in North Beach, so it was definitely A TRIP!) 

It tasted good, but not authentic enough for my taste.  It's a bit too "American" for me.  The menu is short, and everything cost extras.  Even the chips are another buck or so.  Come on now!

It's a cool place if you live close by and want to get a quick burrito fix.  I just rather go to my local taco truck for mines, that's all.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I live 20 minutes away from Gordos, and whenever I'm in the mood for mexican (which is quite often) I drive my ass all the way over there and spend 10 minutes finding parking so I can get an amazing burrito.

My usual is a spinach burrito with cheese, with carnitas, rice, black beans, tomato, guacamole, and a little hot sauce. It is the best burrito I've ever had. It's ALWAYS solid and a mexican place you can definitely rely on. It's cheap too. I just wish I lived close to it!
author: Ashley H.

description: I love going to gordo's I am always super full after a regular burrito!  I live the employees too because they are so friendly and always give me a super stuffed burrito!  I got a chicken burrito with guacamole and it was $6.02.. I was satisfied!
author: Jennifer H.

description: My wife and I went to Gordo's for the first time ever(6-23-06). I tried the Chicken super burrito and she had the Carnitas super. There both average burritos. One of the few taquerias, in the Richmond district, can't complain about it. I'm hungry, I'm there.
author: Matt G.

description:
This should really be two reviews.  I have lived two lives at Gordo Taqueria. The first lasted over ten years.  Since high school I've been frequenting Gordo, always a favorite of my eldest brother and for obvious reasons.  There are fresh ingredients, it's tasty yet clean, they have a transparent preparation process, a variety of flavors, and the service is pretty impeccable.  By that I mean the one thing I've come to expect, and really require, in a burrito place is that they get my order right.

ANYWAY, the first life I lived at Gordo was a life of grilled and boiled chicken and carne asada.  I don't have an aversion to pork - I love bacon, I love pork chops, etc., I just never tried fried, seasoned pork at a taqueria because, well, I hadn't.  But it was a good life.  Boiled chicken is better with black beans.  Grilled is better with pinto.  Steak is better with refried.  I was in mix and match heaven.

That all changed last year, though, when I started my second life at Gordo.  I tried the carnitas.  They don't do carnitas like this anywhere else.  I've looked.  It's fried pork.  Let me slow down.  FRIED.  PORK.  Oh sweet Jesus (pronounced "Hay-Zues" - we're in a Mexican restaurant after all...) that stuff is good.  I get it with the spinach tortilla for an illusion of healthiness but really it's pretty terrible for you.  Which means it's really gooooood.

Get the carnitas.  Please.  You too can have a new life.
author: Tim K.

description:
Meh.. it's decent enough, the ingredients are fine. for me the deal breaker is that the salsa verde contains no tomatillos.. WTF? I give them an extra star for letting me slide when I was short a few cents a couple of times.

Oh yeah this place is tiny and loud kids hang out there and talk at a table without eating and don't get tossed!! WTF again?
author: Dre D.

description:
No matter where I visit in the city, maps or no maps, I seem to have a built-in directional finder for this Gordo's on Geary. It is one of those "hole-in-the-wall" places that has great eats. Dismiss the service, and the decor, here it is all about the food. 

My recommendation is the Carnitas Quesdilla because its basically a friend burrito and it is messy!! The food is relatively inexpensive because as they make it for you, ask for everything in it or not, it doesn't matter because its the same price in the end. 

To-date, this is the best Mexican food (quesadilla) I have ever had and that is saying something for me. This is a must go-to stop for me every time I visit the city, even if it was just for a day. 

My friends bug me always asking me to freeze something and bring it down so they can remember it ... I don't know if it would work. 

My favorite dish: Carnitas quesadilla with rice, black beans, salsa, guacomole and a little sour cream.

Go out and EAT!
author: Anthony C.

description: Hey, don't compare this place to the "Mission Burrito"  it is not a Mission Burro... Just eat and shut up.  Old stand-by spot.  You know its there, you know what to expect and there you go...
author: Christopher F.

description: I am so glad I live next to this place!  For 8 bucks I can get a super burrito and chips with salsa!  The burrito itself is so filling and the joint is hella cheap compared to Papalote, those money grubbers.  So far I've just tried the chicken burrito.  Next up, steak.  and if they have fish, ima get that too. awesome!
author: Alex G.

description:
Some people hate it.

Some people love it.

I tend to like them a lot. Its conveniently located in my neiborhood which makes it all the better and is really cheap. They are super quick and I've never been disappointed. 

Overall we all know there is much better Mexican food to be had in the city but when you are in the Richmond and don't want to trek all the way to the mission to get food then this place often hits the spot.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Anybody who knows me, knows that me and my brother and mom loves gordo's. Lately this one has been slipping though. I've been a fan for more than 10 years when this one didn't exist and you had to squish into the clement store.

I'm not sure what I did, but the fat (yes, fat) burrito maker guy is always so stingy when i order. 

The older guy is great, makes huge super burritos aka 'footballs' but this fat guy just hates us! The person i went with ordered a quesadilla. Granted that you don't expect a 'football' when you order a quesadilla, but you expect something a little more than the tortilla, oil and melted cheese. she asked for meat, rice, tomatoes and hot sauce and it barely covered the cheese!!!!

how can you fill a quesadilla but still see the cheese on the bottom? obviously you need not be so stingy. So she asked if she could have a little more rice and that's exactly what he gave her......maybe 10-15 KERNELS of rice........ we joked after that next time 1.) avoid that guy, 2.) ask for a lot of more rice haha

I got a super burrito and this burrito had nothing SUPER about it. . . . it must have been the size of a small regular burrito made by any of the other workers. There was more tortilla than anything. My first 3 bites (normal, not little mouse bites) were ALL tortilla.....maybe some cheese, but you get the point.

I don't know how to review this one.....everyone is normally nice and gives good portions but that fat guy would seriously make me stop going to gordos. I hate to be mean, but a guy that big making food would expect to give you hearty portions. I'm sure if he made a super burrito for himself it would be 3x the size of the little dinky taco-sized super burrito that he made me.
author: edie t.

description:
for what it is Gordo's kicks an unbelievable amount of ass.

What a load of beans.
author: Nicholas E.

description:
The best Gordo's is the one on Solano Avenue in Albany, which ALWAYS has a line out the door, at all times of the day. However, this one is also pretty damn good.

There is really only one way you should order a burrito here: a super burrito with chicken (stewed chicken, not pollo asado), extra tomatoes and extra extra hot sauce. This will get you a humongous steamed burrito with melted gooey cheese, pinto beans, rice, meat, pico de gallo, guacamole and sour cream, which when it all comes together, is a symphony in your mouth.

Of course, I always opt for a "healthier" version and get whole wheat tortilla and hold the cheese, sour cream and cut the rice and beans in half. But then steal a bite of the person who ordered the better burrito, usually my brother, and spend the rest of the meal regretting getting the healthier option.
author: Deb I.

description:
I think any native SFian would agree that Gordo's has the best burritos in the city

I also love their Gordo cups... cheap, tasty, and the best snack ever!

Gordo's turned me gordo.  Poop.
author: S L.

description:
Lets be truthful here.  Once in a while you want to wear something ugly cause you don't give a shit.  Maybe an old t-shirt, some ripped jeans, or the sweathshirt whose original color is a mystery.  Wearing something nice sometimes is just too much effort.

Thats what going to Gordo's is like when you know what a burrito is supposed to taste like.  Funny thing is, from time to time, I go back.  Usually the decision making goes something like this:  what should we eat for lunch?  I don't know, what do you think?  I'm not sure.  Maybe...nah thats too far.  What about....nope, they're closed Monday's.  Fuck it, lets go to Gordo's.
author: Pete M.

description: This place does not seem to value customer much. When ordering my grilled chicken burrito with everything on it, the cashier seemed to be hating his job and just wanted the day to pass. The expression that he was showing made me feel like  I was giving him a hard time. The burrito i got wasn't all that special too, just like any other burrito, but I guess for $6 it wasn't so bad. I don't know if the cashier just had a bad day and I so happen to be there at the wrong time, but I still won't come back for another visit.
author: Philip T.

description:
Yummy and affordable.  Guac is pretty good.  Boiled chicken is great.  Put it all together with rice and beans, wrap it up as a burrito, pay about $5 and -- you you get a great, satisfying meal.

Today, I noticed that Gordo's posted its recent health department evaluation - it scored wonderfully - 98!!!!   Yeah!
author: Cara C.

description:
The first burrito I ever had was from Gordo's, and I have been a customer ever since.  When in doubt over what to eat or when I discover that I have no food in the refrigerator, Gordo's is a no-brainer.  When I was younger and coming home from school, I had to walk past Gordo's and it became a constant temptation.  Usually, Gordo's would win.

I love to get the super burrito with either the Spinach or Tomato wrap and the grilled chicken.  It may sound like a standard burrito, but the nostalgia I feel each time I bite into a Gordo's burrito makes it anything but standard.

Recently though (maybe because of the down economy), they have been making the burritos smaller, but I still go back for more.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I started coming to this place when I first moved to San Francisco and was still crashing with my brother way out in The Avenues. The burritos are good; the ingredients are fairly fresh, and the staff will do anything you want without asking you twice or charging you too much.
