The only downsides to this place are that there's usually a soccer game blaring on the TV and if you come around dinner time you're likely to have to wait a really long time to order.
author: John S.

description:
After braving the windy conditions, seeing way many unanticipated twigs and berries, and enduring a lengthy wait at Baker Beach to capture the Golden Gate Bridge at Sunset, I was ready to head back to my buddy's place in the Twin Peaks area. Not having any sense of where I was going, I relied heavily on my more important than oxygen GPS to get me around. I crossed Geary Street on the way back and decided that Geary would be a good street to hunt for food. I used the Wells Fargo as a stopping point and surveyed the surrounding areas.

At close to 9:00 pm, I figured most of places would be lacking for patrons but not Gordo's Taqueria. I walked by, the whole time thinking no more Mexican food cuz I nearly OD'ed on it in the previous few days, and decided, okay, any place with a significant line at this hour must be pretty decent. I had to wait nearly 10 minutes to get my order in as the there was only one gent assembling the food there. It was worth the wait. I order the Carnitas burrito and even after a lengthy car ride back, the burrito held up and along with a Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, it went down smoothly.

There were a few choices of meaty fillings and the rest of the toppings/fillings were pretty standard. Nothing of special note but leave it to the locals to help me filter out the good places from the less than good places. Apparently my landlord/buddy knew of this hole in the wall place as well. I'd thought I'd give this place a thumbs up. Happy dining world!
author: Bill G.

description: Fantastic burritos and quesadillas. Both great portions at affordable prices. You can't go wrong with my meat here.
author: Graeme B.

description: I have never really understood the lull of Gordos. But then again, I am not a huge burrito fan. It's a good source for a cheap eat down the road though when I am just too lazy to do anything else.
author: Sarah A.

description: These guys know what they're doing.  They keep it simple and create good tasting burritos.  I tend to do a simple pollo asado con todo.  The place doesn't have much character so not going to give a full five stars.
author: John W.

description:
What kind of taqueria doesn't have refried beans and is out of chips at 9pm on a Thursday night? A crappy one in the Richmond. 
I wanted to satiate my refried beans+salsa+chips craving and was denied. That's what I get for seeking out taquerias in the Richmond.
author: Candice L.

description:
BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!
$5 FAT BURRITOS!!!
I love it!  The carnitas is greasy but a good kind of grease!  YOU MUST COME HERE!
No frills menu!  Easy to order.  The staff is great!
This is not Pancho Villa (san mateo) but that's ok.  I know what to expect.  Fast easy service!  In an out I go!!
OK I think I am going there tmrw.
It is a good thing that I live near this joint!!!
author: Elisa O.

description:
Gordo's is always a solid burrito.  The bean and rice have good flavor the grilled chicken is authentically seasoned.  And the price is right.

I ordered my burrito with lite beans and rice (because I'm watching my figure) which is usually a risky move, sometime you end up with a tiny ass little piece of burrito.  Gordo's hooked it up.  Lite on the carbs meant that I got hooked up with a bunch of everything else, which is nice.  

This isn't a five star burrito but it's never a disappointment.
author: eric f.

description: I love this place.  It's close to home and they're fast and cheap.
author: John B.

description:
I so love Gordo.  Yeah the cheese the put on a burrito is just a slice of cheese (but that's where the comparisons end with Jack in the Box).

They load your junk up and don't even apologize.  All of the ingredients are authentic, simple, and well made.

You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  My particular favorite is any meat quesadilla, add beans and rice and everything else (salsa, guac, sour creme, jalapenos).

This location is the biggest, and it's right next to Cards & Comics Central.  Try not to let the attitude of the comic shop workers affect you all the way over here while you're eating a great burrito.

There is no great taqueria - everyone has their own opinions and their own likes.  Generally speaking Gordo is it's own thing.  It's not a Mission style taqueria, and it's not a taco-truck, and thank God it's not Taco Bell.

Give it a try.
author: Josh L.

description:
I was at Gordo's on Saturday May 10th. You missed me. Ha! 
.....anyway
Gordo's success is in it's simplicity.
Simple burrito, simple prices.
I got the regular size grilled chicken burrito but I added sour cream and guacamole and that little green hot sauce he offered  - thanks guy!
My burrito made me so happy because it wasn't trying to be special or unique or famous; it was just trying to be it's natural self. I think my burrito had a soul. And I ate it. It was sooo good.
I would recommend this place to anyone, and especially people who have been hanging around too many "boutique burritos!"
If you're a hungry man, maybe you should get the super burrito.
Also, we ordered chips and salsa and if you like jalapenos, that salsa has 'em. It was hot! I hurt myself.
Mexican sodas were like $1.15 and I got grapefruit! Thanks guy!

But, alas, the guy gave me grief when I asked to try the carne asada, he had to get approval from senior management and sh*t. 
And that's why you get 4 stars  - guy!
author: Tianna R.

description: Gross... guy wiped the grill, then the counter, then his hands with the same filthy rag. Then he made my food without washing his hands.
author: Heather H.

description:
ummmm....this is for people that moved here from the east coast and party at Ruby Skye, who have never set foot in the Mission

I met Mr Gordo himself when he was in Marin.  I had to ask about the finger.....i know...i know... but I was just a kid on a bmx bike and was spending my hard earned money on a burrito.  I just wanted a story to go with my expensive burrito. He was a very nice memorable guy.  I don't feel bad about this review, because he's making a lot of money no matter what I say for this place.

stinky tofu
author: StinkyTofu S.

description:
the seats are a bit uncomfortable, but if your taking it to go then there's no problem.  the food tastes a bit more healthier than other mexican places i've tried; which is a good thing.

the service is ok, they aren't very friendly ... but they do get the job done.  also the place looks fairly clean.

parking is SO DIFFICULT!!

the line doesn't get too long, and even so, it moves pretty fast.  you don't get free chips with salsa which is a con, but ehh ... you win some, you lose some.
author: Pia V.

description: Just got home.. eating a carnitas burrito... it's reliably good with an off chance of being great.  Three stars only because the workers have never, ever, evvver made the slightest effort to actually give a sh*t about the food they are making.  I've never seen any of them even smile.  It's a quasi-miracle the food is actually good considering they could clearly care less.
author: Alex R.

description:
I've been going to Gordo's ever since I was in 6th grade. Maybe that's why I was a fat kid growing up? Every time I find myself in the Richmond district, I always tend to stop by, even if I'm not hungry.. to get something to go.

I typically get a flour quesadilla with the following:
rice, black beans, grilled chicken, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, cheese and hot sauce. 

In my opinion, Gordo's is the best Mexican food I've tasted in the Bay Area. I've tasted better Mexican food in San Diego, but that's a given. The food is fresh, the prices are fairly cheap, and they are quick to make your order how you like it. I don't normally give out 5 stars, but Gordo's definitely deserves it. I'm hungry now!
author: M L.

description: Best Carnitas in town, Bar None!  Been eating at this place my whole life, great prices, a bit greasy, but very good!
author: Joe E.

description:
did you know you can order a burrito cup at gordos?  this recent discovery has made me crave gordos even though i may not be hungry enough for a gigantic burrito!

must order if you cannot devour a super burrito!
author: Carli F.

description: Even after having many delicious burritos all around the city from El Farolito in the mission to Nicks Crispy Tacos to the a delicious chicken gumbo smothered burrito i had in Corvallis. I will always remember and come back to Gordos. They are super quick and delicious and the good part is they are close to my neighborhood and I have been going there for many years now. I realized i haven't wrote a review especially since i came here twice this wk :X. I almost always get the same thing a Super Chicken Burrito with everything! so i may discover new and better burrito places but Gordo's will always be a part of my stomach! :D
author: Jonathan W.

description: Gross. Really gross. Like, I thought I was going to puke and threw away the rest of my food after choking down one taco gross. Rubbery tortillas, mushy rice, chalky beans, bland pico. Stomach continued churning the rest of the day. Maybe it was an off day for the place, but I won't be back to find out.
author: Kerry S.

description:
First off, please allow me to LMAO @ Danie B. below.  This is precisely the type of person that busts me into hysterics at Gordo.

This place is off the chain terrific-O, Carnitas fiesta of pure dope-ness.  Best carnitas anywhere!!!  ANYWHERE!!!!  Their guacamole, although a bit light on the avocado and heavy on the... (sour cream?) has really grown on me.  All-in-all, it's pretty well priced, the staff is chill and knows how to serve it (assuming they don't hate you - coughcoughDanie B.!!!) and the burritos are straight dream-laced salty goodness.
author: Philippe N.

description: Gordo is me and my girlfriends favorite taqueria...I always order the super burrito with boiled chicken..you can't beat it! Although I wish they had more items on the menu..what they do have is good as F***! Inexpensive, Good Quality, Delicious...
author: Allen K.

description:
Hands down favorite burrito place for me.  Close second to El Farolito.   I know, some will disagree but I gotta go with my gut on this one. 

Quick service.  Great tasting burrito with the right combination of rice, beans, and carnitas.....  AND, if you order extra sour cream, well dangit, you get extra sour cream.  Not sure why a lot of other taquerias don't give you the extra but I'm glad that Gordos obliges my craving for a high calorie meal.

Sometimes, it's the simple things in life that make things so much better.
author: Kenneth K.

description:
They have the best guacamole in town.  They don't wrap the burritos, tight like I like them, but most of the time because they add so much meat into mine.  I've always gotten service with a smile and too much stuffing.

Love it!
author: Susan C.

description:
Taste is relative. We all know that. One woman's "go to" joint is another's "avoid at all cost's" category.

I love coming here for my flour quesadilla with rice, beans, chicken, salsa and a little hot sauce. To me it's a little slice of heaven. And sometimes I'll even order a little cup of rice and beans to nosh on as a snack or for lunch tomorrow.

It's simple no frills fare. They don't have a salsa bar. They don't have random mariachi bands wander in. They don't have any aguas frescas. But they do make my favorite quesadilla. And that's all I need.
author: cyndi L.

description:
oh man
where do I begin
I used to live on 21st & California
and I took Gordo's for granted
I would go there about once or twice a week.. and now that I live in marin, I CRAVE Gordo's for breakfast, lunch, and dinner..
I can't live without it
I can almost TASTE the beautiful burrito right now
I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!
Dear Gordo Owner,
PLEASE OPEN A LOCATION IN MARIN, PREFERABLY IN THE LARKSPUR LANDING AREA!!!!!!
i will work there for FREE!!! 
But you probably won't make too much of a profit because I will make myself about 14 burritos per day... god what I wouldn't do for a Gordos BURRITO right now!!!!!!! i love you gordos, I LOVE YOU
author: Brianna B.

description:
I always say I don't like Gordo's but I do.  I quite like Gordo's.  They are the only fast food mexican restaurant in the 'hood so that might be a big factor but they're not bad.  They have carnitas.  They make fat burritos.  They have Jarritos.  Unfortunately you don't get free chips and salsa.  Unfortunately it's overpriced.  Unfortunately their salsa is either bland and not hot at all or really f'ing hot although I do enjoy the really f'ing hot one.  I wish they had fish tacos.  Why don't they have nachos?  WTF?  Gordo's you could EASILY make me nachos.  Why won't you make me nachos Gordo's?  Hmmm?  It's so easy and you have all the fixins.

Someone should start a mexican food joint that delivers.  I would order from you regularly, even if you weren't that great.  Seriously, you'd have a monopoly.  I'd do it myself but don't want a mexican food joint.
author: Dee K.

description:
The first place I checked out when I moved out to the Richmond, decent for a quick lunch and dinner, best enjoyed as a hangover food. The carnitas is very tasty and tender. If you are really hungry go for the Gordo plate, it can leave you full all day.  A good bang for your buck.

**I was there today and it seemed like a zoo... birds and flies everywhere, didn't bother me too much, but I could go without the battle with nature. On the other hand it made me feel like I was in the Mission... go figure
author: Chris F.

description:
There's something about vegetarians and burritos that makes me scratch my head. 


Then I realize I had tofu ice cream and a shot of wheat grass yesterday. Who am I to talk? Hey, tofu is freaking delicious. I'm chinese, tofu was practically my baby formula. That and jok (porridge). 


Anyways. Gordo's my lovely gordo's. I remember when I was a wee lass back in middle school. You served me well back then, when I was indiscriminate about what I put in my stomach. Then I took spanish class and realized Gordo = fat. Let's just say I went from una niña pequeña to....not.

Well, not really. I never really liked this Gordo's for some odd reason. When they say that their quesadilla was an appetitzer, they mean it. it's small, albeit filled with enough beef to make me happy. 


Not somewhere I would go if I'm in a hurry to finish my food (more ends up IN my brown take out bag than on my food), or if I'm not willing to talk to the people behind the counter. 


Señor Burrito man: You want beef or chicken?
Me: Beef, please
Señor: Salsa?
Me: Yeah.
Señor: Beef?
Me: Yeah.
Señor: Salsa?

never fails. 


I just realized, I have never finished a whole burrito from them at one time...half always ends up in my fridge, which disappears the next day. Who the hell is the one idiot who put Gordo's good for "dessert"? You're a riot.
author: tammy m.

description:
Good food, good value.

You'll probably have to ask for jalapenos and hot sauce. The hot sauce is a green chili sauce, more spicy than hot.
author: C G.

description: the burritos are pretty yummy but is it just me or does it smell funny in there?
author: Ashley C.

description: If you're looking for a quick burrito, Gordo's wouldn't be a bad place to make a stop. While not nearly the best burritos I have eaten, they are well priced and should satisfy the average person.
author: Barrett I.

description: Good ass burritos in the Richmond District.  Ya, I like Farolitos and the Mission places better, but really, its like the only place in the Richmond for Burritos (or tacos, also good, and the quesadillas are bomb, they probably lard it up cuz the outside gets all crispy etc).  And its BOMB.  I almost always get the Chile Verde.  Super Delicious.  And like many places, only around $6-$7.  The carnitas are nice too.
author: Sage S.

description: I have been going to Gordo Taqueria for years and I can't imagine going anywhere else. The food is wonderful and is always spot on. They give you plenty of everything...leaving you nice and full for hours to come. My favorite meat is the boiled chicken, but the carnitas is just as tasty. Hands down, I think they have the best burritos in San Francisco.
author: Holly F.

description:
Gordo's burritos are the greatest burritos on earth, and the burritos against which all others are compared.

There are fine burritos in the Mission, but nothing comes close.
author: Colleen B.

description:
It gets one star for being brave enough to have a mexican restaurant in Outer Richmond...
and another star for being slightly edible, and at least not making me sick.
No more stars past that... I have already been too generous. The meat is dry (apparently). The cheese is in nasty processed slices.  And ordering 'Super' doesn't mean you get sour cream OR guac extra.. OR that it is even bigger! Pretty lame. And the food isn't even tasty. bland bland bland. Guess I'll hit Panchos or Chinos, if the craving takes me...
author: Tiffany M.

description: Update: Finally cracked the code. Just stay away from the meat and beans and rice.  Got a tasty quesadilla with guac only for 3 bucks. Pretty good, actually.
author: Robert K.

description:
Yes, they make a big fat burro.  Sometimes they skimp on the meat portion of the recipe, but that can be cured by asking them to alter the ratio of rice/beans/meat or simply asking for all-meat.

Everyone behind the counter is friendly, and tolerate well all the gringos who will practice their taqueria-spanish here.

Usually plenty of uncomfortable seating around, and the satellite dish is usually showing futbol.  

Be sure to get there about an hour before closing if you want a selection of meats though, they run out towards the end, don't bother replenishing as it gets near closing time.
author: Ken B.

description:
Gordos is great! Most everything is pretty good here! Not sure about the quality of some of the ingredients but It is fresh due to the high amount of people coming in and out! 

I don't know what people are talking about service wise!!! The place is freaking busy and its all about business! And how can they mess your order up when your watching them make everything right in front of you?
author: hel la m.

description:
For those that care nothing for quality service, ingredients, or preparation, then Gordo's is the place for you. 

The food is prepared soullessly by disrespectful employees. Upon my last visit, my little brother was served a quesadilla that was sloppily put together, and his friend, given a terrible burrito carelessly put together with beans and cheese that were specified to be given in moderation. All the while, the servers, unaware of my fluency in Spanish, insulted the hell out of us as they made our food with ennui. Needless to say, we won't be going back anytime soon.  

Take the Geary or Balboa street bus a little farther to Chino's for some quality Mexican food in the Richmond. Cheap, plastic-tasting food doesn't warrant this kind of disrespect.
author: Marcello W.

description: The burritos here are soggy, messy, overly salty, and lacking in flavor.  Unfortunately, the Richmond District really lacks a good burrito joint.  If you're really craving one, head over to El Farolito on Mission and 24th instead.
author: Anthony H.

description:
Gordo's is two things: tasty and cheap.

Sure, they steam their tortillas when they have a flat top right behind them.  Sure, they dip their quesadillas in oil and proceed to shallow fry them and stuff cold ingredients in them.  Sure, their staff is absolutely indifferent about their customers... These are all reasons WHY I go there (minus the steamed tortillas).

If I don't want to be bothered or chat with anyone or be convinced to buy a bunch of extra stuff, Gordo's is where I go.

Some tips for going to this location of Gordo's:

1) Decide everything you want before you get to the counter.
2) Try their refried beans and carnitas.
3) Their guacamole has pico de gallo and sour cream in it already, so it's kind of an all-in-one.
4) Always get extra green sauce.  It's super flavorful and has little heat.
5) Steer clear of the quesadillas.  I hate to say, they make them really bad.

My favorite thing to get from Gordo's are the tacos.  Simple, fast, cheap, delicious.  My personal favorite is grilled chicken and guacamole.

On a final note, this is the CLEANEST burrito place ever.  They are beyond serious about their food safety.
author: Gavin S.

description:
This would have been 4 stars, but I think I had one too many burritos to maintain a high rating. On top of that, I've actually been to another Mexican place that I like more. 

I'm not even going to bother writing about the service, so i'll jump straight into the food. The burritos are a hit to me and it's probably the most popular order for me. It doesn't matter which meat you choose, but the best ones are grilled chicken and the carnitas. The salsa seems fresh and the guacamole is awesome. Add beans at your own discretion. 

Another alternative to the burritos is the Gordo special dishes like the Gordo plate, which is essentially every part of a burrito or taco in separated sections of a take-out tray. There's plenty of rice, meat, salsa, sour cream and guacamole that would make the Gordo plate a feast for anyone. It includes some flour tortillas, so you could make your own soft tacos if you like, or do what I usually do and take everything and turn it into Mexican fried rice. 

The other alternative is the Gordo cup for the budget minded individual. Similar to the Gordo plate in terms of content, but in a "cup" or a small tupperware-like container. It's usually packed to the rim, so be careful when you open it. 

Gordo's is a good place for Mexican, but I see it as fast Mex. Whether you like a big meal (Super Burritos, Gordo Plate) or like smaller fares (Tacos and Gordo Cup), there's always some thing that will fit your stomach.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Simply fantastic. I'm a pretty simple guy, with pretty simple tastes, so maybe die-hard Mexican foodies will disagree with me on this... but Gordo is my number one pick for Mexican food in SF.

With good portion sizes at good prices, a clean sitting area and kitchen, you can't go wrong. I'm sure that some people will argue that you'll only find good Mexican food in the Mission, but if you're just a poor, uncultured schlub looking for A+ Mexican food in the Richmond District... go here!

A couple of notes: This location is far superior to the one on 9th Ave. I haven't been to the one on Clement in about 6 years, so I can't vouch for that one either. If you're in the East Bay, check out the Gordo on College in Berkeley/Oakland!
author: Alex C.

description:
A solid Mexican taqueria.  Hefty burritos, overflowing tacos, greasy quesidillas - what else would you expect?  I wish they had horchata, but nonetheless, it's a spot I frequent.

Mix it up by going for the spinach or tomato flour tortilla.  Man up with all meat (one kind of meat), no rice.  Very tasty.
author: Qyon G.

description:
My native-San Franciscan friends and I lovingly refer to this as the "good Gordos". Actually the Clement Street one was the "good Gorods" until about a year ago. One must not have high expectations of fancy burritos with lots of extras, Gordos is a straight burrito/quesadilla taqueria--
the chips aren't great and there are no sides to be had, but the burriots and quesadillas are to die for.

And for those of you not in the know, here's a little fun fact. The steamers used at Gordos and some other San Francisco taquerias are in fact native to San Francisco as well:

"The San Francisco burrito is distinguished partly by the amount of rice and other side dishes included in the package and partly by sheer size. A food critic working for the San Francisco Chronicle counted hundreds of taquerias in the San Francisco Bay Area, and noted that the topic of which taqueria makes the best burrito can 'encourage fierce loyalty and ferocious debate'"

Also:

"Two key technologies that made the San Francisco burrito possible are the large flour tortilla and tortilla steamers, which together increase the flexibility, stretch, and size of the resulting tortilla. The tortilla steamer saturates the gluten-heavy tortilla with moisture and heat, which increase the capacity of the tortilla to stretch without breaking. This in turn allows for the size of the San Francisco burrito."

From Wikipedia.com (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco_Burrito)
author: Michelle D.

description:
In my house, there is an ongoing conversation about creating the perfect San Francisco burrito using ingredients from all over the city. My perfect burrito would include many ingredients from Gordo Taqueria. 

I was wary of Gordo when I first started coming almost 5 years ago. I was raised on authentically Mexican taquerias (an upbringing that still leads me to order my burritos sans rice) and wasn't accustomed to the San Francisco burrito experience. Let me tell you, I am now. This fine cuisine has grown on me and I now get cravings only Gordo can satisfy.

I want to say it's all in the steamed tortilla, but that doesn't work because I love the quesadillas as much as the burritos. Giant flour tortillas fried, packed with as much filling as a super burrito, and then folded in thirds. Oh, and the corn quesadilla. The dear, dear corn quesadilla. The beef corn is a family favorite, but I recently became addicted to a veggie version - black beans, guacamole, and pico. Juicy, messy, lard-soaked goodness. 

Oh, and I must mention the boiled chicken. Really, most of the meats are great (beef, carnitas, boiled chicken, or grilled chicken - I stay away from the chile verde because of a chile allergy, and avoid like the plague the al pastor offered at certain locations, but must admit I don't like al pastor at any taqueria), but my usual order has become two corn quesadillas (one black bean, one boiled chicken) when dining there, and a boiled chicken burrito when taking it to-go. The black or pinto beans are firm and flavorful and I did a lot of research deciding which beans to pair with which meat, but the refried beans are flavorless and should be skipped.

But, more than anything, my love belongs to the Gordo guacamole. Not as pure as the mashed avocados found at La Taqueria in the Mission, but my favorite part of any order. Something about this goopy green mess has become a part of my soul. I want to slather my body with the stuff. One of my worst memories is when we went to the 9th & Irving location just before close and they were out. Out of guacamole. At first I thought the guy was joking. How could it be? A nightmare! Good thing we go to the Geary location a couple times a week, so my craving was satisfied a couple days later, or I would have continued in a distraught state indefinitely. Phew. Disaster averted!
author: Veronica L.

description:
The only thing that is good here is how they throw your tortilla on the grill and let the cheese melt. Other than that this place is pretty ehhhhhh. It's lame how they make you pay for each add on. It's like hey, why not just offer a bigger menu like every other damn Mexican place?

We really do need better Mexican places in the Richmond.

We need cooks like Nacho Libre.
author: Lee M.

description: My new mantra needs to be that if the staff of an establishment makes you feel like you are ruining their day by walking in, it's time to turn around.  The burrito didn't have much flavor and the taste profile was dominated by the soggy tortilla. The place was dirty and the seats uncomfortable.
author: S L.

description: Not a huge fan of burritos, but this place can be one of my favorite...Decent portion. I usually order the chicken burrito with everything but beans in it. And I'm usually able to finish the regular one.... I guess that means something from someone who doesn't like burritos right? I like the chicken, it's not too dry. I'll come here if I am around the area and craving for burrito....which is rarely but occasionally I would, but it's always busy around dinner time, there's a loooonggg line, so if u can just call in to order and pick up or go earlier or later....because parking can be horrible out there....
author: Helen T.

description:
Take out anyone? Good ! Fast!  Carnitas, Carne Asade, Chile Verde all too good and cheap! How can you feed a family of 4 for under $ 15.00 dollars? 
Service is okay- just a little smile and por favore and thank your lucky stars this Richmond delight is here!
author: Grace A.

description:
This review is only for CARNITAS. If you dnt like carnitas youre seriously delusional. Gordos has great carnitas burritos and for 5 bucks what have you got to lose? 

I come here often and once they were out of carnitas. The carne asada was mediocre and i left without even finishing half. 

It can get annoying that the line is always out the door but hey itll be worth it.

 Minus a point for the immature mexican guys talking smack behind the counter. soy mexicana! i understand what youre saying!!!
author: Jasmine M.

description: Im pretty sure this place is named after the guy who served us. Anyway, this place was dirty, napkins and trash on the floor, dingy and dark inside, and the food in the metal trays looked like it had been sitting all day. The carnitas were dry and the rice tasteless. Not to mention our burrito maker stared at the t.v. the whole time and kept forgetting what we were telling him to put on our burrito while yelling in Spanish to his coworker. With all of the asian places in the hood its hard to find something else to eat. I was hoping for a good mexican joint and all I got was a bland taste in my mouth and bad gas.
author: M K.

description: I'm a native San Franciscan, I love my unauthentic super burritos wrapped in foil, and Gordo is THE place to get them.  I don't give a shit what people say.  I've had the rest, but I still consider them the best.
author: Jenn C.

description: not sure about bad reviews , been coming here for years and food consistently ok, i can agree with one of the yelpers about the stuff (just need to have smile ones in the while) but otherwise great , inexpensive place to grab quick bite.
author: SF G.

description: Great burritos, BUT watch out for the cashier. On three occasions they tried to charge me for sour cream when I did not order it. Once is a mistake, twice is a coincidence, but three times is an unethical business strategy.  Good food, but watch out at the cash register.
author: Gary S.

description:
Gordo's is a Bay Area classic and as usual the cooks do a great job providing quick service and quality meat (try the boiled chicken!). I eat here once a week and the quality is consistent but so are the long lines. Call your order in ahead of time.

I'm a Bay Area local and Gordo's has been on my A list since I was a kid...
author: Mike M.

description:
One of the BEST burritos' I have ever had...and I am from South San Francisco where there are HELLA taqueria's on just one street.

The burrito is a pretty decent size and they pack it with an overage of food. 

The only two complaints I have is that chips and salsa don't come complimentary and my burrito wasn't wrapped very tightly...but with that I did go there after Bay to Breakers and they were SUPER BUSY...so they might have been rushed.  This is something that I am going to be craving for!!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
It took me a while to get around to reviewing Gordo because I have such mixed feelings about the place.

First, after spending so much time in San Diego, it's hard for me to call any burrito up here really "good," but I guess Gordo is close enough. I guess.

The service is slow. Somehow. It takes 30 seconds to make a burrito, but I've stood in line here for 15 minutes. Seems impossible, but it happens. I also get really pissed at customers, yea, you all, who come in with a list of 10 burritos you want made, except you really don't know what you want. So you argue with the guy over the glass in Spanglish for 5 minutes about what kind of beans you want. Burrito after burrito. If your buddy isn't with you, they shouldn't get to eat. But I guess that's not Gordo's fault.

Anyway... A slice of cheese? In a burrito? I feel like I really should be giving the place 2 stars, but where the hell else am I going to get a burrito in the Richmond.... oh yea.... a different Gordo. The guys aren't really all that nice either. There's no smile or hello or emotion whatsoever. 

They're not "good" burritos. They're burritos you eat because San Diego is too far to go for lunch.
author: jared c.

description: Great food.  Questionable hygiene.  One of the guys making burritos goes to the bathroom with his cell phone.  He comes out  -let's assume he washed his hands.  He goes back on cell phone again.  Then he makes my burrito.  No gloves.  No gloves is fine, if I know hands are clean and not touching the surface of something that is probably not clean.    Ewwwwwwww.
author: Paul G.

description: The measure of a great taqueria is the delivery of a great bean, cheese, and rice burrito. It is simple, so it shouldn't be hard to F*ck up. However,  this place manage to do just that. First, the beans we de la olla, which is not bad, but they should have been re-fried. The rice lacked flavor, and the cheese looked like a kraft single before it was launched into the "heat press" to warm the flour tortilla. It was reminiscent of chipotle; however, at least chipotle has flavor! Then the guy asked, "would you like tomatoes?" I said, "no." He proceeds to add them anyway. As I was paying for my burrito, the guy starts talking sh*t in Spanish. Little does he know I that I know Spanish, fluently. Now, how did it taste? Just imagine chef Gordon Ramsey on kitchen nightmares tasting a god awful dish and picture his facial expression. IT WAS MIERDA! I will not be coming back.
author: Adrian G.

description:
Location, location, location.  If Gordo's were on Valencia, it would be in trouble.  But it's on Geary.  In the Richmond.  And so the burrito matches the neighborhood-- solid, dense, but a little bland in spots.  It shouldn't be a destination, rather part of the journey.

Extra star for the salsa-- which you have to pay for (booo), but they give you so much you can take it home for later, or use to liven up your burrito.
author: Jeff M.

description:
So-so service. Decent-sized super burrito.  I had a veggie burrito here and they were able to honor my requests for a veggie burrito, although, I got the feeling that the big guy behind the grill felt a real-man must eat meat!  

In fact, as I recall the server's first inclination was was to scoop some char-burnt black beef cube substance into my burrito had I not insisted on no meat.  I sat down and ate in the smallish dinning area where a TV was on the news or something but in Spanish. Overall, this wasn't quite as authentic as going into the Mission on 24th Street by Folsom where on a weekend you'll like see them serve up food into the wee hours of the morning right out on the street in front of their shop.
author: Ed M.

description:
Honestly I go there when I'm in a rush... and sometimes I regret it... the last couple of times the tomato tortilla have been staled :( and the spinach ones too... 

I went there a couple of weeks ago and after an hour... the burrito was a brick in my stomach

The bigger dude I find is rude... and just slops the stuff on the burritos... the other guys though do a better job
author: Peta C.

description:
Ooh Gordo's, my first burrito love. I started coming here my senior year of high school and since my friend Antonia lives only 4 blocks away on Fulton and they are perfect for us lazy, broke college students that know you better walk instead of hoping to find parking anywhere along Geary!!

And I believe they have finally started accepting cards sometime earlier this year. Thweet. I just wish they had horchata. Every time I go and ask, but alas, none yet.
author: Daneca V.

description:
A few months ago I was eating at Gordo 3-5 times a week, at about $5-6/ visit.  That makes around $90 per month.  Now?  I just went there for the first time this month and it sucked, as usual.

I should probably rate Gordo 1 star, the way it's tasted lately, but I have strong memories of amazing, 5-star burritos I've had in the past that prevent me from doing that.

There is no problem with the decor, the employees, the presentation.  There is no problem with selection, and they are very fast.

The only problem is the food is crap, possibly literally.  I'm eating my burrito and a bite or two are delicious, and then suddenly you feel like you've bitten into... something rotten.  Either the meat tastes like it's three days old, or the beans do.  It's always something.  The carnitas are insanely good one day and crap the next.  Same for the carne asada (beef).   And the problem with getting a burrito at a place that uses shady ingredients (or keeps good ones for too long) is that there are so many ways it can go wrong.

With a quesadilla, at least, there are fewer ingredients - less can go wrong.  I love the corn (tortilla) quessadilla.  They can't mess up the tortilla or the cheese, really, so all you need to pray for is that the meat isn't "off" yet.  Of course, that's usually the first thing that goes off.  And when they can't even get the corn quesadillar right, I give up.  I would rather spend my $5-$6 per day somewhere else, where I don't consistently develop facial twitches of disgust when I'm trying to provide my body with essential nutrition.

A couple more things:  someone else mentioned stinginess.  They have been WAY STINGY lately as well.  I pay extra for guacomole, and they barely put any on the burrito.  Can I bring my own? They also skimp on the (rotten) meat (which could be a good thing).  I assume that their boss is trying to cut costs.  The best guy to get to make your burrito would be THE NEW GUY (whoever hasn't yet been told that the best way to run a burrito joint is to keep the customers hungry).  But none of this matters when the food quality is crap.

Gordo, pay up.  Buy fresher ingredients.  Throw away old meat.  Apparently, the lines have gotten too long lately and you needed to scare some people away.  I'm gone, until you need me again.
author: Nick B.

description: Being a generic Geary street Russian I've been coming to this gordos since I was 14 , 22 now and nothing has changed, it's as good today as when I used to skip 5th period at wash to get my Super Steak W/everything fix. 95 % of the time it's good and hits the spot, once in a blue moon I'll get a dried out tortilla or not enough of a certain ingredient. Gordos isn't El Farolito, it's a different type of burrito, more wet ingredients, I would love to go to the mission for a great burrito but let's be realistic I'm an avenue ruskie and my Armani jeans and leather jacket don't fit in there, so gordos thank you for providing me with 8 years of memories.
author: Sergey A.

description:
I pretty much never give negative reviews ...

so this is the only location of gordos I've been to. the first time I went was last year and I thought it was bomb. 

I've been going to gordos recently because it's close to my gym. don't judge, after a workout the black bean and chicken taco is perfect for refueling! anyway, I don't have that many bad things to say. the taco gets the job done. the chicken isn't dry like some places and I basically love anything with sour cream on it. 

the problem I have is 2 specific employees working there. it's so weird. they are rude, but in a subtle way. 

it's like, "WOULD IT KILL YOU TO SMILE!?" I want to scream at the woman taking the money. I'm sorry you hate your life, but I didn't choose your job for you. 

oh, and the guy making my food? ... this is usually how the conversation goes:

him: -staring at me blankly

me: "chicken taco with black beans please"

him: -turns around for 5 seconds to put my tortilla on the grill

him: "what kinda beans?"

me: "black beans"

him: -speaking over me in spanish to the cook

him: "what kinda beans?"

me: "black beans"

him: -again speaking over me in spanish to the cook

him: "what kinda beans?"

me: "BLACK BEANS!" 

and I'm not exaggerating, this actually happened. so fucking ridiculous. I shouldn't keep going back, but there aren't many taqueria options in the richmond. grrrr.
author: Leslie S.

description:
People who come to Gordo's usually either find it bland or great. I, obviously, am in the great camp. 

I'm a chicken super burrito kind of person. I pretty much order the same thing no matter what mexican place I'm at. When it comes to the Richmond, let's be honest - there aren't a lot of choices. Gordo's consistently delivers warm, moist super chicken burritos for not a lot of dough. You can also order different tortilla or call ahead and pick it up. (Recommended if you are in the after work crowd)
author: Astrea W.

description: Yum yum and yum. I'm actually mad at my roommate for introducing me to this place since it is on the other side of town. Fresh delicious homemade burritos for a GOOD price! Pretty much like a healthier and more delicious Chipolte.
author: Jenny I.

description: Believe it or not, but my Rabbi turned me onto this place. The Carnitas are to die for, and one taco is all you need to feel well fed. the food is great and the portions are HUGE for not much money at all.
author: Thomas E.

description:
Gordo is the spot for burritos in San Francisco.    I started my relationship with Gordo 7 years ago when I first moved to the city and found myself in the Richmond.   I happened upon Gordo's my first week in town and have never looked back.   I moved away from the hood for 5 years, but now I'm back and have hit Gordo's twice in as many weeks. 

Personally I recommend the Super Carnitas burrito.    

BTW - the same people are still working there from 7 years ago....
author: Craig D.

description: service sucks and everything is really watery. They keep all the meat and beans in a pool of liquid of some sort, looks gross. normally they cook burritos in front of you but this place they just place the foods that are kept warm for god knows how long into your meal.
author: Jack L.

description:
You cannot compare this burrito to a Mission burrito. But its in the Richmond, and they are reasonably fast. Two recommendations: 

1) Get some Chorizo!
2) Don't make me watch you put the burrito together!
author: Gary B.

description:
This is my default taqueria. The burritos are descent sized, they have pinto, black, and refired beans for those of us who like to switch it up, and their hot sauce is pretty bomb. The carne asada burrito is my fav. However, their salsa is only mediocre and their carnitas suck. And I wish they would use shredded cheese instead of sliced. 

All in all I give them a B+ to an A-.
author: Nicole T.

description:
Gordos is an excellent value for people who want something decent on the cheap.

Get the super Buritto for around five dollars, and be full without the stomach pain other fast food offers.

It's a no frills restaurant with minimal indoor seating but who cares? It's a bargain in a city where ten dollars or more is frequently the case.

I'm a vegetarian, so I can't speak for the quality of the meat, but occasionally the food gets old sitting in the tubs, so try to time it if you can :-)

Enjoy!
author: Jonah R.

description: Gordo Taqueria.  What can I say ?  Service, or even a smile, completely non existent.  Food quality, standard, nothing stands out.  The clincher, no complimentary chips and salsa.  Not recommended, the good reviews are probably by people that a) never had a burrito before, or b) love bland food served by unfriendly folks.
author: Mark W.

description: Large , yummy burritos that hit the spot. My only complaint is that they do not have chopped onions and cilantro on the side- only in the salsa. The service is quick and generally friendly. Great for grabbing a bite on the go.
author: Melinda Q.

description: Ok food, but the guys are jerks. Second time my burrito had "BTCH" written on it. (And no, there were no confrontations, disagreements, etc. when ordering. I think they just think it's funny.) I know they would say "Beans, Tomatoes, cheese" but the nicer guy at the register actually crossed it out and wrote "BB (black beans)". Anyhow, it bums me out when people are jerks for no reason. Won't be going back...
author: Kristy H.

description:
mmm not so much.

considering that the best mexican food in the city is a 20 minute bus ride from my house, i guess i might be back if i'm feeling really desperate. but, considering that i have lived in this neighborhood for a year, i crave mexican food everyday, & have only been here twice, i'm just not THAT desperate.
author: Lizzy L.

description: ok the food is good blah blah blah.. Customer service is also important and that fat dude there doesn't have one. When i get my lunch there i always make sure i go to the guy on the end coz he's more reasonable than that customer hatin fat guy.
author: Eddie 'bhong' V.

description: Whenever I go back to the city, this is one stop I have to make. I usually get the carnitas quesadilla and it is sooo yummy! Gordo's is my favorite place to satisfy a craving for mexican food. You'd think I'd be able to find a comparable place in socal, especially with santa ana being right around the corner but not yet, I'm still searching. In the meantime, I'm going to have to keep finding excuses to make the 400+ mile drive to the city just so I can drop in here.
author: Jen C.

description: Right around the corner from my home, so this Gordo's is very convenient. But, alas, the burritos are so bland. Where's the flavor? Now my favorite place for burritos is El Farolito. I've been going there for over 25 years and their flavor is "home" to me,whether it is the 24th & Alabama shop, the Mission and 24th site or even the  Grand Ave shop in South SF. The taste is tconsistently goodl. But, I don't always want to get into the car to go across the City, so, yes, I will walk around the corner and buy a Gordo's burrito on occassion. Sorry Gordo's I wanted to like you, but you've got to improve on the flavor!
author: Sarita E.

description: This place looks dirty and I always feel dirty after eating here, but they make a good burrito so I keep coming back...
author: Bucky K.

description: No a bad spot if you live in the hood, would not go out of my way to eat here, but  also would not go to across town to get a burrito either. All in all it is what it is; quality cheap eats..
author: Vince S.

description: good average burrito. i would come here since it is near by. slice of melted cheese on tortilla, beans, salsa for their veggie burrito. bag of chips extra. this sort of reminds me of chipotle but slightly better. slightly.
author: AL S.

description: The standard bearer in good super burritos. They're consistent, and they're good, and for this Sunset native, worth not having to drive to the mission. Every time I go, it makes me sad that they use some processed guacamole. But that's forgivable, because they make good burritos. The other thing that makes me upset is they don't give you free chips. But that's forgivable, because they make good burritos.
author: Drew Y.

description: I like this place because it's close to my house and it's fast GOOD food. The only problem is that sometimes when ordering they can't hear you so it gets pretty repetitive. Most of my guy friends go for a super burrito, so if you're a big eater get one or two of those. I get a regular, it'll last me a good day. I finished mine at home and I craved some more. So thumbs up! But of course if you want more of a selection go to the Mission...
author: Kimberly S.

description:
gordo's will always hold a space in my heart

it brings back memories of when i used to attend St. Monica's.
i always get the super burrito with spinach tortilla.. usually carne asada (what can i say.. i'm a carnivore).. and with everything and anything they can put into it..

when i went back recently, it wasn't as AMAZING as i had remembered..
sigh~
perhaps it was my burrito naivety.. or perhaps it's taste changed.. 
but all in all..
an OK burrito
author: monica c.

description: If I didn't care whether I resembled a hippopotamus I would eat here every day.  I have been coming here forever (starting with the one on College Avenue in Berkeley when I was in junior high).  It is the PERFECT HANGOVER FOOD - much better than greasy leftover pizza, or even my usual Balboa Burger and bloody mary.  I usually get a gigantic super burrito with tons of melted cheese and boiled chicken (don't get the grilled, trust me), but most of my friends get the quesdadilla (which is basically a burrito because you can stuff it with everything).  I make it out here at least once a week from Russian Hill (a half hour trip on a good day).  It is that good.
author: Liz C.

description: I feel like anybody who has ever dissed this place has not tried the Carnitas.  Carnitas= 5 stars  Minus one star because the chubby worker guy seems to hate my sister and I.
author: Marisa M.

description: 4.5 stars. Really good burritos and 'dillas
author: Kacie M.

description: That's right, I'm giving 5 stars to a taqueria.  I can't believe I didn't rate this place sooner, it's one of my fav places in the city.  I've been going here for 11 years...that's more than half of my life people! In these years nothing has changed, not the awesome burritos, not the decor, not the people.....i realize this actually sounds bad, but I think they have a formula for success. Why fix what ain't broke, right? Everything is always fresh and made just like I love it.  My granddad hates mexican food and even he can't turn down a Gordo plate, and why would he? And why would you? And why haven't you gone there yet?
author: Aristocles P.

description: Don't go anywhere else for burritos. I lived abroad for three years and probably missed Gordos over everything else. Get it done and go to Gordo's if you are in the market for one of the world's best burritos. Know how some burrito places have cold ingredients inside the warm burrito? Not Gordos. Know how some places have too juicy meat that makes your tortilla worthless? Not Gordos. Know how some places overcharge you for just a rice stuffed tortilla. Not Gordos. I could go on and on...
author: Kane R.

description: Chicken is not vegetarian. I don't care what the guys who work here say -- chicken in my burrito is not a vegetarian burrito. Not once, but twice I have ordered a vegetarian burrito and they put chicken in it. One time when I complained they immediately made me a new one. The other time, the guy making the burritos said "well, it's not meat like carnitas or anything." Okay true. Chicken is not as "meaty" as steak or pork, but it's still from an animal and I didn't want it. And once I got the veggie burrito, it wasn't that great. With all the other burrito places in the city, I'm not sure why you would go here (other than because it's the closest one to you).
author: Rebecca H.

description: The burritos here are OK.  They're decent sized and come with some solid beans and nice.  After that, I can't name too many positives.  The staff is so preoccupied with muttering to themselves you have to tell them "chicken burrito" three times.  And while I appreciate the speed, I'd rather have a wider range menu.
author: John H.

description:
as expected there will be much debate over the "best mexican food in the bay area" but this is the horse i am riding to glory. gordo is understated and no-frills and the food is off the chain. i've never gotten anything i wouldn't order two of next time. once, while tipsy, i ordered my favorite burrito, inhaled it on the way home and then my stomach promptly rejected it. so, i did the obvious thing and marched back down there and bought another one which stayed firmly lodged in my corpus and sent me to shangri-la. hooray for binge eating!!

affordable and delectable; this is everything i want in a burrito|mexican spot. i am going to have them cater my wedding and then i will get divorced so that i can do it again.

and as for the clowns who complain about the 'service' - give it a rest. it's a cafeteria-model burrito joint, there are no sommeliers, no chefs in white hats and no maitre'ds. you order what you want and you get it and sit down and stuff your face. simple, easy and satisfying.

menu tips for the challenged:
pollo blanco in your burrito
carnitas quesadilla - corn

p.s.  refried beans are demon spawn
p.p.s. don't go to a burrito place for chips, go for the FOOD
author: W G.

description: This place actually has good sized burritos with good quality tortillas. It's convenient, and not too expensive. The downsides are: the service quality isn't too good. The staff just seems lazy sometimes, but they're okay. Also, the menu is somewhat limited (no nachos for example). Also the place is usually kinda dirty looking inside. Slightly expensive for a taqueria, but not bad. I'll keep coming here due to convenience and the good taste.
author: Aleksey Z.

description: Best burrito in the city - super carnitas and grilled chicken for sure. I ran here from the marina the other night after being away from the place for 24 hours - couldn't help myself. The big guy behind the counter is super unfriendly and skimps on meat, so try to get Carols (with the SF hat) at all costs. The big guy also spends quite a bit of time in the bathroom, which is sketchy.
author: Michael D.

description: Burritos are O.K., but any other day, a trip to the Mission is far more rewarding if you're looking for huge, tasty, cheap (super) burritos.
author: Richard D.

description: I guess it isn't all about how the burrito looks right? Just as long as it taste good. Anyways my burrito was not even round the guy did not roll the burriot well enough! It tasted good though. I love the grilled chicken. They do not put enough cheese. Bad service, but I guess it does not really matter. Or does it.
author: Janet Z.

description:
i didn't like burritos until gordo's. then i loved it. then i ate it. every.single.day. my boyfriend and his mom frequent this location in particular. they don't cook so it's gordo's maybe 3 times a week and they buy enough so that they don't have to go a day without it. (i'm not exaggerating. well not exactly, anyway.) i don't like wet burritos. if you do, this isn't really the place for you. get a super. and guac. and pico de gallo. 

except. the service is just... okay. there's one guy in particular who gives us the smallest burrito ever. i've observed - it's just us. i think he hates us. no, really. i think he does.
author: Mel L.

description: This is my first time writing a review on Yelp, but let me tell you I came on here JUST to write that Gordo's makes the best burrittos I have ever had HANDS DOWN. I love the super burritto with guacamole and sour cream. Its HUGE and its yummy.
author: Anna T.

description: My favorite burrito in San Francisco.  I can't tell you how many times I've come here.  Used to come here once a week.  Now not as often that I moved farther away, but I still make the drive!  Worth it.
author: Scott C.

description: By far, one of the better tasting taqueria's in the city. But, sheesh, everytime I go here (and I grew up eating at the place on Sundays) they could never get me the correct pricing. Sometimes my final price included tax, other times it did not. So, what am I supposed to pay anyway?!
author: Jj H.

description: So after deciding that it's going to be a Gordo's night, my boyfriend and I then have to argue about which one to go to.  Since he usually pays, we usually go to the Clement location, but this one is my favorite.  I'm consistent, so it's almost always the super carne asada with extra hot sauce.  The seasoning on the steak is licious and goes really well with the fresh guac.  It's reasonably priced, you're in and out in under 10 minutes on moderately busy days and best of all, I usually have enough for two meals.
author: Jasmine L.

description: OK -- I really want to love this place - go about once a month - but I always come away feeling it is pretty bland and tasteless.  I will keep going back because it is fairly close and not terrible.  If I have the time I drive to La Taqueria in the Mission -- blows this place away.
author: Phil C.

description: I'm Mexican I normally hate this kind of places. Burritos are not real Mexican food people!!!!! Well my boyfriend wanted a burrito so we went in. I had my cute puppy with me and they said it was okay to let him stay while we ordered. Most places make us take him outside (meanies!). They asked me why I wasn't getting anything I told, how many Mexicans actually eat burritos? They laughed and agreed. They told me to try it anyway, so I agreed. It was pretty good. I'll never be a fan of burritos, but if I had to pick, this is the only place I'll eat them from.
author: Salma L.

description: I wouldn't come here if I didn't live in the area.  That being said, it's a pretty decent burrito but I wish they had more salsa choices.  I end up going home and piling on more of my own jalapenos and hot sauce...Don't get the guacamole.
author: Derrick V.

description: I had the carnitas.  The tortilla is processed and cold.  I want my tortilla warm and grilled.  The burrito didn't have any complexity.  It was just mushed ingredients that turned the tortilla cold.  I ate it once and I won't eat it again.  Sorry Gordos.  Plus parking here is a biatch.
author: Fatty A.

description: I'm sorry, Gordo's!! I've heard such great things about you, but that burrito just didn't hit the spot.
author: Audrey T.

description: This Gordo's is my roommate's favorite burrito place.  Whenever we go up to SF, she wants to stop by.  I've been to it twice thus far.  As a vegetarian, the selection can be fairly slim but you definitely get your money's worth since it's inexpensive and quick.
author: Lloyd C.

description: granted this isn't REAL authentic mexican food, but it sure hits the spot when you're having a major burrito craving.  usually i get my super carne asada on spinach wrap w/ black beans and everything on it.  SO GOOD !  this location seems to make their stuff better and are more generous with their extras than all the other gordo's that i've been to in the city.  no complaints here.
author: Jeannie W.

description: Great fast mexican food! I love the carnitas quesadilla with rice beans, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and hot sauce. Delish! Big portions that it's almost impossible to finish everything in one sitting. I am sooo lucky that it's right on the corner of where I live!
author: Cynthia S.

description: great food, clean, decent service. I highly recommend the gordo plate to make your own tacos!
author: renee m.

description:
Bleh,

The burritos aren't even that good, and the guys who wrap the burritos don't wear gloves.  They keep cleaning up the counter with a dirty wet rag that looks like it is teaming with bacteria, and I'm surprised that I didn't get food poisoning.  Seriously tho, how come they don't wear gloves when wrapping my burrito?  Isn't that a health code violation?

Also, the burrito itself was flavorless, and there was noone cooking meat in the back to indicate any freshness whatsoever.   Like Taqueria Pancho villa in the mission much better! On  a positive note tho, the prices are cheap!
author: Michele Y.

description: Wow. There is an apparent rivalry between local Mexican places Pancho's and this excuse for food. I think I know who wins. The burritos are awfully dry and tastless, as well as long lines for the food. I have heard nothing but praise about this place, but it is not good at all. No sour cream without asking ... WHAT? Avoid this place AT ALL COSTS
author: Samantha W.

description: I went to this joint on a recommendation from a coworker.  She definitely put way too much hype on it, cuz this place was kinda on the sucky side.  I got a carnitas super burrito, and was not impressed at all.  The biggest flavor I tasted in the burrito was that of salt.  Not that the food was over salty, just that there wasnt much of any other flavor--just NaCl.  My overall feeling is that Gordos is a place to get a boring burrito, and I'm trying not to do that anymore.
author: Peter N.

description: This is one of my favorite taquerias in the city.  It's one of the best burritos I've had in SF, simple and straightforward ingredients.  The super burritos are huge, so if you get one don't plan on doing too much afterwards.  The real gem here is the carnitas.  It's some of the best in the city. If that crack-like pork is your thing, this is heaven.
author: Brian S.

description: Got the regular carnitas burrito, and even with the hold on the rice, sour cream, and guac, it still ended up being a very filling burrito.  They were quite generous with the beans, which I had to scrape a lot of it out.  For some reason, the burritos from this location is always so greasy by the time you get down to the last bite.
author: Lisa C.

description:
This is the best deal in the bay area.  Please don't bother to look any further.  You can get full on beans, rice, salsa and meat  for under $5.  They don't do fancy here.  If you need a salsa bar with 20 choices so you can fill up a bunch of little plastic cups then feel free to spend $10 somewhere else. 

You can't go wrong with a gordo plate, burrito, super burrito, quesadilla or taco.   They all pretty much use the same ingredients yet somehow manage to taste different.  If this was ebay I'd say A+++++++++++
author: Joe M.

description: I am not a huge fan of Mexican food but I like Gordo's.  Ever since elementary school, I've been going to Gordo's (at the Clement location and then Geary when they opened this one) for their cups (basically rice, your choice of meat and beans, and the usual fixings of salsa, guacamole and sour cream).  I always get it with rice, grilled chicken, salsa, extra sour cream and extra hot sauce.  Of course, it was cheaper and bigger back in the day.  Nowadays, it costs about $1.50 or so, but it still makes a cheap and tasty afternoon snack.
author: Katelynn L.

description: There is nothing fancy about this place - basic seating, simple cheap menu - that's it. The food is ok, but I have had better. If you are in the need for a quick burrito at nearly any hour of the day, this is a good place to go.
author: Victoria K.

description: Outside of the Mission, there's no better taqueria than Gordo's!  I love their super burritos, as they are hearty, yet cheap (less than $5).  My favorite is their carnitas, though their carne asada and been and cheese are awesome.  Can't go wrong with this Richmond district taqueria--even when I didn't live in the neighborhood, I'd trek out there for their burritos and salsa!
author: Marie B.

description: Cheap and yummy, great for a quick fix after work!  The quesedillas come sloppy if taken out, but tasty none-the-less.
author: Grant B.

description:
Fatty Taqueria..(Gordo means Fatty hehe) is one of my fast food greazy faves.   

I used to go to the one in Berkeley on college avenue everytime I needed a quesadilla or crispy taco.  SO GOOD.

They don't have much selection..not a lot of confusing salsas w/mango and stuff in it.   

This place is fried tortillas w/meat and that's it.
Greasy, crispy and OH SO GOOD.

The best things to have here are the chicken corn quesadillas.
I can never choose between boiled or grilled chicken.  They both have their own distinct flavor.  

They put the tortilla on the grill w/a big slob of cheese and let it crisp up.  After that..they slab on a big mound of chicken, add some garnish of salsa..wrap it up in wax paper and put it on a plastic mesh tray and hand it to you.   For 3-4 bucks!!!

Getting 2 of these crispy quesadillas plus a drink is a great fast food fav.   

I've never seen an empty Fatty's Taqueria in all it's locations.

As far as ambience...just some bench seats, a big single bathroom that makes for interesting stories that I'll leave out, and a LOT of bradman patrons who love grilled, fried..greasey food.   

This must be the closet haven for the Bradman patrons who masquerade as liking sushi or dimsum across the street w/their dainty yuppee girlfriends, and then run off in the late night to 
get their heavy greasy meat fix!   

They tear off their forced GAP blue button shirts and put on their oldest, dirtiest t-shirt and relive their single pasts!!  

I see those guys here ALL THE TIME...and they look like they're in hiding!!

OH and if you're a pretty girl...of the blonde persuasion....be prepared for the staff to give you looks of lust as they prepare your food.
Comes w/the territory.  =)
author: Michael L.

description: I can only give four stars - because my five star ratings are reserved for the truly outstanding.  However if it was at all possible... I would give this place four and a half stars.  I have never been disappointed here.  The burritos are immense and often serve as two meals.... and consequently two poops - yay poop!  One down side to this place is that they charge for chips and salsa... I have to say that's not very Mexican of them.  Every taqueria in my experience gives free chips and salsa... so I say that it seems a bit stingy, especially since their chips are nothing to brag about.
author: Sadie K.

description: couldn't be less impressed. I live in the area, and  I wonder if the people that make this 'barely-an-excuse-for-Mexican-food' are catering to the surrounding demographic...NOT as much to a person like myself who grew up on SDiego Mex food....This food was awful. Wait-staff was lame. How do you F up a quesadilla? answer: you don't melt the cheese sufficiently and have lame pico-de-gallo on/it it. didn't even finish it--couldn't justify the calories for lack of taste. Wow- I'm feeling testy today, eh? Anyway--best mexican food is in San Bruno...
author: Bing B.

description:
My backup Gordo's location when parking on Clement is impossible, which it usually is. Love it that there is two close by, and no need to travel to the mission for a fat, tasty burrito. 

This location has more seating, which is not hard since the other is more of a place to pickup a burrito and eat elsewhere. Bathroom too if you feel so inclined to drop that five pound burrito after you quickly inhaled it.
author: David B.

description: All I have to do is look at the guys behind the counter and realize that is what will happen to me if I eat here every day....nevertheless...it's OK in a pinch ...always happy to flirt with the boys in here - which is good for the ego at my age...
author: Sue U.

description: When I want something hardy and filling, burritos are the answer. This place is located on the busy street of Geary where parking is difficult. I recommend either walking or taking the bus here. The cost of parking is 25 cents for 10 minutes if you find parking. I usually get my burritos to go but there is a seating area if you wanted to eat in. I like the burritos here. I usually get a super burrito with everything on it. They steam the tortilla with a slice of cheese and then add the meat, beans, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, and some spicy sauce on top. They wrap it up and it's ready to go. I usually can't finish a whole burrito myself, so I eat now and save half for later. Sorry, no free chips on the side, they charge 55 cents for a small bag of chips.
author: Candace F.

description: I'll give it four stars for the carnitas tacos alone.  I stay away from the burritos.  I had initially written off gordos because I had only tried the burritos, which leave much to be desired.  I grew up in San Diego and use to live in Mexico, so I consider myself a pretty good judge of Mexican food.  And while I am well aware that burritos dont count as real Mexican food, there is still an art to a good burrito.  So, why the 4 stars? The carnitas tacos are pretty close to authentic - minus the beans and sour cream. It is possible that I have just been living in Northern California for too long (2 years now) and my highly refined taco taste buds have lowered their standards.  That being said, I still enjoy gordos carnitas tacos.
author: Maya S.

description:
I grew up in the avenues and OMG, I would seriously eat here 3 or 4 times a week.  Love the place

I dare say better than any burrito place in the Mission
author: Robert T.

description: Gordo's serves up one tasty burrito, for the Richmond that is.  Service is not the friendlist and they can be a bit slow.  Sometimes you have to tell them what you'd like two or three times.  When compared to the mission, Gordo's burritos are smaller and a bit more pricey.  Oh, and chips are extra-can you believe that!  In the end, I guess it is all worth it considering I live in the Richmond and it's the only taqueria around.
author: Monica L.

description: I like Gordos. Yeah, it might not be the most authentic Mexican burrito restaurant but I like their burritos.
author: Roger C.

description: I've been going to gordos for years! I usually get a burrito or quesidilla and its always good! Theirs different choices of wraps such as spinach, tomato, flower, or corn. I like their grilled chicken or carne asada meat. I also love the jarritos drinks. The same people have been working their for years, so sometimes they hook it up with extra meat or a free bag of chips.
author: Angela C.

description: One of the best burritos around. The Super Chicken never disappoints, my only complaint is these guys don't understand 'andale'. Rigamortis can set in before you get to order when its busy. Also, speaking of when its busy, good luck getting a seat.
author: AnonE M.

description: very average bland, burrito.  has all the right things going for it beans, rice normal option of meat, but some spice in the meat or something is definitely missing.  just tastes realllllly bland and i finish it feeling full, which is good.  it's cheap as well.  but chipotle's barbacoa burrito has 10 x the flavor with their lime cilantro rice, very well seasoned meat etc...
author: Ryan K.

description: I have a lot of good memories eating burritos with friends at Gordo's.  I don't know if it's just me, but they always pile on a little more fillings at this place over the other locations.  Although this place isn't exactly authentic (I've had some friends tell me that putting tortillas in steamers is sacrilege), I still find their burritos tasty and more than filling.  I also love the flour quesedillas, even though they really pour on the oil, the result is a crispy, flaky tortilla that tastes great with all that melted cheese.
author: Tony L.

description:
Ah Gordo's...back in the days when I was a teenager, before I had status and before I had a major...I first stumbled upon Gordo's on College Ave. while attending Cal.  I used to bitch to anyone that would listen that La Burrita was crap (and they would listen because I was from Santa Barbara), but Gordo's was tolerable.  I didn't even know they had multiple locations till a few years ago.
Fast forward a few years, and I've come to terms with the state of Mexican food away from the Mission and SB.  Gordo's is good.  Not as good as the taquerias in the Mission, but it's a good burrito that'll fill you up for not much money, plus I can walk to it in under 3 minutes when I'm really hungry.  One thing I have to say for Gordo's is that they're consistent, Gordo's on Geary is the same as Gordo's on College, Clement, etc.  Don't come here for their tacos or nachos, but take home a chicken burrito and have a cold Negro Modelo ready and you're set.
author: Mike U.

description: Stuck down on Geary Blvd.? Gordo is a decent and reliable taqueria. Decent because they have a simple selection of burritos, quesadillas, and gordo plates. Reliable because they're a reputable chain. Their Beef Quesadillas are a standout.
author: Leroid D.

description: It's not just that this place is 3 blocks from my new house but the food is simply the perfect comfort food for borrito lovers. The service could use a little personality and warmth but it's the food that really matters here. The line can be a little long at times but it's definately worth the wait and the prices are perfect.
author: Gabriel R.

description: The most reliable, affordable and satisfying burrito joint that you'll find in the Richmond (there really isn't much competition though, honestly.) Good portions and a no-frills eating experience, and at the very least it saves you the gas/bus fare/time of heading to the Mission to satisfy the craving for a burrito carb overload.
author: Ramon T.

description: I have a few SF native friends that love this place. I either went on a bad night or I really am just that cranky. I had the super burrito and it was wet, wet, wet. Yes it was the size of a small child but it drooled like one too. It was just to messy. I like my burritos wrapped up tight and packed with goodness. I'd much rather go to the Mission for a burrito. Maybe one day I will come here again and it will be a better day.
author: Alia D.

description: My favorite is a Pork-chile verde quesadilla with rice, salsa, guac and hot sauce!  Yummy!  I love their green hot sauce...it's spicy!  It's kinda hard to read the staff's mood, though.  I've been going there since they opened and some days they are friendly...mostly they aren't.
author: Marie E.

description: Pretty standard, but solid burrito from what I can recall. I'm a Mission burrito kind of girl, but the ex took me here ages ago, he's a local so I figured he knew a little somethin somethin about burritos. Nothing to write home about, since Philly doesn't know a burrito from a chilaquile.
author: Colleen B.

description: I walked into this place and I immediately knew that I was in for an unsatisfying meal.  I knew it was a chain ( i have nothing againts fast food chains) but my bf who is into cheap and filling cuisine thought this place was great the first time he ate here.  So of course he wanted to take me there.  Never again will I eat here....i had a super burrito and it was the biggest and blandest burrito i have ever had.  I can't believe they have the nerve to give you a large amount of awful food.
author: Maria B.

description: Delicious carnitas burritos, especially with the refried beans.  The other locations are rated okay...only because they don't carry the good stuff - the refried beans makes it tastier than ever!
author: Lisa C.

description: I ate a quesadilla there, which they bake. And if you don't mind it being a little oily and messy, then your in for a treat.  It literally melts in your mouth.  I crave their quesadilla's and would drive 20 minutes away just to have it.  Now I found out they have one on 9th Ave., and it cuts my drive in half.  I have to eat this place once, if I'm home for the weekend.  It is THAT good.
author: Peter K.

description:
i'm from san diego, and we take our burritos rather serious down there.  gordo's is not a san diego burrito spot, it's a bit different.  

they use fresh ingredients, and serve you up a fat burrito real fast. you walk out of there $7.00 less in your pocket but 1lb more in your stomach.
author: Ameer N.

description: Nothing really great; nothing really bad.  Its always crowded but I'm chalking that up to the fact that there aren't really any other burrito options out here.
author: Nora B.

description: Yeah, it's a solid burrito.  It's not the best, but I often crave it.  Gordo would get 4 stars for the burritos, but having to pay for add-ons is so annoying.  So...3 1/2.  But I take off a 1/2 star for the burrito dude always making us feel like we are imposing on his futbol watching.  Be friendly, bro - there are worse things than people throwing money at you to eat your food.
author: Louis M.

description: Gordo's is pretty friggin awesome! Fresh ingredients, tasted good and I didn't get mud butt. This make it 5 star mexican food!
author: Dan M.

description: I think it's a hit or miss sorta place. I've eaten it in the past in the Sunset as well as in Albany (?) and it wasn't bad. Big burritos, good quesadillas. But they may have gone down in quality.
author: Gina R.

description: ate there today. the beef is great! i have been going to gordo's since i was a kid. the quality hasn't changed. the prices haven't changed. the only difference now is the staff. not as friendly as they once were. Still go there twice a week at least. lol
author: Arthur S.

description: Definitely not the best Mexican in the city, but it meets my needs. Food was good and cheap, but simple.
author: Jen L.

description: Chicken super burrito hits the spot right after a good work out at the gym. I got free chips n guacamole and geez the service is great! I ordered my burrito in spanish and then one of the workers asked me why i had a cubano accent. ancestry rules when speaking spanish lol We had a good convo while i was waiting for my order. =]
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Let me tell you. This place is delicious. Absolutely yummy. I love when the burrito is juicy at the end. The sour cream and guacamole mix together with the beef and bean juices....delectable. 

However,

I was sick afterward. Like my stomach hurts sick. Ay Gordito, why did you have to ruin a good thing with bacteria issues?
author: Niya M.

description: This is an institution in SF. When I was a in Middle School we would go to Gordos and get a stake/rice/sour cream bowl. Wow, I don't think I could  hack that today, but what the heck. There Gordo Borritos are just that, FAT. They pack more into a tortia then I have ever seen. Gotta Love It.  I only wish it was more centrally located, with out a car this place is way out for those that live in the Mission or anywhere on this side of the Sunset.
author: Susannah M.

description: Best burrito for the price in the city.  Everyone I've taken here has gotten wide-eyed and overwhelmed with the goodness that is the super carnitas.
author: John R.

description: A major part of burrito consumption is the food coma. Any good burro should be large enough to induce a catatonic state in an ex-NFL lineman. Guess ol' Gordo hasn't heard of that because all that happened here was I got pissed since I left hungry after plunking down 6 pesos. The personnel department should also be notified that it doesn't take four people on the assembly line, especially to shit together some wack-ass food.
author: Robert K.

description: Gordo is not the best taqueria in SF but it is certainly one of the better spots outside of the Mission and is, in my experience, the best in the Richmond (that's not saying a whole lot though!).  I end up here at least once a week because I live nearby. What the food lacks in overall taste it makes up with in consistency.  The prices are reasonable and the menu is pretty flexible.  There are the usual meat choices (a bonus is that they will let you do half one meat half another), three bean choices, and wheat or spinach tortilla choices.  One tip: ask for jalapenos.  It's not on the menu but for an extra 25cents, it adds a nice kick.
author: Rishi K.

description:
I love their burritos-its tasty and fresh.  

the line sometimes gets long but it moves quickly.  I'm sure there are other places that are better but none more convenient and affordable.
author: kenny l.
