description: Definitely not what I expected from a taqueria anywhere in San Francisco, but this is the Richmond.  That being said, the food is OK.  I like there salsa.  The hot is hot, not at first, but it kind of creeps.  I've had the veggie burrito many times, (I'm in the area and hungry often...).  It is almost the only choice for mexican food in this part of town, so if you're craving, make due.  Sometimes I'm actually craving mediocre mexican food, something comforting about it, and I go here.  Sound weird?  The service has jumped back and forth for me, sometimes treated well, sometimes just the opposite.  They do have extremely busy lunchtime rushes though, so I never take it personally, I'd probably want to escape too after that kind of rush.
author: Jayson J.

description:
I live a few blocks from Gordo on Geary and have been eating there for about 5-6 years. The ONLY reason I go is a. I love taquerias and b. It's the only game in town (walking distance, that is).

Deep down, as I munch away on my 2nd or 3rd burrito or quesadilla that week, I can't help but get angry. After patronizing the same place for as long as that, not one employee evinces a spark of recognition or memory for me or what I almost always order. My roommate thinks I'm nuts for even noticing, but I guess his expectations are lower. Actually, it's not even that I have high expectations. I'm actually shocked. 

It seems to me that as an employee you would have to go out of your way to pretend you haven't seen the same customer come in time and time again. So really, maybe I'm more shocked, even impressed that they could carry on this thing for this long. 

As to a previous review, I'm glad I don't speak Spanish.

As a guide to the uninitiated, here's a sample dialogue for ordering at Gordo:

Worker: Help you.
Me: Hi, could I get a super carne asada with black beans and hot sauce, no guacamole to go?
W: No response, but steams tortilla for a few seconds
W: What kind beans?
M: Uhh, black.
W: What kind meat?
M: I want a super carne asada with black beans and hot sauce, no guacamole to go.
W: Hot sauce?
M: YES.
W: Sour cream and guacamole?
M: No guacamole.
W: For here or to go?
M: !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is no exaggeration. Lest you think I'm being harsh, THIS IS THE SAME DIALOGUE I'VE HAD WITH EVERY EMPLOYEE FOR MORE THAN HALF A DECADE. That goes for other locations as well except for the Clement Gordo's.

In closing, it drives me nuts and I wish a Mission taqueria would come in and shut Gordo down.
author: Joe C.

description: BIG TASTY BURRITOS!!! Stuffed very full - good deal!
author: Iain B.

description: Simply the best burritos in the Bay Area.  I got into the Gordo habit while in medical school at UCSF, when I went there 3-5 times per week for their super bean and cheese burritos.  I have moved to the suburbs, but still go out of my way to visit Gordo whenever I am within a 5 mile radius in San Francisco or Berkeley.
author: Thomas T.

description: The burritos here are excellent.  My BF and I go here about once a week and it feeds us enough to the point where you have to do the unbuttoned pants trick.  The portions are hefty.  Only thing that makes me wonder is why the amount is always something different, but either way that should stop you from getting a bohemeth burrito.
author: Diana T.

description: i love their quesadillas! its the best i've had so far. their burritos are pretty good too! try it with the spinach tortilla. it taste even better.
author: B B.

description:
the one thing i like about this place is that everything is pretty filling for under $5. 

you can get tacos, quesadillas, burritos, super burritos, and gordo plates (basically do it yourself tacos on a tray) 

chicken, beef, chili verde (i don't know what this is), carnitas (shredded pork), i don't remember the other fillings....

this place is TOTALLY NOT 5 star good eats. its your standard burrito. probably like a chipotle burrito, but not as gringo'ed out. i've gotta admit that the fill ins were not very extensive as far as salsa goes. pretty basic, rice, black or refried beans, couple slices of cheese, and like pico de gallo kind of salsa. it was hard to see the other condiments b/c that tortilla warmer press thing is blocking it, and the people that work there aren't very clear when they speak. they kind of mumble under the noise of the kitchen (unless i've grown deaf from going to too many concerts but i had to ask the guy to repeat himself over and over, sometimes i wouldn't here him, and kind of stood there blankly when he said something.... he must have thought i was annoying... but i seriously couldn't hear him....), but i was pretty disappointed with my NO GLOVE WEARING WIPING COUNTER WITH DIRTY RAG HAND WRAPPED burrito. 

its pretty standard for places like these to give you chips and salsa with your purchase.... even just a little. but NOPE you don't get freebies like that from here... unless you eat there often, WHICH I DON'T PLAN ON.... unless i was REALLY jonesin for a burrito at like 9pm, in that hood. 

oh yeah, one last thing, i asked for some hot sauce, and the guy at the front counter took it out of a squeeze bottle that was refrigerated, it was this green olive color, but it was good homemade hot sauce. that was probably the highlight of my meal. its basically like pureed jalepenos. GOOD STUFF. even tho i was looking for more of a tabasco, tapatio, chalua type hot sauce. 

i think dos pinas in soma is better than here.....
author: Irene C.

description: So far, it's the cheapest place where I can get good burritos. The super grilled chicken burrito is my favorite. Good prices, good food, and good atmosphere.
author: A R.

description: Well, I'll just tell you what happened. So... I called in my order because I had to be at work shortly. They tell me it will be ready in 10 minutes. I'm there in about 15, and they tell me they don't have my order they can't find it. I'm like ok, it's a veggie super burrito... I start to tell them what it was so maybe it will help them track it down. The woman is obviously not actually listening, and she tells me that she can make me another one. I tell her, "no thanks, I don't have time to wait, which is why I called it in in the first place". Then, she says, "oh here it is", and rings it up. i grab it and go, get to work soo hungry, start to eat and i discover that all that is in it is beans, rice and cheese. obviously NOT even close to being a super burrito. i can't leave work to go back, can't find the receipt to see what she charged me but I remember it was over 6 bucks (waay to much for beans, rice, and cheese). totally sucked. i have tried gordo's before and wasn't very impressed, but this just sealed it for me. not to mention, they think they're so cool that they can charge for chips and salsa. lame. they're a waste of money, didn't taste very good, and have horrible customer service. booooooo
author: C. S.

description: I grew up on Gordo's burritos, mostly at the 9th Ave. location. I've come back to them, but recently everything's been underseasoned and often not hot enough.
author: Matt G.

description: me and my folks have been coming to gordos for years, so this review may be a bit biased. we loves it. every time friends come back to town, this is the spot. the prices are decent and the food is great. the chips aren't all that. one thing to take into consideration is who you order from, try to get the old dudes with the hats, they'll make a phatty burrito. The big dude makes em skimp, i think he sneaks food home in his chin flaps. I'm just speculating so don't quote me on that one. Oh and good luck with parking, you're gonna need it!
author: buddy p.

description: tasty but sort of boring.  the chicken in my burrito wasn't spiced all that well and the balance of rice to beans to chicken wasn't all that great....
author: Lauren V.

description: ive been here twice, and the first time the place smelled like a gas station bathroom, and the next time we actually ate there and it just wasnt up to par. for all the praise i'd heard about it, it really didnt live up to the hype. sorry gordo, running out of hot sauce is just not ok with me.
author: Sarah C.

description: i used to eat gordos on solano when i lived in albany.  the menu and recipes are the same whichever one you go to.  i love it.
author: yayoi s.

description: AMAZING! Best place in the city for tasty, affordable, huge portions of Mexian food. My fave is the gut-busting super burrito, but anything on the menu is a good bet! I used to live in the neighborhood, gut even now that I live accross the city, I still venture into the Richmond to experience the magic that is a Gordo burrito on a regular basis! Highly recommend it!
author: Edwin M.

description:
decent food--but man, they are CHEAP. 

when you order their food, they will SKIMP on the meat. off the menu, you can order a "gordo cup," which is basically all the stuff they put in a burrito, but just watch them, they will put like 3 small pieces of meat in it. if you complain and ask for more, they will charge you an extra $1.50 for more meat, when the gordo cup itself costs $1.75.


DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY here. seriously.
author: Nathaniel L.

description: first time i came here, the guys were really sweet (they too called me a bonita) and i had a really delicious burrito.  mmmm fresh flavorful beef with some extra spicy salsa.  however, the second time i came with my bf, the service was really bad and the burrito was sloppy and not too appetizing.  overall service is poor in my opinion but the burritos are definitely craveable.
author: Amanda N.

description: i would walk across hot coals for this burritto. i eat burrittos every single place i go and this is by far the best place on earth. thank you gordo's every single day
author: Annie W.

description: no frills here. simple, cheap and good. just right for a burrito fix in the Richmond.
author: n m.

description: I was an idiot for going to pancho's from my apartment for all this time. Granted I really enjoy panchos, but gordo taqueria is sooooo much closer. Pro's about this place. The price, these burritos are dirt cheap, and there's nothing better than a burrito that  you pay very little for that fills you up...  Their carnitas are money, I don't think I've had anything else (and you can almost never go wrong with carnitas!). I have only a three minor complaints with this place. First, the way they wrap the burritos... Super loose! I personally prefer a burrito that maintains its integrity/form. When eating one of these badboys, it just feels like your stuffing your face down the sucker in order to prevent a meat/veggie spillover. Second, they kind of skimp on the meat, I'd advice asking for more. Finally, there's no salsa bar. I love being able to choose what kind of salsa to put on my burrito etc etc, i know i trust the guys making the burrito, but i love being able to put some more on when I feel like it...  Anyhow, the service is great and fast, and if your hungry and in the neighborhood, stop by!
author: Cameron R.

description: white man's burrito. plain, simple, fast...if that's what you want, that's what you'll get. if you want real mexican food, go to the mission.
author: selma s.

description: I find the burritos here to be pretty bland & tasteless compared to burritos in other parts of the city.  Place is clean and you will not get sick.
author: JERRY D.

description: a lot of people built this place up for me, so i had high expectations. i ordered the carnitas tacos and the meat was pretty tough to chew. and there was so much sour cream i could barely taste the taco. next time i'll get a burrito.
author: N. M.

description: i was going to put 3 stars, but it gets an extra one for being in the outer richmond and by my house; like comments below, it's a long trek into the mish for a good burrito, so gordo's does the trick. their menu is TINY (pretty much, tacos, burritos, or like 5 dinner plates), and i was surprised that not "everything" is included in the burrito (sour cream, guac, salsa et al). i got a super burrito with carnitas (pork, on recommendation from the roomie), black beans, rice, sour cream and salsa. that salsa is pretty much like crack, very savory and chunky. i agree with nicole below, at 50 cents per extra addition, it was a little annoying, AND they don't even have agua frescas. what the hell!! but they do carry jarrito's, which is a plus, and it did the trick on satisfying my hunger. portions are a fairly large size, too. it's not the best of places, but i can think of worser places (balazo, i am looking at you).
author: Jenz y.

description: i'm a native and i cant agree that this is the best burrito in town, but it is damned good. i've been going to this location of gordo's since it opened i think back in the early 90's. the food is consistent and the service is always the same, pretty fast although kinda no frills.
author: A G.

description: I've been going to Gordo's almost since it first opened and I have to say I've finally had enough of the surly service and, frankly, really bad attitude of the people who work behind the counter. I frequent the Geary Blvd location as I live just around the corner and have lost count of how many times I've been infuriated by the rudeness and arrogance of the servers, to say nothing of the number of times the server gets my order wrong or disregards my requests altogether. Then there are the numerous times I've been overcharged. There's a particularly hauty fat guy who seems to think he's doing his customers a favor by deigning to serve them. I'm sorry, Gordo's food is not good enough to justify my returning. I see I'm not the only one who's complained about this. Clearly, Gordo's is doing great business, lousy service or not. Nonetheless, it's lost mine and I'll encourage anyone who cares to listen, not to frequent Gordo's in future.
author: Leo B.
